[pagebreak]

Varieties of Faith in the Empire by Brother Mikhael Karkuxor of the Imperial College

[pagebreak]

his is my best attempt at a listing of the pantheons and associated divine spirits of Tamriel's dominant cultures. This list is by no means complete (the Imperial City of Cyrodiil alone boasts a vast host of saints and holy spirits). It only includes the most important spirits revered by native members of the culture. Other et'Ada, especially Daedra, are often familiar known to many cultures, though specific names are included here only when they possess a particular cultural significance. The omission of any reference to the worships of the Argonians of Black Marsh is a result of my complete inadequacy in reconciling the obscure and contradictory accounts available to me on that subject. THE EIGHT PANTHEONS CYRODIIL: Akatosh, Dibella, Arkay, Zenithar, Mara, Stendarr, Kynareth, Julianos, Shezarr, Tiber Septim, Morihaus, Reman SKYRIM: Alduin, Dibella, Orkey, Tsun, Mara, Stuhn, Kyne, Jhunal, Shor, Ysmir, Herma-Mora, Maloch ALTMER: Auri-El, Trinimac, Magnus, Syrabane, Y'ffre, Xarxes, Mara, Stendarr, Lorkhan, Phynaster BOSMER: Auri-El, Y'ffre, Arkay, Z'en, Xarxes, Baan Dar, Mara, Stendarr, Lorkhan, Herma-Mora, Jone, Jode DUNMER: Almalexia, Vivec, Sotha Sil, Boethiah, Mephala, Azura, Lorkhan, Nerevar, Molag Bal, Malacath, Sheogorath, Mehrunes Dagon YOKUDA: Satakal, Ruptga, Tu'whacca, Zeht, Morwha, Tava, Malooc, Diagna, Sep, HoonDing, Leki, Onsi, BRETONY: Akatosh, Magnus, Y'ffre, Dibella, Arkay, Zenithar, Mara, Stendarr, Kynareth, Julianos, Sheor, Phynaster ELSWEYR: Alkosh, Khenarthi, Riddle'Thar, ja-Kha'jay, Mara, S'rendarr, Lorkhaj, Rajhin, Baan Dar, Azurah, Sheggorath NOTES ON THE DIVINE SPIRITS OF THE PANTHEONS Akatosh (Dragon God of Time): Akatosh is the chief deity of the Nine Divines (the major religious cult of Cyrodiil and its provinces), and one of two deities found in every Tamrielic religion (the other is Lorkhan). He is generally considered to be the first of the Gods to form in the Beginning Place; after his establishment, other spirits found the process of being easier and the various pantheons of the world emerged. He is the ultimate God of the Cyrodilic Empire, where he embodies the qualities of endurance, invincibility, and everlasting legitimacy. Alduin (World Eater): Alduin is the Nordic variation of Akatosh, and only superficially resembles his counterpart in the Nine Divines. For example, Alduin's sobriquet, 'the world eater', comes from myths that depict him as the horrible, ravaging firestorm that destroyed the last world to begin this one. Nords therefore see the god of time as both creator and harbinger of the apocalypse. He is not the chief of the Nordic pantheon (in fact, that pantheon has no chief; see Shor, below) but its wellspring, albeit a grim and frightening one. Alkosh (Dragon King of Cats): Pre-ri'Datta Dynasty Anaquinine deity. A variation on the Altmeri Auri-El, and thus an Akatosh-as-culture-hero for the earliest Khajiiti. His worship was co-opted during the establishment of the Riddle-T'har, and he still enjoys immense popularity in Elsweyr's wasteland regions. He is depicted as a fearsome dragon, a creature the Khajiit say 'is just a real big cat'. He repelled an early Aldmeri pogrom of Pelinal Whitestrake during mythic times. Almalexia (Mother Morrowind): Most traces of Akatosh disappeared from ancient Chimer legends during their so-called 'exodus', primarily due to that god's association and esteem with the Altmeri. However, most aspects of Akatosh which seem so important to the mortal races, namely immortality, historicity, and genealogy, have conveniently resurfaced in Almalexia, the most popular of Morrowind's divine Tribunal. Arkay (God of the Cycle of Life and Death): Member of the Nine Divines pantheon, and popular elsewhere as well. Arkay is often more important in those cultures where his father, Akatosh, is either less related to time or where his time aspects are difficult to comprehend by the layman. He is the god of burials and funeral rites, and is sometimes associated with the seasons. His priests are staunch opponents of necromancy and all forms of the undead. It is said that Arkay did not exist before the world was created by the gods under Lorkhan's supervision/urging/trickery. Therefore, he is sometimes called the Mortals' God. Auri-El (King of the Aldmer): The Elven Akatosh is Auri-El. Auri-El is the soul of Anui-El, who, in turn, is the soul of Anu the Everything. He is the chief of most Aldmeri pantheons. Most Altmeri and Bosmeri claim direct descent from Auri-El. In his only known moment of weakness, he agreed to take his part in the creation of the mortal plane, that act which forever sundered the Elves from the spirit worlds of eternity. To make up for it, Auri-El led the original Aldmer against the armies of Lorkhan in mythic times, vanquishing that tyrant and establishing the first kingdoms of the Altmer, Altmora and Old Ehlnofey. He then ascended to heaven in full observance of his followers so that they might learn the steps needed to escape the mortal plane. Azura (Goddess of Dusk and Dawn): Azura was the god-ancestor that taught the Chimer the mysteries needed to be different than the Altmer. Some of her more conventional teachings are sometimes attributed to Boethiah. In the stories, Azura is often more a communal cosmic force for the race as a whole than an ancestor or a god. Also known as the Anticipation of Sotha Sil. In Elsweyr, Azurah is nearly a wholly separate entity, yet she is still tied into the origins of Khajiiti out of Altmeri stock. Baan Dar (The Bandit God): In most regions, Baan Dar is a marginal diety, a trickster spirit of thieves and beggars. In Elsweyr he is more important, and is regarded as the Pariah. In this aspect, Baan Dar becomes the cleverness or desperate genius of the long-suffering Khajiit, whose last minute plans always upset the machinations of their (Elven or Human) enemies. Boethiah (Prince of Plots): Heralded by the Prophet Veloth, Boethiah is the original god-ancestor of the Dark Elves. Through his illuminations, the eventual 'Chimer', or Changed Folk, renounced all ties to the Aldmer and founded a new nation based on Daedric principles. All manner of Dark Elven cultural 'advances' are attributed to Boethiah, from philosophy to magic to 'responsible' architecture. Ancient Velothi allegories are uniformly heroic successes of Boethiah over enemies of every type, foundation stories of Chimeri struggle. Also known as the Anticipation of Almalexia. Diagna (Orichalc God of the Sideways Blade): Hoary thuggish cult of the Redguards. Originated in Yokuda during the Twenty Seven Snake Folk Slaughter. Diagna was an avatar of the HoonDing (the Yokudan God of Make Way, see below) that achieved permanence. He was instrumental to the defeat of the Lefthanded Elves, as he brought orichalc weapons to the Yokudan people to win the fight. In Tamriel, he led a very tight knit group of followers against the Orcs of Orsinium during the height of their ancient power, but then faded into obscurity. He is now little more than a local power spirit of the Dragontail mountains. Dibella (Goddess of Beauty): Popular god of the Nine Divines. In Cyrodiil, she has nearly a dozen different cults, some devoted to women, some to artists and aesthetics, and others to erotic instruction. Herma-Mora (The Woodland Man): Ancient Atmoran demon who, at one time, nearly seduced the Nords into becoming Aldmer. Most Ysgramor myths are about escaping the wiles of old Herma-Mora. Also called the Demon of Knowledge, he is vaguely related to the cult origins of the Morag Tong ('Foresters Guild'), if only by association with his brother/sister, Mephala. HoonDing (The Make Way God): Yokudan spirit of 'perseverance over infidels'. The HoonDing has historically materialized whenever the Redguards need to 'make way' for their people. In Tamrielic history this has only happened three times -- twice in the first era during the Ra Gada invasion and once during the Tiber War. In this last incarnation, the HoonDing was said to have been either a sword or a crown, or both. Jhunal (Rune God): The Nordic god of hermetic orders. After falling out of favor with the rest of that pantheon, he became Julianos of the Nine Divines. He is absent in modern Skyrim mythology. Jode (Big Moon God): Aldmeri god of the Big Moon. Also called Masser or Mara's Tear. In Khajiti religion, Jode is only one aspect of the Lunar Lattice, or ja-Kha'jay. Jone (Little Moon God): Aldmeri god of the Little Moon. Also called Secunda or Stendarr's Sorrow. In Khajiti religion, Jone is only one aspect of the Lunar Lattice, or ja-Kha'jay. Julianos (God of Wisdom and Logic): Often associated with Jhunal, the Nordic father of language and mathematics, Julianos is the Cyrodilic god of literature, law, history, and contradiction. Monastic orders founded by Tiber Septim and dedicated to Julianos are the keepers of the Elder Scrolls. Kyne (Kiss At the End): Nordic Goddess of the Storm. Widow of Shor and favored god of warriors. She is often called the Mother of Men. Her daughters taught the first Nords the use of the thu'um, or Storm Voice. Kynareth (Goddess of Air): Kynareth is a member of the Nine Divines, the strongest of the Sky spirits. In some legends, she is the first to agree to Lorkhan's plan to invent the mortal plane, and provides the space for its creation in the void. She is also associated with rain, a phenomenon said not to occur before the removal of Lorkhan's divine spark. Leki (Saint of the Spirit Sword): Goddess daughter of Tall Papa, Leki is the goddess of aberrant swordsmanship. The Na-Totambu of Yokuda warred to a standstill during the mythic era to decide who would lead the charge against the Lefthanded Elves. Their swordmasters, though, were so skilled in the Best Known Cuts as to be matched evenly. Leki introduced the Ephemeral Feint. Afterwards, a victor emerged and the war with the Aldmer began. Lorkhan (The Missing God): This Creator-Trickster-Tester deity is in every Tamrielic mythic tradition. His most popular name is the Aldmeri 'Lorkhan', or Doom Drum. He convinced or contrived the Original Spirits to bring about the creation of the mortal plane, upsetting the status quo -- much like his father Padomay had introduced instability into the universe in the Beginning Place. After the world is materialized, Lorkhan is separated from his divine center, sometimes involuntarily, and wanders the creation of the et'Ada. He and his metaphysical placement in the 'scheme of things' is interpreted a variety of ways. In Morrowind, for example, he is a being related to the Psijiic Endeavor, a process by which mortals are charged with transcending the gods that created them. To the High Elves, he is the most unholy of all higher powers, as he forever broke their connection to the spirit plane. In the legends, he is almost always an enemy of the Aldmer and, therefore, a hero of early Mankind. Lorkhaj (Moon Beast): Pre-ri'Datta Dynasty Anaquinine deity, easily identified with the Missing God, Lorkhan. Magnus (Magus): The god of sorcery, Magnus withdrew from the creation of the world at the last second, though it cost him dearly. What is left of him on the world is felt and controlled by mortals as magic. One story says that, while the idea was thought up by Lorkhan, it was Magnus who created the schematics and diagrams needed to construct the mortal plane. He is sometimes represented by an astrolabe, a telescope, or, more commonly, a staff. Cyrodilic legends say he can inhabit the bodies of powerful magicians and lend them his power. Associated with Zurin Arctus, the Underking. Malacath (God of Curses): Malacath is the reanimated dung that was Trinimac. A somewhat weak but vengeful Daedra, the Dark Elves say he is also Malak, the god-king of the orcs. He always tests the Dunmer for physical weakness. Malooc (Horde King): An enemy god of the Ra Gada. Led the goblins against the Redguards during the first era. Fled east when the army of the HoonDing overtook his goblin hordes. Mauloch (Malacath): An Orcish god, Mauloch troubled the heirs of King Harald for a long time. Fled east after his defeat at the Battle of Dragon Wall, ca. 1E660. His rage was said to fill the sky with his sulphurous hatred, later called the "Year of Winter in Summer". Mara (Goddess of Love): Nearly universal goddess. Origins started in mythic times as a fertility goddess. In Skyrim, Mara is a handmaiden of Kyne. In the Empire, she is Mother-Goddess. She is sometimes associated with Nir of the 'Anuad', the female principle of the cosmos that gave birth to creation. Depending on the religion, she is either married to Akatosh or Lorkhan, or the concubine of both. Mehrunes Dagon (God of Destruction): Popular Daedric power. He is associated with natural dangers like fire, earthquakes, and floods. In some cultures, though, Dagon is merely a god of bloodshed and betrayal. He is an especially important deity in Morrowind, where he represents its near-inhospitable terrain. Mephala (Androgyne): Mephala is the Webspinner, or the Spider God. In Morrowind, he/she was the ancestor that taught the Chimer the skills they would need to evade their enemies or to kill them with secret murder. Enemies were numerous in those days since the Chimer were a small faction. He/she, along with Boethiah, organized the clan systems that eventually became the basis for the Great Houses. He/she founded the Morag Tong. Also called the Anticipation of Vivec. Molag Bal (God of Schemes, King of Rape): Daedric power of much importance in Morrowind. There, he is always the archenemy of Boethiah, the Prince of Plots. He is the main source of the obstacles to the Dunmer (and preceding Chimer) people. In the legends, Molag Bal always tries to upset the bloodlines of Houses or otherwise ruin Dunmeri 'purity'. A race of supermonsters, said to live in Molag Amur, are the result of his seduction of Vivec during the previous era. Morihaus (First Breath of Man): Ancient cultural hero god of the Cyro-Nordics. Legend portrays him as the Taker of the Citadel, an act of mythic times that established Human control over the Valley Heartland. He is often associated with the Nordic powers of thu'um, and therefore with Kynareth. Morwha (Teat God): Yokudan fertility goddess. Fundamental deity in the Yokudan pantheon, and the favorite of Tall Papa's wives. Still worshipped in various areas of Hammerfell, including Stros M'kai. Morwha is always portrayed as four-armed, so that she can 'grab more husbands'. Nerevar (Godkiller): The Chimeri king of Resdayn, the Golden Age of old Veloth. Slain during the Battle of Red Mountain, Nerevar was the Herald of the Triune Way, and is the foremost of the saints of Dunmeri faith. He is said to have killed Dumac, the Last Dwarven King, and feasted on his heart. Onsi (Boneshaver): Notable warrior god of the Yokudan Ra Gada, Onsi taught Mankind how to pull their knives into swords. Orkey (Old Knocker): A loan-god of the Nords, who seem to have taken up his worship during Aldmeri rule of Atmora. Nords believe they once lived as long as Elves until Orkey appeared; through heathen trickery, he fooled them into a bargain that 'bound them to the count of winters'. At one time, legends say, Nords only had a lifespan of six years due to Orkey's foul magic. Shor showed up, though, and, through unknown means, removed the curse, throwing most of it onto the nearby Orcs. Phynaster: Hero-god of the Summerset Isles, who taught the Altmer how to naturally live another hundred years by using a shorter walking stride. Rajhin (Footpad): Thief god of the Khajiiti, who grew up in the Black Kiergo section of Senchal. The most famous burglar in Elsweyr's history, Rajhin is said to have stolen a tattoo from the neck of Empress Kintyra as she slept. Reman (The Cyrodiil): Culture god-hero of the Second Empire, Reman was the greatest hero of the Akaviri Trouble. Indeed, he convinced the invaders to help him build his own empire, and conquered all of Tamriel except for Morrowind. He instituted the rites of becoming Emperor, which included the ritual geas to the Amulet of Kings, a soulgem of immense power. His Dynasty was ended by the Dunmeri Morag Tong at the end of the first era. Also called the Worldly God. Riddle'Thar (Two-Moons Dance): The cosmic order deity of the Khajiiti, the Riddle'Thar was revealed to Elsweyr by the prophet Rid-Thar-ri'Datta, the Mane. The Riddle'Thar is more a set of guidelines by which to live than a single entity, but some of his avatars like to appear as humble messengers of the gods. Also known as the Sugar God. Ruptga (Tall Papa): Chief deity of the Yokudan pantheon. Ruptga, more commonly 'Tall Papa', was the first god to figure out how to survive the Hunger of Satakal. Following his lead, the other gods learned the 'Walkabout', or a process by which they can persist beyond one lifetime. Tall Papa set the stars in the sky to show lesser spirits how to do this, too. When there were too many spirits to keep track of, though, Ruptga created a helper out the dead skin of past worlds. This helper is Sep (see below), who later creates the world of mortals. Satakal (The Worldskin): Yokudan god of everything. A fusion of the concepts of Anu and Padomay. Basically, Satakal is much like the Nordic Alduin, who destroys one world to begin the next. In Yokudan mythology, Satakal had done (and still does) this many times over, a cycle which prompted the birth of spirits that could survive the transition. These spirits ultimately become the Yokudan pantheon. Popular god of the Alik'r nomads. Sheogorath (The Mad God): The fearful obeisance of Sheogorath is widespread, and is found in most Tamrielic quarters. Contemporary sources indicate that his roots are in Aldmeri creation stories; therein, he is 'born' when Lorkhan's divine spark is removed. One crucial myth calls him the 'Sithis-shaped hole' of the world. Sheor (Bad Man): In Bretony, the Bad Man is the source of all strife. He seems to have started as the god of crop failure, but most modern theologians agree that he is a demonized version of the Nordic Shor, born during the dark years after the fall of Saarthal. Sep (The Snake): Yokudan version of Lorkhan. Sep is born when Tall Papa creates someone to help him regulate the spirit trade. Sep, though, is driven crazy by the hunger of Satakal, and he convinces some of the gods to help him make an easier alternative to the Walkabout. This, of course, is the world as we know it, and the spirits who followed Sep become trapped here, to live out their lives as mortals. Sep is punished by Tall Papa for his transgressions, but his hunger lives on as a void in the stars, a 'non-space' that tries to upset mortal entry into the Far Shores. Shezarr (God of Man): Cyrodilic version of Lorkhan, whose importance suffers when Akatosh comes to the fore of Imperial (really, Alessian) religion. Shezarr was the spirit behind all human undertaking, especially against Aldmeri aggression. He is sometimes associated with the founding of the first Cyrodilic battlemages. In the present age of racial tolerance, Shezarr is all but forgotten. Shor (God of the Underworld): Nordic version of Lorkhan, who takes sides with Men after the creation of the world. Foreign gods (i.e., Elven ones) conspire against him and bring about his defeat, dooming him to the underworld. Atmoran myths depict him as a bloodthirsty warrior king who leads the Nords to victory over their Aldmeri oppressors time and again. Before his doom, Shor was the chief of the gods. Sometimes also called Children's God (see Orkey, above). Sotha Sil (Mystery of Morrowind): God of the Dunmer, Sotha Sil is the least known of the divine Tribunal. He is said to be reshaping the world from his hidden, clockwork city. Stendarr (God of Mercy): God of the Nine Divines, Stendarr has evolved from his Nordic origins into a deity of compassion or, sometimes, righteous rule. He is said to have accompanied Tiber Septim in his later years. In early Altmeri legends, Stendarr is the apologist of Men. Stuhn (God of Ransom): Nordic precursor to Stendarr, brother of Tsun. Shield-thane of Shor, Stuhn was a warrior god that fought against the Aldmeri pantheon. He showed Men how to take, and the benefits of taking, prisoners of war. Syrabane (Warlock's God): An Aldmeri god-ancestor of magic, Syrabane aided Bendu Olo in the Fall of the Sload. Through judicious use of his magical ring, Syrabane saved many from the scourge of the Thrassian Plague. He is also called the Apprentices' God, for he is a favorite of the younger members of the Mages Guild. Tava (Bird God): Yokudan spirit of the air. Tava is most famous for leading the Yokudans to the isle of Herne after the destruction of their homeland. She has since become assimilated into the mythology of Kynareth. She is still very popular in Hammerfell among sailors, and her shrines can be found in most port cities. Tiber Septim (Talos, the Dragonborn): Heir to the Seat of Sundered Kings, Tiber Septim is the most important hero-god of Mankind. He conquered all of Tamriel and ushered in the Third Era (and the Third Empire). Also called Ysmir, 'Dragon of the North'. Trinimac: Strong god of the early Aldmer, in some places more popular than Auri-El. He was a warrior spirit of the original Elven tribes that led armies against the Men. Boethiah is said to have assumed his shape (in some stories, he even eats Trinimac) so that he could convince a throng of Aldmer to listen to him, which led to their eventual Chimeri conversion. He vanishes from the mythic stage after this, to return as the dread Malacath (Altmeri propaganda portrays this as the dangers of Dunmeri influence). Tsun: Extinct Nordic god of trials against adversity. Died defending Shor from foreign gods. Tu'whacca (Tricky God): Yokudan god of souls. Tu'whacca, before the creation of the world, was the god of Nobody Really Cares. When Tall Papa undertook the creation of the Walkabout, Tu'whacca found a purpose; he became the caretaker of the Far Shores, and continues to help Redguards find their way into the afterlife. His cult is sometimes associated with Arkay in the more cosmopolitan regions of Hammerfell. Vivec (Master of Morrowind): Warrior-poet god of the Dunmer. Vivec is the invisible keeper of the holy land, ever vigilant against the dark gods of the Volcano. He/she has saved the Dunmeri people from certain death on numerous occasions, most notably when he/she taught them how to breathe water for a day so that he/she could flood Morrowind and kill the Akaviri invaders, ca. 2E572. Xarxes: Xarxes is the god of ancestry and secret knowledge. He began as a scribe to Auri-El, and has kept track of all Aldmeri accomplishments, large and small, since the beginning of time. He created his wife, Oghma, from his favorite moments in history. Y'ffre (God of the Forest): Most important deity of the Bosmeri pantheon. While Auri-El Time Dragon might be the king of the gods, the Bosmer revere Y'ffre as the spirit of 'the now'. According to the Wood Elves, after the creation of the mortal plane everything was in chaos. The first mortals were turning into plants and animals and back again. Then Y'ffre transformed himself into the first of the Ehlnofey, or 'Earth Bones'. After these laws of nature were established, mortals had a semblance of safety in the new world, because they could finally understand it. Y'ffre is sometimes called the Storyteller, for the lessons he taught the first Bosmer. Some Bosmer still possess the knowledge of the chaos times, which they can use to great effect (the Wild Hunt). Ysmir (Dragon of the North): The Nordic aspect of Talos. He withstood the power of the Greybeards' voices long enough to hear their prophecy. Later, many Nords could not look on him without seeing a dragon. Z'en (God of Toil): Bosmeri god of payment in kind. Studies indicate origins in both Argonian and Akaviri mythologies, perhaps introduced into Valenwood by Kothringi sailors. Ostensibly an agriculture deity, Z'en sometimes proves to be an entity of a much higher cosmic order. His worship died out shortly after the Knhaten Flu. Zeht (God of Farms): Yokudan god of agriculture. Renounced his father after the world was created, which is why Tall Papa makes it so hard to grow food. Zenithar (God of Work and Commerce, Trader God): Member of the Nine Divines, Zenithar is understandably associated with Z'en. In the Empire, however, he is a far more cultivated god of merchants and middle nobility. His worshippers say, despite his mysterious origins, Zenithar is the god 'that will always win'.
String.Dest:
[pagebreak]

Varieties of Faith in the Empire oleh Brother Mikhael Karkuxor dari Imperial College

[pagebreak]

ini adalah usaha terbaik saya dalam membuat daftar pantheon dan roh ilahi yang terkait dengan budaya dominan Tamriel. Daftar ini sama sekali tidak lengkap (Kota Imperial Cyrodiil saja memiliki banyak sekali santo dan roh suci). Daftar ini hanya mencakup roh-roh terpenting yang dihormati oleh anggota asli budaya tersebut. Et'Ada lain, khususnya Daedra, sering dikenal di banyak budaya, namun nama spesifik hanya dimasukkan di sini bila memiliki kepentingan budaya tertentu. Penghilangan referensi apa pun tentang penyembahan Argonian di Black Marsh disebabkan oleh ketidakmampuan saya yang total dalam menyatukan catatan yang samar dan kontradiktif yang tersedia bagi saya mengenai hal itu. DELAPAN PANTHEON CYRODIIL: Akatosh, Dibella, Arkay, Zenithar, Mara, Stendarr, Kynareth, Julianos, Shezarr, Tiber Septim, Morihaus, Reman SKYRIM: Alduin, Dibella, Orkey, Tsun, Mara, Stuhn, Kyne, Jhunal, Shor, Ysmir, Herma-Mora, Maloch Altmer: Auri-El, Trinimac, Magnus, Syrabane, Y'ffre, Xarxes, Mara, Stendarr, Lorkhan, Phynaster Bosmer: Auri-El, Y'ffre, Arkay, Z'en, Xarxes, Baan Dar, Mara, Stendarr, Lorkhan, Herma-Mora, Jone, Jode Dunmer: Almalexia, Vivec, Sotha Sil, Boethiah, Mephala, Azura, Lorkhan, Nerevar, Molag Bal, Malacath, Sheogorath, Mehrunes Dagon YOKUDA: Satakal, Ruptga, Tu'whacca, Zeht, Morwha, Tava, Malooc, Diagna, Sep, HoonDing, Leki, Onsi, BRETONY: Akatosh, Magnus, Y'ffre, Dibella, Arkay, Zenithar, Mara, Stendarr, Kynareth, Julianos, Sheor, Phynaster ELSWEYR: Alkosh, Khenarthi, Riddle'Thar, ja-Kha'jay, Mara, S'rendarr, Lorkhaj, Rajhin, Baan Dar, Azurah, Sheggorath CATATAN TENTANG ROH ILAHI DARI PANTHEON Akatosh (Dewa Naga Waktu): Akatosh adalah dewa utama Dari Sembilan Dewa (kultus keagamaan utama Cyrodiil dan provinsinya), dan salah satu dari dua dewa yang ditemukan dalam setiap agama Tamriel (yang lainnya adalah Lorkhan). Ia umumnya dianggap sebagai dewa pertama yang terbentuk di Tempat Awal; setelah pendiriannya, roh-roh lain menemukan proses penciptaan lebih mudah dan berbagai pantheon dunia muncul. Ia adalah Dewa tertinggi Kekaisaran Cyrodilic, di mana ia mewujudkan sifat ketahanan, ketaklukan, dan legitimasi abadi. Alduin (Pemakan Dunia): Alduin adalah varian Nordik dari Akatosh, dan hanya secara dangkal mirip dengan rekanannya di Sembilan Dewa. Misalnya, julukan Alduin, 'pemakan dunia', berasal dari mitos yang menggambarkannya sebagai badai api mengerikan yang menghancurkan dunia terakhir sebelum memulai dunia ini. Oleh karena itu, Nord memandang dewa waktu sekaligus pencipta dan pertanda kiamat. Ia bukan pemimpin pantheon Nordik (nyatanya, pantheon itu tak memiliki pemimpin; lihat Shor, di bawah) melainkan sumbernya, meski kelam dan menakutkan. Alkosh (Raja Naga Kucing): Dewa dinasti Pre-ri'Datta Anaquinine. Varian dari Auri-El Altmeri, sehingga merupakan pahlawan budaya Akatosh bagi Khajiiti awal. Penyembahannya diambil alih ketika Riddle-T'har didirikan, dan ia masih sangat populer di tanah tandus Elsweyr Regions. Ia digambarkan sebagai naga yang menakutkan, makhluk yang Khajiit katakan 'hanya kucing besar yang sebenarnya'. Ia menolak pogrom Aldmeri awal terhadap Pelinal Whitestrake pada zaman mitos. Almalexia (Ibu Morrowind): Sebagian besar jejak Akatosh menghilang dari legenda Chimer kuno selama apa yang disebut 'ekskodus' mereka, terutama karena asosiasi dan penghormatan dewa tersebut kepada Altmeri. Namun, banyak aspek Akatosh yang tampak penting bagi mortal Races, yaitu keabadian, historisitas, dan genealoginya, muncul kembali secara menguntungkan dalam Almalexia, yang paling populer di Tribunal ilahi Morrowind. Arkay (Dewa Siklus Kehidupan dan Kematian): Anggota pantheon Sembilan Dewa, dan populer di tempat lain juga. Arkay sering menjadi lebih penting di budaya-budaya di mana ayahnya, Akatosh, kurang terkait dengan waktu atau aspek waktunya sulit dipahami orang awam. Ia adalah dewa pemakaman dan upacara pemakaman, kadang dikaitkan dengan musim. Pendetanya tegas menentang necromancy dan semua bentuk mayat hidup. Dikatakan bahwa Arkay tidak ada sebelum dunia diciptakan oleh para dewa di bawah pengawasan/pendorongan/kelicikan Lorkhan. Oleh karena itu, ia kadang disebut Dewa Mortal. Auri-El (Raja Aldmer): Akatosh Elf adalah Auri-El. Auri-El adalah jiwa Anui-El, yang pada gilirannya adalah jiwa Anu Sang Segalanya. Ia adalah pemimpin mayoritas pantheon Aldmeri. Sebagian besar Altmeri dan Bosmeri mengklaim keturunan langsung dari Auri-El. Pada satu-satunya momen kelemahan yang diketahui, ia menyetujui perannya dalam penciptaan bidang mortal, tindakan yang selamanya memisahkan Elf dari dunia roh keabadian. Untuk menebusnya, Auri-El memimpin Aldmer asli melawan pasukan Lorkhan pada masa mitos, menaklukkan tiran itu dan mendirikan kerajaan pertama Altmer, Altmora dan Old Ehlnofey. Ia kemudian naik ke surga sepenuhnya mematuhi Followersnya agar mereka dapat belajar langkah-langkah melarikan diri dari bidang mortal. Azura (Dewi Senja dan Fajar): Azura adalah nenek moyang dewa yang mengajarkan Chimer misteri yang diperlukan agar berbeda dari Altmer. Beberapa ajaran konvensionalnya kadang dikaitkan dengan Boethiah. Dalam cerita, Azura sering lebih merupakan kekuatan kosmik komunal bagi seluruh ras daripada seorang nenek atau dewa. Juga dikenal sebagai Antisipasi Sotha Sil. Di Elsweyr, Azurah hampir merupakan entitas terpisah sepenuhnya, namun masih terkait dengan asal usul Khajiiti dari keturunan Altmeri. Baan Dar (Dewa Bandit): Di sebagian besar Regions, Baan Dar adalah dewa marginal, roh penipu pencuri dan pengemis. Di Elsweyr ia lebih penting, dan dianggap sebagai Paria. Dalam aspek ini, Baan Dar menjadi kecerdikan atau kejeniusan desperado dari Khajiit yang lama menderita, yang rencananya di menit terakhir selalu mengacaukan taktik musuh mereka (Elf atau Manusia). Boethiah (Pangeran Intrik): Dihadirkan oleh Nabi Veloth, Boethiah adalah nenek dewa asli Dark Elf. Melalui iluminasinya, 'Chimer' akhirnya, atau Folk yang Berubah, memutuskan semua ikatan dengan Aldmer dan mendirikan negara baru berdasarkan prinsip Daedra. Semua 'kemajuan' budaya Dark Elf dikaitkan dengan Boethiah, mulai dari filsafat, sihir, hingga arsitektur 'bertanggung jawab'. Alegori Veloth kuno selalu menampilkan keberhasilan heroik Boethiah melawan musuh segala jenis, cerita dasar perjuangan Chimeri. Juga dikenal sebagai Antisipasi Almalexia. Diagna (Dewa Orichalc Pedang Samping): Kultus merah tua dari Redguard. Berasal di Yokuda selama Pembantaian Dua Puluh Tujuh Bangsa Ular. Diagna adalah avatar HoonDing (Dewa Yokudan Membuka Jalan, lihat di bawah) yang mencapai keabadian. Ia berperan penting dalam mengalahkan Elf Kidal, karena ia membawa senjata orichalc ke orang Yokudan untuk memenangkan pertempuran. Di Tamriel, ia memimpin kelompok Followers yang sangat rapat melawan Orc Orsinium pada puncak kekuatan kuno mereka, namun kemudian memudar menjadi tidak dikenal. Saat ini ia hampir hanya menjadi roh kekuatan lokal di pegunungan Dragontail. Dibella (Dewi Keindahan): Dewa populer Sembilan Dewa. Di Cyrodiil, ia memiliki hampir selusin kultus berbeda, ada yang didedikasikan untuk wanita, ada untuk seniman dan estetika, dan ada pula untuk ajaran erotis. Herma-Mora (Manusia Hutan): Iblis Atmoran kuno yang pada satu masa hampir menipu Nord menjadi Aldmer. Sebagian besar mitos Ysgramor tentang melarikan diri dari tipu muslihat Herma-Mora lama. Juga disebut Iblis Pengetahuan, ia kabur berhubungan dengan asal mula kultus Morag Tong ('Serikat Penjaga Hutan'), hanya karena hubungannya dengan saudara/saudari-nya, Mephala. HoonDing (Dewa Membuka Jalan): Roh Yokudan 'ketabahan atas kafir'. HoonDing secara historis muncul setiap kali Redguard perlu 'membuka jalan' bagi bangsa mereka. Dalam sejarah Tamrielik, hal ini hanya terjadi tiga kali — dua kali di era pertama selama invasi Ra Gada dan sekali selama Perang Tiber. Pada inkarnasi terakhir, HoonDing dikatakan berupa pedang atau mahkota, atau keduanya. Jhunal (Dewa Rune): Dewa Nordik ordo hermetik. Setelah jatuh tidak disukai oleh pantheon lainnya, ia menjadi Julianos dari Sembilan Dewa. Ia tidak ada dalam mitologi Skyrim modern. Jode (Dewa Bulan Besar): Dewa Aldmeri Bulan Besar. Juga disebut Masser atau Air Mata Mara. Dalam agama Khajiiti, Jode hanyalah satu aspek dari Jaring Lunar, atau ja-Kha'jay. Jone (Dewa Bulan Kecil): Dewa Aldmeri Bulan Kecil. Juga disebut Secunda atau Duka Stendarr. Dalam agama Khajiiti, Jone hanyalah satu aspek dari Jaring Lunar, atau ja-Kha'jay. Julianos (Dewa Kebijaksanaan dan Logika): Sering dikaitkan dengan Jhunal, ayah Nordik bahasa dan matematika, Julianos adalah dewa Cyrodilic literatur, hukum, sejarah, dan kontradiksi. Ordo monastik yang didirikan oleh Tiber Septim dan didedikasikan kepada Julianos adalah penjaga Gulungan Elder. Kyne (Ciuman di Akhir): Dewi Nordik Badai. Janda Shor dan dewa favorit para pejuang. Ia sering disebut Ibu Manusia. Putrinya mengajarkan Nord pertama cara menggunakan thu'um, atau Suara Badai. Kynareth (Dewi Udara): Kynareth adalah anggota Sembilan Dewa, roh langit terkuat. Dalam beberapa legenda, ia pertama yang menyetujui rencana Lorkhan menciptakan bidang mortal, dan memberikan ruang bagi penciptaannya di kekosongan. Ia juga dikaitkan dengan hujan, fenomena yang dikatakan tidak terjadi sebelum percikan ilahi Lorkhan diangkat. Leki (Santo Pedang Roh): Putri Dewi Tall Papa, Leki adalah dewi pedang aneh. Na-Totambu dari Yokuda berperang sampai impas pada era mitos untuk memutuskan siapa yang memimpin serangan melawan Elf Kidal. Pendekar pedang mereka, bagaimanapun, sangat terampil dalam Potongan Terbaik yang dikenal sehingga dapat berimbang. Leki memperkenalkan Tipuan Sementara. Setelah itu, seorang pemenang muncul dan perang melawan Aldmer dimulai. Lorkhan (Dewa yang Hilang): Dewa Pencipta-Pengelabui-Penguji ini hadir dalam setiap tradisi mitis Tamrielik. Nama paling populer adalah Aldmeri 'Lorkhan', atau Drum Malapetaka. Ia meyakinkan atau menyusun Roh Asli untuk menciptakan bidang mortal, mengacaukan status quo — mirip ayahnya Padomay yang memperkenalkan ketidakstabilan ke alam semesta di Tempat Awal. Setelah dunia terwujud, Lorkhan terpisah dari pusat ilahi, kadang secara tidak sengaja, dan mengembara dalam penciptaan et'Ada. Penempatan metafisikanya dalam 'rencana segala sesuatu' diinterpretasikan beragam. Di Morrowind, misalnya, ia menjadi makhluk yang terkait dengan Usaha Psijiik, proses dimana mortal ditugaskan melampaui dewa yang menciptakan mereka. Bagi Altmer Tinggi, ia adalah yang paling tidak suci di antara semua Powers tinggi, karena ia selamanya memutuskan hubungan mereka ke bidang roh. Dalam legenda, ia hampir selalu menjadi musuh Aldmer dan, oleh karena itu, pahlawan Manusia awal. Lorkhaj (Babi Bulan): Dewa dinasti Pre-ri'Datta Anaquinine, mudah diidentifikasi dengan Dewa yang Hilang, Lorkhan. Magnus (Magi): Dewa sihir, Magnus menarik diri dari penciptaan dunia pada detik terakhir, meski itu sangat mahal baginya. Apa yang tersisa darinya di dunia dirasakan dan dikendalikan mortal sebagai sihir. Sebuah cerita mengatakan bahwa, meski ide itu dipikirkan Lorkhan, Magnus yang membuat skematik dan diagram yang diperlukan untuk membangun bidang mortal. Ia kadang digambarkan dengan astrolabe, teleskop, atau lebih umum, Staff. Legenda Cyrodilic mengatakan ia dapat menghuni tubuh penyihir kuat dan memberi mereka kekuatannya. Dikaitkan dengan Zurin Arctus, Raja Bawah. Malacath (Dewa Kutukan): Malacath adalah kotoran hidup yang menjadi Trinimac. Daedra yang agak lemah tapi pendendam, Dark Elf mengatakan ia juga Malak, raja dewa ork. Ia selalu menguji Dunmer untuk kelemahan fisik. Malooc (Raja Gerombolan): Dewa musuh Ra Gada. Memimpin goblin melawan Redguard pada era pertama. Melarikan diri ke timur ketika pasukan HoonDing menaklukkan gerombolan goblinnya. Mauloch (Malacath): Dewa Orc, Mauloch mengganggu ahli waris Raja Harald lama. Melarikan diri ke timur setelah dikalahkan di Pertempuran Tembok Naga, sekitar 1E660. Amarahnya konon mengisi langit dengan kebencian belerangnya, kemudian disebut "Tahun Musim Dingin di Musim Panas". Mara (Dewi Cinta): Dewi hampir universal. Asal‑usulnya dimulai pada masa mitos sebagai dewi kesuburan. Di Skyrim, Mara adalah pelayan Kyne. Di Kekaisaran, ia adalah Dewi Ibu. Kadang dikaitkan dengan Nir dari 'Anuad', prinsip wanita kosmos yang melahirkan penciptaan. Tergantung agama, ia menikah dengan Akatosh atau Lorkhan, atau menjadi gundik keduanya. Mehrunes Dagon (Dewa Kehancuran): Kekuatan Daedric populer. Ia terkait dengan bahaya alam seperti api, gempa bumi, dan banjir. Di beberapa budaya, Dagon hanyalah dewa pertumpahan darah dan pengkhianatan. Ia sangat penting di Morrowind, dimana ia mewakili medan yang hampir tidak bersahabat. Mephala (Androgini): Mephala adalah Webspinner, atau Dewa Laba‑Laba. Di Morrowind, ia/ia adalah nenek yang mengajarkan Chimer skills yang mereka perlukan untuk mengelak musuh atau membunuh mereka dengan pembunuhan rahasia. Musuh banyak pada masa itu karena Chimer hanya sedikit. Ia/ia, bersama Boethiah, mengatur sistem klan yang pada akhirnya menjadi dasar Great Houses. Ia/ia mendirikan Morag Tong. Juga disebut Antisipasi Vivec. Molag Bal (Dewa Skema, Raja Pemerkosaan): Kekuatan Daedric yang sangat penting di Morrowind. Di sana, ia selalu menjadi musuh utama Boethiah, Pangeran Intrik. Ia sumber utama rintangan bagi orang Dunmer (dan Chimer sebelumnya). Dalam legenda, Molag Bal selalu berusaha mengacaukan garis keturunan House atau merusak 'Purity' Dunmeri. Ras monster super, yang konon hidup di Molag Amur, merupakan hasil godaan Vivec pada era sebelumnya. Morihaus (Nafas Pertama Manusia): Dewa pahlawan budaya kuno Cyro‑Nord. Legenda menggambarkannya sebagai Pengambil Benteng, tindakan zaman mitis yang menegaskan kontrol Manusia atas Lembah Hati. Ia sering dikaitkan dengan Powers Nordik thu'um, dan karena itu dengan Kynareth. Morwha (Dewa Puting): Dewi kesuburan Yokudan. Dewa utama dalam pantheon Yokudan, dan favorit istri Tall Papa. Masih disembah di berbagai daerah Hammerfell, termasuk Stros M'kai. Morwha selalu digambarkan berkepala empat, sehingga ia dapat 'mencengkeram lebih banyak suami'. Nerevar (Pembunuh Dewa): Raja Chimeri Resdayn, Zaman Keemasan Veloth kuno. Dibunuh selama The Battle of Red Mountain, Nerevar adalah Utusan Jalan Triune, dan santo utama kepercayaan Dunmeri. Dikatakan ia membunuh Dumac, Raja Dwarf Terakhir, dan memakan hatinya. Onsi (Pemecah Tulang): Dewa pejuang terkemuka Ra Gada Yokudan, Onsi mengajarkan Manusia cara mengubah belati menjadi pedang. Orkey (Pengetuk Tua): Dewa pinjaman Nord, yang tampaknya diadopsi selama pemerintahan Aldmeri di Atmora. Nord percaya mereka pernah hidup selama yang sama dengan Elf sampai Orkey muncul; melalui tipu muslihat penyembah, ia menipu mereka ke dalam perjanjian yang 'mengikat mereka pada hitungan musim dingin'. Sekali waktu, legenda mengatakan, Nord hanya memiliki usia enam tahun karena sihir busuk Orkey. Shor muncul, namun, dan melalui cara tak diketahui, menghilangkan kutukan, melemparkannya ke Orc terdekat. Phynaster: Dewa pahlawan Kepulauan Summerset, yang mengajarkan Altmer cara hidup alami seratus tahun lebih lama dengan cara langkah kaki yang lebih pendek. Rajhin (Pemburu): Dewa pencuri Khajiit, yang tumbuh di daerah Black Kiergo Senchal. Pencuri paling terkenal dalam sejarah Elsweyr, Rajhin konon mencuri tato dari leher Permaisuri Kintyra saat ia tidur. Reman (Cyrodiil): Dewa‑pahlawan budaya Kekaisaran Kedua, Reman adalah pahlawan terbesar Masalah Akaviri. Ia meyakinkan penyerbu membantu membangun kekaisarannya, dan menaklukkan seluruh Tamriel kecuali Morrowind. Ia menetapkan upacara menjadi Kaisar, termasuk ritual geas untuk The Amulet of Kings, sebuah soulgem berkuasa besar. Dinasti‑nya diakhiri oleh Morag Tong Dunmeri di akhir era pertama. Juga disebut Dewa Duniawi. Riddle'Thar (Tarian Dua Bulan): Dewa tatanan kosmik Khajiit, Riddle'Thar diungkapkan ke Elsweyr oleh nabi Rid‑Thar‑ri'Datta, Mane. Riddle'Thar lebih merupakan seperangkat pedoman hidup daripada satu entitas, namun beberapa avatarnya suka muncul sebagai utusan rendah hati dewa. Juga dikenal sebagai Dewa Gula. Ruptga (Tall Papa): Dewa utama pantheon Yokudan. Ruptga, lebih umum disebut 'Tall Papa', adalah dewa pertama yang menemukan cara bertahan hidup dari Kelaparan Satakal. Mengikuti jejaknya, dewa‑dewa lain mempelajari 'Walkabout', proses di mana mereka dapat melampaui satu masa hidup. Tall Papa menata bintang‑bintang di langit untuk menunjukkan cara itu pada roh‑roh kecil. Ketika terlalu banyak roh yang tak terhitung, Ruptga menciptakan pembantu dari kulit mati dunia‑dunia sebelumnya. Pembantu itu adalah Sep (lihat di bawah), yang kemudian menciptakan dunia mortal. Satakal (Kulit Dunia): Dewa Yokudan segala sesuatu. Gabungan konsep Anu dan Padomay. Pada dasarnya, Satakal mirip Alduin Nordik, yang menghancurkan satu dunia untuk memulai berikutnya. Dalam mitologi Yokudan, Satakal telah melakukannya (dan masih melakukannya) berkali‑kali, siklus yang memunculkan roh‑roh yang dapat bertahan dalam transisi. Roh‑roh itu pada akhirnya menjadi pantheon Yokudan. Dewa populer penduduk nomad Alik'r. Sheogorath (Dewa Gila): Penghormatan takut terhadap Sheogorath tersebar luas, dan ditemukan di hampir setiap daerah Tamrielik. Sumber kontemporer menunjukkan akarnya pada cerita penciptaan Aldmeri; di sana, ia 'dilahirkan' ketika percikan ilahi Lorkhan diangkat. Salah satu mitos krusial memanggilnya 'lubang berbentuk Sithis' dunia. Sheor (Orang Buruk): Di Bretony, Orang Buruk adalah sumber semua perselisihan. Ia tampaknya mulai sebagai dewa kegagalan panen, namun sebagian besar teolog modern setuju bahwa ia merupakan versi demonisasi Shor Nordik, dilahirkan pada tahun‑tahun gelap setelah kejatuhan Saarthal. Sep (Ular): Versi Yokudan Lorkhan. Sep lahir ketika Tall Papa menciptakan seseorang untuk membantunya mengatur perdagangan roh. Sep, bagaimanapun, menjadi gila karena kelaparan Satakal, dan ia meyakinkan beberapa dewa membantu menciptakan alternatif yang lebih mudah bagi Walkabout. Ini, tentu saja, menjadi dunia yang kita kenal, dan roh‑roh yang mengikuti Sep terperangkap di sini, hidup sebagai mortal. Sep dihukum Tall Papa atas pelanggarannya, namun kelaparannya tetap hidup sebagai void di bintang‑bintang, 'non‑space' yang mencoba mengacaukan masuknya mortal ke Far Shores. Shezarr (Dewa Manusia): Versi Cyrodilic Lorkhan, yang kepentingannya menurun ketika Akatosh menjadi pusat agama Imperial (sebenarnya, Alessian). Shezarr adalah roh di balik semua usaha manusia, terutama melawan agresi Aldmeri. Ia kadang dikaitkan dengan pendirian battlemage Cyrodilic pertama. Pada zaman toleransi rasial saat ini, Shezarr hampir dilupakan. Shor (Dewa Dunia Bawah): Versi Nordik Lorkhan, yang berpihak pada Manusia setelah penciptaan dunia. Dewa‑dewa asing (yaitu, Elf) bersekongkol melawannya dan menyebabkan kekalahannya, menakutkannya ke dunia bawah. Mitos Atmoran menggambarkannya sebagai raja pejuang berdarah yang memimpin Nord memenangkan pertempuran melawan penindas Aldmeri berulang kali. Sebelum kiamatnya, Shor adalah kepala para dewa. Kadang juga disebut Dewa Children (lihat Orkey, di atas). Sotha Sil (Misteri Morrowind): Dewa Dunmer, Sotha Sil adalah yang paling tidak dikenal dari Tribunal ilahi. Ia dikatakan sedang merombak dunia dari kota jam tersembunyinya. Stendarr (Dewa Belas Kasih): Dewa Sembilan Dewa, Stendarr berevolusi dari asal Nordiknya menjadi dewa welas asih atau, kadang, aturan benar. Ia dikatakan menemani Tiber Septim pada tahun‑tahun akhir hidupnya. Dalam legenda Altmeri awal, Stendarr adalah pembela Manusia. Stuhn (Dewa Tebusan): Pendahulu Nordik Stendarr, saudara Tsun. Perisai‑thane Shor, Stuhn adalah dewa pejuang yang melawan pantheon Aldmeri. Ia mengajarkan Manusia cara mengambil, serta manfaat mengambil tawanan perang. Syrabane (Dewa Penyihir): Dewa‑nenek Aldmeri sihir, Syrabane membantu Bendu Olo dalam Kejatuhan Sload. Dengan penggunaan cermat cincin sihirnya, Syrabane menyelamatkan banyak orang dari Wabah Thrassian. Ia juga disebut Dewa Murid, karena ia favorit para anggota muda Guild Mage. Tava (Dewa Burung): Roh udara Yokudan. Tava paling terkenal karena memimpin Yokudan ke pulau Herne setelah kehancuran tanah air mereka. Sejak itu ia menyatu dengan mitologi Kynareth. Ia masih sangat populer di Hammerfell di antara pelaut, dan kuilnya dapat ditemukan di hampir semua kota pelabuhan. Tiber Septim (Talos, Sang Dragonborn): Pewaris Singgasana Raja‑Raja Terbagi, Tiber Septim adalah pahlawan‑dewa paling penting bagi Manusia. Ia menaklukkan seluruh Tamriel dan membuka Era Ketiga (serta Kekaisaran Ketiga). Juga disebut Ysmir, 'Naga Utara'. Trinimac: Dewa kuat Aldmer awal, di beberapa tempat lebih populer daripada Auri-El. Ia adalah roh pejuang suku Elf asli yang memimpin pasukan melawan Manusia. Boethiah dikatakan mengadopsi bentuknya (dalam beberapa cerita, ia bahkan memakan Trinimac) sehingga dapat meyakinkan banyak Aldmer untuk mendengarkannya, yang pada akhirnya mengarah pada konversi Chimeri. Ia menghilang dari panggung mitos setelah itu, untuk kembali sebagai Malacath menakutkan (propaganda Altmeri menampilkan ini sebagai bahaya pengaruh Dunmeri). Tsun: Dewa Nordik yang punah, pengujian melawan kesulitan. Mati membela Shor dari dewa‑dewa asing. Tu'whacca (Dewa Licik): Dewa Yokudan Souls. Tu'whacca, sebelum penciptaan dunia, adalah dewa Nobody Really Cares. Ketika Tall Papa memulai Walkabout, Tu'whacca menemukan tujuan; ia menjadi penjaga Far Shores, dan terus membantu Redguard menemukan jalan ke alam baka. Kultusnya kadang dikaitkan dengan Arkay di Regions Hammerfell yang lebih kosmopolitan. Vivec (Penguasa Morrowind): Dewa‑puisi‑pejuang Dunmer. Vivec adalah penjaga tak terlihat tanah suci, selalu waspada terhadap dewa gelap Vulkan. Ia/ia telah menyelamatkan orang Dunmeri berkali‑kali dari kematian pasti, terutama ketika ia/ia mengajari mereka cara bernafas di dalam air selama satu hari sehingga dapat membanjiri Morrowind dan membunuh penyerbu Akaviri, sekitar 2E572. Xarxes: Xarxes adalah dewa keturunan dan pengetahuan rahasia. Ia memulai sebagai juru tulis Auri‑El, dan mencatat semua prestasi Aldmeri, besar dan kecil, sejak awal zaman. Ia menciptakan istri, Oghma, dari momen‑momen sejarah favoritnya. Y'ffre (Dewa Hutan): Dewa terpenting pantheon Bosmeri. Sementara Auri‑El Naga Waktu mungkin menjadi raja para dewa, Bosmer menyembah Y'ffre sebagai roh 'sekarang'. Menurut Elf Hutan, setelah penciptaan bidang mortal segala sesuatu kacau. Mortal pertama berubah menjadi tumbuhan dan binatang berulang kali. Kemudian Y'ffre berubah menjadi yang pertama dari Ehlnofey, atau 'Tulang Bumi'. Setelah hukum alam ini ditetapkan, mortal memperoleh sedikit keamanan di dunia baru, karena kini mereka dapat memahaminya. Y'ffre kadang disebut Sang Pencerita, untuk pelajaran yang diajarkannya kepada Bosmer pertama. Beberapa Bosmer masih memiliki pengetahuan zaman kekacauan, yang dapat mereka manfaatkan (Perburuan Liar). Ysmir (Naga Utara): Aspek Nordik Talos. Ia menahan suara The Greybeards cukup lama untuk mendengar nubuat mereka. Kemudian banyak Nord tak dapat melihatnya tanpa menganggapnya naga. Z'en (Dewa Pekerjaan): Dewa Bosmeri pembayaran dalam jenis. Penelitian menunjukkan asalnya di kedua Argonian dan mitologi Akaviri, mungkin dibawa ke Valenwood oleh pelaut Kothringi. Secara lahiriah dewa pertanian, Z'en kadang terbukti menjadi entitas kosmik yang lebih tinggi. Penyembahannya mati tak lama setelah Flu Knhaten. Zeht (Dewa Pertanian): Dewa Yokudan pertanian. Menolak ayahnya setelah dunia diciptakan, itulah mengapa Tall Papa membuatnya begitu susah menumbuhkan makanan. Zenithar (Dewa Kerja dan Perdagangan, Dewa Pedagang): Anggota Sembilan Dewa, Zenithar wajar dikaitkan dengan Z'en. Di Kekaisaran, ia lebih dikenal sebagai dewa pedagang dan bangsawan menengah. Pengikutnya berkata, terlepas dari asal misteriusnya, Zenithar adalah dewa 'yang selalu menang'.

String.Source: Sapphire + Salt Pile + Albino Spider Pod
String.Dest: Safir + Salt Pile + Pola Laba‑Laba Albino

String.Source: I agreed to fund Ralis Sedarys' expedition to excavate Kolbjorn Barrow. He told me to return in a few days to see how work was progressing.
String.Dest: Saya setuju untuk mendanai ekspedisi Ralis Sedarys dalam menggali Kolbjorn Barrow. Dia menyuruh saya kembali dalam beberapa hari untuk melihat bagaimana pekerjaan berjalan.

String.Source: Adril Arano has requested my help with what he believes is an imminent threat on Councilor Morvayn's life. He believes members of the Ulen family are present on the island and seek revenge upon Morvayn for executing their ancestor. He's requested that I investigate the identity of any possible assassins, hoping to catch them unaware. Adril suggests that I start by speaking to Geldis Sadri, the innkeeper at the Retching Netch Cornerclub. He's hoping that Geldis, who has quite the reputation as a gossip, might have some useful leads.
String.Dest: Adril Arano telah meminta bantuan saya atas apa yang dia yakini merupakan ancaman mendesak terhadap nyawa Councilor Morvayn. Dia percaya anggota keluarga Ulen berada di pulau ini dan mengincar balas dendam kepada Morvayn karena mengeksekusi leluhur mereka. Dia meminta saya menyelidiki identitas kemungkinan pembunuh, dengan harapan menangkap mereka tanpa curiga. Adril menyarankan agar saya mulai dengan berbicara kepada Geldis Sadri, pemilik kedai di The Retching Netch Cornerclub. Dia berharap Geldis, yang memiliki reputasi sebagai pengumpat, mungkin memiliki petunjuk berguna.

String.Source: Flawless Sapphire + Damaged Albino Spider Pod
String.Dest: Safir Tanpa Cacat + Pod Laba-laba Albino Rusak

String.Source:
<font face='$HandwrittenFont'><font size='18'> I am stronger now. The heart stone kept me alive after Neloth's butchery. I can feel the bones in the ash calling to me. I can call back to them too. With the heart stone I can bind the spirits to bone and ash and raise a servant to do my bidding.
Tonight I will seize control. These miners and fortune seekers are pawns of Neloth. I can feel them staring at me. I'm sure they are sending him messages, reporting on my every move. The only ones I can trust are the voices. They've never lied to me. They've shown me that these fools plan to betray me, just like Neloth.
When they are all asleep, I will raise my ash spawn. Their brute of a leader will die first. I can see the lust in his heart. He may act all kind and generous, but I know what he wants, what they all want. They want the heart stone.
I'll keep a few prisoners. I need test subjects for my experiments. There is more that the heart stone can do. I just need to try out a few ideas.
String.Dest:
<font face='$HandwrittenFont'><font size='18'> Saya lebih kuat sekarang. heart stone menjaga saya tetap hidup setelah pembantaian Neloth. Saya dapat merasakan tulang-tulang di dalam abu memanggil saya. Saya juga dapat memanggil kembali mereka. Dengan heart stone saya dapat mengikat roh-roh ke tulang dan abu serta mengangkat seorang pelayan untuk melaksanakan perintah saya.
Malam ini saya akan merebut kendali. Penambang dan pencari keberuntungan ini hanyalah pion-pion Neloth. Saya dapat merasakan mereka menatap saya. Saya yakin mereka mengirimkan pesan kepadanya, melaporkan setiap gerak-gerik saya. Satu-satunya yang dapat saya percayai adalah suara-suara. Mereka tidak pernah berbohong kepada saya. Mereka menunjukkan bahwa orang-orang bodoh ini berencana mengkhianati saya, seperti Neloth.
Ketika mereka semua tertidur, saya akan memanggil makhluk abu saya. Pemimpin kasar mereka akan mati pertama. Saya dapat melihat nafsu di hatinya. Dia mungkin berpura‑pura baik dan murah hati, namun saya tahu apa yang dia inginkan, apa yang mereka semua inginkan. Mereka menginginkan heart stone.
Saya akan menyimpan beberapa tahanan. Saya membutuhkan subjek percobaan untuk eksperimen saya. Masih banyak yang dapat dilakukan heart stone. Saya hanya perlu mencoba beberapa ide.

String.Source: I agreed to fund Ralis Sedarys' expedition to excavate Kolbjorn Barrow, but in order to continue, he needs more gold to hire replacements for the workers that have been killed.
String.Dest: Saya setuju untuk mendanai ekspedisi Ralis Sedarys ke Kolbjorn Barrow, tetapi supaya dapat melanjutkan, dia membutuhkan lebih banyak emas untuk mempekerjakan pengganti pekerja yang telah terbunuh.

String.Source:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"> Dear Wulf,
I'm writing to you now as I already feel my mind going. I fear that soon I will not be able to write at all. I came to the wilderness to better know the All-Maker. But in the wilds I found a force greater than any we've known.
It is seductive, this power I've been granted. I know you would not approve, so I don't dare show my face to you. But know that I realized the greatest potential of my strength before the last.
I hope to one day meet you before the All-Maker, brother.
- Torkild </font>
String.Dest:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"> Wulf yang terkasih,
Aku menulis kepadamu sekarang karena aku sudah merasakan pikiran ku memudar. Aku takut bahwa segera aku tidak akan mampu menulis sama sekali. Aku datang ke alam liar untuk lebih mengenal Sang Pencipta. Namun di sana aku menemukan kekuatan yang lebih besar daripada apa pun yang pernah kita ketahui.
Kekuatan yang diberikan kepadaku ini menggoda. Aku tahu kau tidak akan menyetujuinya, jadi aku tidak berani menampakkan wajahku kepadamu. Namun ketahuilah, aku telah menyadari potensi tertinggi dari kekuatanku sebelum akhir.
Aku berharap suatu hari kelak dapat bertemu denganmu di hadapan Sang Pencipta, saudaraku.
- Torkild </font>

String.Source: I agreed to fund Ralis Sedarys' expedition to excavate Kolbjorn Barrow, but work on the site has stopped. Most of the miners were killed by another wave of Draugr attacks, and two more are unaccounted for. I dealt with the Draugr, but still need to locate the missing miners.
String.Dest: Saya setuju untuk mendanai ekspedisi Ralis Sedarys guna menggali Kolbjorn Barrow, tetapi pekerjaan di situs telah terhenti. Sebagian besar penambang terbunuh oleh gelombang serangan Draugr lainnya, dan dua orang lagi tidak terhitung. Saya telah menanggulangi Draugr, namun masih perlu menemukan penambang yang hilang.

String.Source: You can't make out the writing on this tablet.
String.Dest: Anda tidak dapat membaca tulisan pada tablet ini.

String.Source:
Mora's Agony: Summons a field of writhing tentacles that poison foes.
You may only accept one ability from this book at a time.
String.Dest:
Mora's Agony: Memanggil ladang tentakel berkelok yang meracuni musuh.
Anda hanya dapat menerima satu kemampuan dari buku ini pada satu waktu.

String.Source:
[pagebreak]

Lives of the Saints

[pagebreak]

f you would be wise, model your lives on the lives of the saints. If you would learn valor, follow St. Nerevar the Captain, patron of Warriors and Statesmen. Lord Nerevar helped to unite the barbarian Dunmer tribes into a great nation, culminating in his martyrdom when leading the Dunmer to victory against the evil Dwemer and the traitorous House Dagoth in the Battle of Red Mountain. If you would learn daring, follow Saint Veloth the Pilgrim, Patron of Outcasts and Spiritual Seekers. Saint Veloth, prophet and mystic, led the Dunmer out of the decadent home country of the Summerset Isles and into the promised land of Morrowind. Saint Veloth also taught the difference between the Good and Bad Daedra, and won the aid of the Good Daedra for his people while teaching how to carefully negotiate with the Bad Daedra. If you would learn generosity, follow Saint Rilms the Barefooted, Patron of Pilgrims and Beggars. Saint Rilms gave away her shoes, then dressed and appeared as a beggar to better acquaint herself with the poor. If you would learn self-respect and respect for others, follow Saint Aralor the Penitent, Patron of Tanners and Miners. This foul criminal repented his sins and traveled a circuit of the great pilgrimages on his knees. If you would learn mercy and its fruits, follow Saint Seryn the Merciful, Patron of Brewers, Bakers, Distillers. This pure virgin of modest aspect could heal all diseases at the price of taking the disease upon herself. Tough-minded and fearless, she took on the burdens of others, and bore those burdens to an honored old age. If you would learn fierce justice, follow Saint Felms the Bold, Patron of Butchers and Fishmongers. This brave warlord slew the Nord invaders and drove them from our lands. He could neither read nor write, receiving inspiration directly from the lips of Almsivi. If you would learn pride of race and tribe, follow Saint Roris the Martyr, Patron of Furnishers and Caravaners. Captured by Argonians just before the Arnesian War, Roris proudly refused to renounce the Tribunal faith, and withstood the cruel tortures of Argonian sorcerers. Vengeance and justice for the martyred Saint Roris was the rallying cry of the Arnesian War. If you would learn the rule of law and justice, follow Saint Olms the Just, Patron of Chandlers and Clerks. Founder of the Ordinators, Saint Olms conceived and articulated the fundamental principles of testing, ordeal, and repentance. If you would learn benevolence, follow Saint Delyn the Wise, Patron of Potters and Glassmakers. Saint Delyn was head of House Indoril, a skilled lawyer, and author of many learned treatises on Tribunal law and custom. If you would learn the love of peace, follow Saint Meris the Peacemaker, Patron of Farmers and Laborers. As a little girl, Saint Meris showed healing gifts, and trained as a Healer. She ended a long and bloody House War, intervening on the battlefield in her white robe to heal warriors and spellcrafters without regard to faction. The troops of all House adopted white robes as her standard, and refused to shed the blood of their brethren. If you would learn reverence, follow Saint Llothis the Pious, Patron of Tailors and Dyers. Contemporary and companion of the Tribunals, and the best-loved Alma Rula of the Tribunal Temple, he formulated the central rituals and principles of the New Temple Faith. Saint Llothis is the symbolic mortal bridge between the gods and the faithful, and the archetypal priest.
String.Dest:
[pagebreak]

Lives of the Saints

[pagebreak]

Jika Anda ingin bijaksana, contohkan hidup Anda pada Lives of the Saints. Jika Anda ingin belajar keberanian, ikuti St. Nerevar si Kapten, pelindung Para Pejuang dan Negara. Lord Nerevar membantu menyatukan suku barbar Dunmer menjadi sebuah bangsa besar, yang berujung pada kemartirannya ketika memimpin Dunmer meraih kemenangan melawan Dwemer jahat dan House Dagoth yang berkhianat di The Battle of Red Mountain. Jika Anda ingin belajar keberanian, ikuti Saint Veloth si Peziarah, Pelindung Orang Terbuang dan Pencari Spiritual. Saint Veloth, nabi dan mistik, memimpin Dunmer keluar dari tanah kelahiran yang dekaden di Kepulauan Summerset ke tanah yang dijanjikan Morrowind. Saint Veloth juga mengajarkan perbedaan antara Daedra Baik dan Daedra Jahat, serta memperoleh bantuan Daedra Baik bagi bangsanya sambil mengajarkan cara bernegosiasi hati-hati dengan Daedra Jahat. Jika Anda ingin belajar kemurahan hati, ikuti Saint Rilms si Kaki Telanjang, Pelindung Peziarah dan Pengemis. Saint Rilms memberikan sepatunya, kemudian berpakaian dan muncul sebagai pengemis untuk lebih mengenal orang miskin. Jika Anda ingin belajar hormat pada diri sendiri dan hormat pada orang lain, ikuti Saint Aralor si Penitente, Pelindung Tukang Kulit dan Penambang. Penjahat busuk ini menyesali dosanya dan menempuh rangkaian ziarah besar berlutut. Jika Anda ingin belajar belas kasih dan buahnya, ikuti Saint Seryn si Penyayang, Pelindung Pembuat Bir, Pembuat Roti, Penyuling. Perawan murni berpenampilan sederhana ini dapat menyembuhkan semua penyakit dengan harga mengambil penyakit itu pada dirinya sendiri. Tangguh dan tak kenal takut, dia memikul beban orang lain, dan menanggungnya hingga usia tua yang terhormat. Jika Anda ingin belajar keadilan yang keras, ikuti Saint Felms si Berani, Pelindung Penjagal dan Penjual Ikan. Panglima perang yang berani ini membunuh penyerang Nord dan mengusir mereka dari tanah kami. Dia tidak dapat membaca atau menulis, menerima inspirasi langsung dari bibir Almsivi. Jika Anda ingin belajar kebanggaan ras dan suku, ikuti Saint Roris si Martir, Pelindung Penghuni dan Karawan. Ditangkap oleh Argonian tepat sebelum Perang Arnesian, Roris dengan bangga menolak mengingkari kepercayaan Tribunal, dan menahan penyiksaan kejam para penyihir Argonian. Pembalasan dan keadilan bagi Saint Roris yang menjadi martir adalah teriakan rally Perang Arnesian. Jika Anda ingin belajar aturan hukum dan keadilan, ikuti Saint Olms si Adil, Pelindung Penjual Lilin dan Juru Tulis. Pendiri Ordinators, Saint Olms merumuskan dan menyatakan prinsip dasar pengujian, ujian, dan pertobatan. Jika Anda ingin belajar kebaikan hati, ikuti Saint Delyn si Bijaksana, Pelindung Toser dan Pembuat Kaca. Saint Delyn adalah kepala Rumah Indoril, seorang pengacara terampil, dan penulis banyak risalah ilmiah tentang hukum dan adat Tribunal. Jika Anda ingin belajar cinta damai, ikuti Saint Meris si Perdamaian, Pelindung Petani dan Buruh. Sebagai anak kecil, Saint Meris menunjukkan bakat Healing, dan dilatih sebagai Penyembuh. Ia mengakhiri Perang Rumah yang panjang dan berdarah, turun ke medan perang dengan jubah putih untuk menyembuhkan pejuang dan penyihir tanpa mempedulikan faksi. Pasukan semua Rumah mengadopsi jubah putih sebagai standar mereka, dan menolak menumpahkan darah saudara mereka. Jika Anda ingin belajar penghormatan, ikuti Saint Llothis si Saleh, Pelindung Penjahit dan Pewarna. Kontemporer dan sahabat Tribunal, serta Alma Rula yang paling dicintai di Kuil Tribunal, ia merumuskan ritual sentral dan prinsip Kepercayaan Kuil Baru. Saint Llothis adalah jembatan mortal simbolik antara dewa dan yang setia, serta imam arketip.

String.Source: I met a group of Nords from Thirsk Mead Hall, which has recently been overrun by Rieklings. They're camped on the eastern shore of the island, waiting for an opportunity to attack and take back their home.
String.Dest: Saya bertemu dengan sekelompok Nords dari Thirsk Mead Hall, yang baru-baru ini telah dikuasai oleh Rieklings. Mereka berkemah di pantai timur pulau, menunggu kesempatan untuk menyerang dan merebut kembali rumah mereka.

String.Source:
[pagebreak]

The Poison Song Book IV By Bristin Xel

[pagebreak]

cra sat by the hearth in Tay's room, reading her book by the fire. It concerned some minutiae of theosophy that she did not believe in, but nevertheless found morbidly compelling. When the door opened and she heard Tay enter, she finished the paragraph she was reading before looking up. "I've been here for hours, darling. If I knew you were going to be so late, I would have brought more books," she giggled. When she saw Tay's face and the state of his clothing, her manner lost all frivolity. "What happened to you? Are you all right?" "I've been to see my old childhood nursemaid, Edebah," he said in a strange voice. "It was a sudden change of plans. I hadn't realized she was in Mournhold." "I wish I had known where you were going," she said, rising slowly from her chair. "I would have loved to have met her." "Well, it's too late now. I've killed her." Acra inhaled deeply, studying Tay's frozen face. She took his hand. "Perhaps you ought to tell me everything." Tay let his beloved lead him to the hearth, where he sat blinking at the fire. He looked down at the silver ring on his finger. "Before I killed her, she gave me this. It's the sealing ring of the House Dagoth. She told me I was the bearer of the inheritance, and the Song I hear all the time in my head, the one that called me to kill another boy when I was young, and then Edebah herself, is the Song of my ancestors." Tay fell silent. Acra knelt by his side, stroking his ringed hand. "Tell me more." "My tutor Kena Gafrisi taught us that the House Dagoth was a curse on Morrowind. He said that when they were all destroyed at the end of the War, the very earth itself breathed in relief," Tay closed his eyes. "I can see the obliteration. I can even hear it in the Song. Edebah told me that the five Houses adopted the orphan children of Dagoth, raising them in their own traditions. I thought she was mad or a liar, but the real lie was all those years I thought my family was House Indoril." "What are you going to do?" Acra whispered. "Well, Edebah told me to follow the Song to my destiny," Tay laughed bitterly. "But the Song led me to kill her, so I don't know if she'd still give me that recommendation now. I know that I need to leave Mournhold. Before I knew what I was doing, I set a fire in her tenement. The guards were called. I just don't know where I'd go." "You have many friends to shield you if you prove yourself to be the new leader of the return of the Sixth House," Acra kissed the ring. "I will help you find them." Tay stared at her. "Why would you help me?" "When you thought I was your cousin of the House Indoril, you did not mind having me though it might well have been incestuous," Acra replied, meeting his eyes. "I have heard the Song too. It is not as strong with me as it was with you, but I never chose to ignore it. It taught me more than the ridiculous Temple priests and priestesses ever could. I knew that my true name was Dagoth-Acra, and I knew that I had a brother." "No," Tay said through gritted teeth. "You're lying." "You are Dagoth-Tython." Tay shoved Acra hard against the wall and ran from the room. As he fled through the hall, he heard the sound of Kalkorith's footfall on the stairs behind him, a percussive instrument in the Song that was rising in his heart and head "Cousin," the senior initiate was saying. "Have you heard about the fire--" Tay unsheathed his dagger and turned, burying it to the hilt in Kalkorith's throat. "Cousin," he hissed. "I am not your cousin." The streets of Mournhold were lit by the red glow of the tenement fire, spreading through the tight alleyways by a steady and intense gust of wind. It was as if Dagoth-Ur himself was looming over the city, fanning the flames his heir had struck. A House guard, running toward the blaze, stopped at the sight of Tay, standing uncertainly, swaying, before the front door of Kalkorith's house, a bloodied blade in his hand. "What you done, serjo?" Tay ran for the forest, his cape whipping behind him by the force of the howling wind. The guard clambered after him, sword drawn. He had no need to investigate the house to see the murder. He knew. For hours, Tay raced through the wilderness, the Song pushing him onward. The sound of his pursuer faded away. At last, the trees thinned, and he saw nothing before him but air and water. A cliff, a hundred foot long plunge into the Inner Sea. The Song told him no. It pulled him north, sweetly promising a place to rest among friends. More than friends -- people who would worship him as the heir of Dagoth. As he slowly walked toward the edge of the cliff, the Song became more threatening, warning him not to seek to avoid his fate. There was no escape in death. Tay spat a curse upon his House and threw himself head first over the cliff. It was another glorious day on the island of Gorne, the first one in weeks that Baynarah could truly enjoy. Uncle Triffith had important company, Housemen from far away, and she had been required to attend every dinner, every meeting, every ceremony. As a child, she remembered, she had hoped for some attention. Now nothing was more blissful than time away from her duties. There was only one thing she wanted to do that she had to do indoors, and that was writing a letter to her cousin. But that could wait until the evening, she told herself. After all, he had not written her in many days. It was the influence of that girl, Acra. Not that she seemed disagreeable, but Baynarah knew how one's first love can be all-consuming. At least, she had read about it. As she walked idly through the wildflower meadow, Baynarah was so distracted with her thoughts that she did not hear her maid Hillima calling. She was quite startled when she turned to see the young servant running up. "Serjo," she said, breathlessly. "Please come! Someone has washed up on the shore! It's your cousin, Serjo Indoril-Tay!"
String.Dest:
[pagebreak]

The Poison Song Book IV By Bristin Xel

[pagebreak]

cra duduk di dekat perapian di kamar Tay, membaca bukunya di dekat api. Buku itu membahas beberapa hal kecil tentang teosofi yang tidak ia percayai, namun tetap terasa memikat secara menyeramkan. Saat pintu terbuka dan ia mendengar Tay masuk, ia menyelesaikan paragraf yang sedang dibacanya sebelum menatap ke atas. "Aku sudah di sini berjam‑jam, sayang. Kalau aku tahu kau akan terlambat begini, aku pasti membawa lebih banyak books," dia tertawa kecil. Ketika melihat wajah Tay dan keadaan pakaiannya, sikapnya kehilangan semua kegembiraannya. "Apa yang terjadi padamu? Apakah kau baik‑baik saja?" "Aku pergi menemui perawat masa kecilku, Edebah," katanya dengan suara aneh. "Itu perubahan rencana yang mendadak. Aku tidak menyadari dia berada di Mournhold." "Aduh, kalau aku tahu ke mana kau pergi," katanya sambil perlahan bangkit dari kursinya. "Aku sangat ingin menemuinya." "Yah, sudah terlambat sekarang. Aku sudah membunuhnya." Acra menghirup napas dalam‑dalam, mengamati wajah Tay yang beku. Ia memegang tangan Tay. "Mungkin kau harus menceritakan semuanya kepadaku." Tay membiarkan kekasihnya menuntunnya ke perapian, di mana ia duduk menatap api. Ia menurunkan pandangan ke cincin perak di jarinya. "Sebelum aku membunuhnya, dia memberiku ini. Ini adalah cincin penyegel Rumah Dagoth. Dia memberitahuku bahwa aku adalah pewaris warisan, dan Lagu yang selalu kupikirkan dalam kepalaku, yang memanggilku untuk membunuh anak lain ketika aku masih muda, serta Edebah sendiri, adalah Lagu leluhurku." Tay terdiam. Acra berlutut di sampingnya, mengelus tangan ber‑cincin itu. "Ceritakan lebih banyak." "Guru ku, Kena Gafrisi, mengajarkan kami bahwa Rumah Dagoth adalah kutukan bagi Morrowind. Ia mengatakan bahwa ketika mereka semua dihancurkan pada akhir Perang, bumi itu sendiri menghela napas lega," Tay menutup matanya. "Aku dapat melihat kehancurannya. Aku bahkan dapat mendengarnya dalam Lagu. Edebah memberitahuku bahwa lima Rumah mengadopsi anak yatim Children Dagoth, membesarkannya sesuai tradisi masing‑masing. Aku pikir dia gila atau pembohong, tetapi kebohongan sebenarnya adalah selama bertahun‑tahun ku percaya keluargaku adalah Rumah Indoril." "Apa yang akan kau lakukan?" bisik Acra. "Yah, Edebah menyuruhku mengikuti Lagu ke takdirku," Tay tertawa pahit. "Tapi Lagu membawaku membunuhnya, jadi aku tak tahu apakah dia masih akan memberi rekomendasi itu sekarang. Aku tahu bahwa aku harus meninggalkan Mournhold. Sebelum aku sadar apa yang kulakukan, aku menyalakan api di rumahnya. Penjaga dipanggil. Aku hanya tidak tahu ke mana harus pergi." "Kau memiliki banyak teman yang akan melindungimu jika kau membuktikan diri sebagai pemimpin baru kebangkitan Rumah Keenam," Acra mencium cincin itu. "Aku akan membantumu menemukannya." Tay menatapnya. "Kenapa kau membantu aku?" "Saat kau mengira aku adalah sepupumu dari Rumah Indoril, kau tidak memikirkan bahwa hubungan kami mungkin incestus," jawab Acra menatap matanya. "Aku juga pernah mendengar Lagu itu. Tidak sekuat yang kau rasakan, tapi aku tak pernah memilih untuk mengabaikannya. Lagu mengajarku lebih banyak daripada pendeta dan pendeta wanita Kuil yang konyol. Aku tahu nama sejati ku adalah Dagoth‑Acra, dan aku tahu bahwa aku punya seorang saudara." "Tidak," Tay berkata sambil menggeram. "Kau berbohong." "Kau adalah Dagoth‑Tython." Tay mendorong Acra keras‑keras ke dinding dan melarikan diri dari ruangan itu. Saat ia berlari melalui lorong, ia mendengar langkah kaki Kalkorith di tangga di belakangnya, sebuah instrumen perkusi dalam Lagu yang semakin menguat di hati dan kepalanya. "Sepupu," kata inisiat senior. "Apakah kau sudah dengar tentang kebakaran—" Tay mengeluarkan belati, berbalik, dan menusuknya hingga ujung ke tenggorokan Kalkorith. "Sepupu," ia berbisik. "Aku bukan sepupumu." Jalan‑jalan Mournhold diterangi oleh cahaya merah api tenemen, menyebar melalui gang‑gang sempit oleh hembusan angin yang kuat dan terus‑menerus. Seakan Dagoth‑Ur sendiri mengawasi kota itu, menghembuskan api yang diterjang warisannya. Seorang penjaga Rumah, berlari menuju kobaran, berhenti ketika melihat Tay, berdiri tidak pasti, bergoyang, di depan pintu depan rumah Kalkorith, memegang pedang berlumuran darah. "Apa yang kau lakukan, serjo?" Tay berlari ke hutan, jubahnya berkibar dibelakangnya diterpa hembusan angin yang meneriakkan. Penjaga itu mengejarnya, menghunus pedang. Ia tak perlu menyelidiki rumah untuk melihat pembunuhan itu. Ia sudah tahu. Berjam‑jam Tay berlari melintasi alam liar, Lagu mendorongnya terus maju. Suara pengejarnya memudar. Akhirnya, pepohonan menipis, dan yang tampak di depannya hanyalah udara dan air. Sebuah tebing, jurang ratus kaki yang mengarah ke Laut Dalam. Lagu berkata tidak. Lagu menariknya ke utara, menjanjikan tempat beristirahat bersama sahabat. Lebih dari sahabat — orang‑orang yang akan menyembahnya sebagai pewaris Dagoth. Saat ia perlahan melangkah menuju tepi tebing, Lagu menjadi lebih mengancam, Warning dia agar tidak menghindari takdirnya. Tidak ada pelarian dalam kematian. Tay melontarkan kutukan pada Rumahnya dan melompat kepala pertama ke atas tebing. Hari itu merupakan hari yang indah lagi di pulau Gorne, hari pertama dalam berminggu‑minggu yang bisa dinikmati Baynarah. Paman Triffith memiliki tamu penting, Housemen dari jauh, dan ia harus menghadiri setiap jamuan, setiap pertemuan, setiap upacara. Sewaktu kecil, ia ingat, ia mengharapkan sedikit perhatian. Sekarang tak ada yang lebih membahagiakan daripada waktu jauh dari tugasnya. Satu‑satunya hal yang ingin ia lakukan di dalam ruangan adalah menulis surat kepada sepupunya. Namun itu bisa menunggu sampai malam, pikirnya. Lagipula, sepupunya belum menulis kepadanya selama berhari‑hari. Itu pengaruh gadis itu, Acra. Bukan berarti dia menjengkelkan, tapi Baynarah tahu bagaimana cinta pertama bisa menyerap segalanya. Setidaknya, ia pernah membacanya. Saat ia berjalan santai melalui padang bunga liar, Baynarah terlalu teralihkan oleh pikirannya sehingga ia tak mendengar pembantu Hillima memanggilnya. Ia terkejut ketika berbalik dan melihat pelayan muda berlari mendekat. "Serjo," katanya terengah‑engah. "Tolong datang! Seseorang terdampar di pantai! Itu sepupumu, Serjo Indoril‑Tay!"

String.Source: <font face="$HandwrittenFont"> Black slimy fingers. Black slimy words. Black slimy book. <alias=Dungeon> Black like the back of my eyes. But darker. Get these things out of my head!
String.Dest: <font face="$HandwrittenFont"> Jari-jari hitam berlendir. Kata-kata hitam berlendir. Buku hitam berlendir. <alias=Dungeon> Hitam seperti bagian belakang mataku. Tapi lebih gelap. Keluarkan hal-hal ini dari kepalaku!
Anda tidak dapat memanggil Karstaag di sini.
