String.Source:
[pagebreak]

The Anticipations

[pagebreak]

he Daedra are powerful ancestor spirits, similar in form and substance to the Tribunal (Blessed Be Their Holy Names), but weaker in power, and more arbitrary and removed from the affairs of mortals. In old times, the Chimer worshiped the Daedra as gods. But they did not deserve this veneration, for the Daedra harm their worshippers as often as help them. The Advent of the Tribunal (Blessed Be Their Holy Names) changed this unhappy state. By the Apotheosis, the Tribunal (Blessed Be Their Holy Names) became the Protectors and High Ancestor Spirits of the Dunmer, and bade the Daedra to give proper veneration and obedience. The Three Good Daedra, Boethiah, Azura, and Mephala, recognized the Divinity of the Triune Ancestors (Blessed Be Their Holy Names). The Rebel Daedra, Molag Bal, Malacath, Sheogorath, and Mehrunes Dagon, refused to swear fealty to the Tribunal (Blessed Be Their Holy Names), and their worshippers were cast out. These Rebel Daedra thus became the Four Corners of the House of Troubles, and they continue to plague our tranquility and tempt the unwary into Heresy and Dark Worship. The Priests of the Temple remain ever vigilant for signs of the Adversaries' return, sometimes aided by the loyal Three Good Daedra, who are familiar with the wiles of their rebellious kin. The Good Daedra are known to the Temple as the Anticipations, since they are the early ancestral anticipations of the loving patronage of the Tribunal. The Anticipations are the Daedra Lords Boethiah, Mephala, and Azura. Boethiah is the Anticipation of Almalexia but male to her female. Boethiah was the ancestor who illuminated the elves ages ago before the Mythic Era. He told them the truth of Lorkhan's test, and defeated Auriel's champion, Trinimac. Boethiah ate Trinimac and voided him. The followers of Boethiah and Trinimac rubbed the soil of Trinimac upon themselves and changed their skins. Mephala is the Anticipation of Vivec, but manifold and androgynous. Mephala taught the Chimer to evade their enemies or kill them with secret murder. Enemies were numerous in those days since the Chimer were a small with enemies on all sides. Mephala organized the clan systems that eventually became the Great Houses. Later, Mephala created the Morag Tong. Azura is the Anticipation of Sotha Sil, but female to his male. Azura was the ancestor who taught the Chimer how to be different from the Altmer. Her teachings are sometimes attributed to Boethiah. In the stories, Azura is often encountered more as a communal progenitor of the race as a whole rather than as an individual ancestor. She is associated with Dusk and Dawn, and is sometimes called the Mother Soul. Azura's Star, also called the Twilight Star, appears briefly at dawn and dusk low on the horizon below the constellation of the Steed. Azura is associated with mystery and magic, fate and prophecy.
String.Dest:
[pagebreak]

The Anticipations

[pagebreak]

Daedra adalah roh leluhur yang kuat, serupa dalam bentuk dan substansi dengan Tribunal (Blessed Be Their Holy Names), namun lebih lemah dalam kekuatan, serta lebih sewenang‑wenang dan terasing dari urusan makhluk fana. Pada zaman dahulu, Chimer menyembah Daedra sebagai dewa. Namun mereka tidak layak mendapatkan pemujaan tersebut, karena Daedra menyakiti penyembahnya sesering mereka membantu. Kedatangan Tribunal (Blessed Be Their Holy Names) mengubah keadaan yang tidak bahagia ini. Dengan Apoteosis, Tribunal (Blessed Be Their Holy Names) menjadi Pelindung dan Roh Leluhur Tinggi bagi Dunmer, dan memerintahkan Daedra untuk memberikan penghormatan dan ketaatan yang tepat. Tiga Daedra Baik, Boethiah, Azura, dan Mephala, mengakui Keilahian dari Tiga Leluhur (Blessed Be Their Holy Names). Daedra Pemberontak, Molag Bal, Malacath, Sheogorath, dan Mehrunes Dagon, menolak bersumpah setia kepada Tribunal (Blessed Be Their Holy Names), dan penyembah mereka diusir. Daedra Pemberontak ini kemudian menjadi Empat Penjuru The House of Troubles, dan mereka terus mengganggu ketenangan kami serta menggoda yang tidak waspada ke dalam Bid'ah dan Penyembahan Gelap. Pendeta‑Pendeta Kuil tetap waspada terhadap tanda‑tanda kembalinya Musuh‑musuh, terkadang dibantu oleh Tiga Daedra Baik yang setia, yang mengenal kelicikan kerabat pemberontak mereka. Daedra Baik dikenal oleh Kuil sebagai The Anticipations, karena mereka adalah antisipasi leluhur awal dari patronase penuh kasih Tribunal. The Anticipations adalah Daedra Lords Boethiah, Mephala, dan Azura. Boethiah adalah Antisipasi Almalexia namun berjenis kelamin laki‑laki terhadap dia yang perempuan. Boethiah adalah leluhur yang menerangi bangsa elf ratusan tahun yang lalu sebelum Era Mistik. Dia memberi tahu mereka kebenaran tentang ujian Lorkhan, dan mengalahkan juara Auriel, Trinimac. Boethiah memakan Trinimac dan mengosongkannya. The Followers milik Boethiah dan Trinimac menggosok tanah Trinimac pada diri mereka dan mengubah kulit mereka. Mephala adalah Antisipasi Vivec, namun beranekaragam dan androgini. Mephala mengajari Chimer untuk menghindari musuh mereka atau membunuh mereka dengan pembunuhan rahasia. Musuh sangat banyak pada masa itu karena Chimer adalah kaum kecil dengan musuh di segala arah. Mephala mengorganisir sistem klan yang pada akhirnya menjadi Great Houses. Kemudian, Mephala menciptakan Morag Tong. Azura adalah Antisipasi Sotha Sil, namun berjenis kelamin perempuan terhadap dia yang laki‑laki. Azura adalah leluhur yang mengajari Chimer cara menjadi berbeda dari Altmer. Ajarannya kadang dikaitkan dengan Boethiah. Dalam cerita, Azura lebih sering ditemui sebagai progenitor komunal seluruh ras daripada sebagai leluhur individu. Dia dikaitkan dengan Senja dan Fajar, dan kadang disebut sebagai Jiwa Ibu. Bintang Azura, yang juga disebut Bintang Senja, muncul sesaat pada fajar dan senja rendah di cakrawala di bawah rasi bintang Kuda. Azura berhubungan dengan misteri dan sihir, takdir dan ramalan.

String.Source: I agreed to fund Ralis Sedarys' expedition to excavate Kolbjorn Barrow, but work on the site has stopped. Most of the miners were killed by another wave of Draugr attacks, and two more are unaccounted for.
String.Dest: Saya setuju untuk mendanai ekspedisi Ralis Sedarys dalam menggali Kolbjorn Barrow, tetapi pekerjaan di lokasi itu telah terhenti. Sebagian besar penambang tewas akibat gelombang serangan Draugr yang lain, dan dua orang lagi tidak dapat ditemukan.

String.Source: Your Wards are <25>% less effective, but absorb <50>% of the magicka from incoming spells.
String.Dest: Ward-mu kurang efektif <25>%, tetapi menyerap <50>% magicka dari spells yang masuk.

String.Source: I agreed to continue funding Ralis Sedarys' excavation of Kolbjorn Barrow. He told me to return in a few days to see how work was progressing.

String.Source:
[pagebreak]

Bone, Part I By Tavi Dromio

[pagebreak] "It seems to me," said Garaz, thoughtfully looking into the depths of his flin. "That all great ideas come from pure happenstance. Take for instance, the story I told you last night about my cousin. If he hadn't fallen off that horse, he never would have become one of the Empire's foremost alchemists." It was late one Middas night at the King's Ham, and the regulars were always especially inclined toward philosophy. "I disagree," replied Xiomara, firmly but politely. "Great ideas and inventions are most often formed slowly over time by diligence and hard work. If you'll recall my tale from last month, the young lady -- who I assure you is based on a real person -- only recognized her one true love after she had slept with practically everyone in Northpoint." "I put it to you that neither is the case," said Hallgerd, pouring a topper on his mug of greef. "The greatest inventions are created by extraordinary need. Must I remind you of the story I told some time ago about Arslic Oan and the invention of bonemold?" "The problem with your theory is that your example is entirely fictional," sniffed Xiomara. "I don't believe I remember the story of Arslic Oan and the invention of bonemold," frowned Garaz. "Are you sure you told us?" "Well, this happened many, many, many years ago, when Vvardenfell was a beauteous green land, when Dunmer were Chimer and Dwemer and Nord lived together in relative peace when they weren't trying to kill one another," Hallgerd relaxed in his chair, warming to his theme. "When the sun and moons all hung in the sky together--" "Lord, Mother, and Wizard!" grumbled Xiomara. "If I'm going to be forced to hear your ridiculous story again, pray don't embellish and make it any longer than it has to be." This all happened in Vvardenfell quite some time ago (said Hallgerd, ignoring Xiomara's interruption with admirable restraint) during an era of a king you would never have heard of. Arslic Oan was one of this king's nobles and very, very disagreeable fellow. Because of his allegiance to the crown, the king had felt the need to grant him a castle and land, but he didn't necessarily want him as a neighbor so the land he granted was far from civilization. Right in an area of Vvardenfell that is, even today, not quite civilized to this day. Arslic Oan built a walled stronghold and settled down with his unhappy slaves to enjoy a quiet if somewhat grim life. It was not long before his stronghold's integrity was tested. A tribe of cannibalistic Nords had been living in the valley for some time, mostly dining on one another, but occasionally foraging what they liked to call dark meat, the Dunmer. Xiomara laughed with appreciation. "Marvelous! I don't remember that from before. It's funny how you don't hear much about the Nords' rampant cannibalism nowadays." This was obviously, as I've said, quite some time ago (said Hallgerd, glaring at part of his audience with civil malevolence) and things were in many ways quite different. These cannibalistic Nords began attacking Arslic Oan's slaves in the fields, and then slowly grew bolder, until they held the very stronghold itself under siege. They were quite a fearsome sight you can imagine: a horde of wild-eyed men and women with dagger-like teeth filed to tear flesh, wielding massive clubs, cloaked only in the skins of their victims. Arslic Oan assumed that if he ignored them, they'd go away. Unfortunately, the first thing that the Nords did was to poison the stream that carried water into the walled stronghold. All the livestock and most of the slaves died very quickly before this was discovered. There was no hope of rescue, at least for several months when the king's emissaries would come reluctantly to visit the disagreeable vassal. The next closest source of water was on the other side of the hill, so Arslic Oan sent three of his slaves with empty jugs to bring some back. They were beaten with clubs and eaten before they were a few feet outside the stronghold gates. The next group he sent through he gave sticks to defend themselves. They made it a few feet farther, but were also overwhelmed, beaten, and devoured. It was obvious that better personal defensive was required. Arslic Oan went to talk to his armorer, one of his few slaves with specific talents and duties. "The slaves need armor if they're going to make it to the river and back," he said. "Collect every scrap of steel and iron you can find, every hinge, knife, ring, cup, everything that isn't needed to keep the walls sturdy, smelt it, and give me the most and the best armor you can, very, very quickly." The armorer, whose name was Gorkith, was used to Arslic Oan's demands, and knew that there could be no compromise on the quality and quantity of the armor, or the speed at which he worked. He labored for thirty hours without a break - and, recall, without any water to slake his thirst as he struggled with the kiln and anvil - until finally, he had six suits of mixed-metal armor. Six slaves were chosen, clad in the armor, and sent with jars to collect river water. At first, the mission progressed well. The Nord attacked the armored slaves with their clubs, but they continued their march forward, warding off the blows. Gradually, however, the slaves seemed to be walking uncertainly, dazed by the endless barrage. Eventually, one by one, they fell, the armor was peeled from their bodies, and they were eaten. "The slaves couldn't move quickly enough in that heavy armor you made," said Arslic Oan to Gorkith. "I need you to collect all the cadavers of the poisoned livestock, strip their skin, and give me the most and the best leather armor you can, very, very quickly." Gorklith did as he was told, though it was a particularly repulsive task given the rancid state of the livestock. Normally it takes quite a time to treat and cure leather, so I understand, but Gorklith worked at it tirelessly, and in a half a day he had twelve suits of leather armor. Twelve slaves were chosen, clad in the armor, and sent with jars to collect river water. They progressed, at first, much better than the earlier expedition. Two fell almost immediately, but the others had some luck out-maneuvering their assailants while deflecting an occasional blow of the club. Several got to the river, three were able to fill up their jars, and one fellow very nearly made it back to the stronghold gates. Alas, he fell and was eaten. The Nords possessed a remarkably healthy appetite. "What we need before I completely run out of slaves," said Arslic Oan thoughtfully to Gorkith. "Is an armor sturdier than leather but lighter than metal." The armorer had already considered that and taken stock of the materials available. He had thought about doing something with stone or wood, but there were practical problems with demolishing more of the stronghold. The next most prevalent stuff present in the stronghold was skinned dead bodies, hunks of muscle, fat, blood, and bone. For six hours, he toiled relentlessly until he produced eighteen suits of bonemold, the first ones ever created. Arslic Oan was somewhat dubious at the sight (and smell) but he was very thirsty, and willing to sacrifice another eighteen slaves if necessary. "Might I suggest," Gorklith queried tremulously, "Having the slaves practice moving about in the armor, here in the courtyard, before sending them to face the Nords?" Arslic Oan coolly allowed it, and for a few hours, the slaves wandered about the stronghold courtyard in their suits of bonemold. They grew used to the give of the joints, the rigidity of the backplate, the weight pushed onto their shoulders and hips. They discovered how to plant their feet slightly askew to keep their balance steady; how to quickly turn, pivoting without falling down; how to break into a run and stop quickly. By the time they were sent out of the castle gates, they were easily very nearly almost amateurs in the use of their medium weight armor. Seventeen of them were killed and eaten, but one made it back with a jar of water. "It's perfect nonsense," said Xiomara. "But my point is still valid even so. Like all great inventors, even in fiction, the armorer worked diligently to create the bonemold." "I think there was a good deal of happenstance as well," frowned Garaz. "But it is an appalling story. I wish you hadn't told me." "If you think that's appalling," grinned Hallgerd. "You should hear what happened next."
String.Dest:
[pagebreak]

Bone, Part I By Tavi Dromio

[pagebreak] "Sepertinya bagi saya," kata Garaz, memandang dalam ke dalam flin-nya dengan penuh pemikiran. "Semua ide besar muncul dari kebetulan murni. Contohnya, cerita yang saya ceritakan semalam tentang sepupu saya. Jika dia tidak jatuh dari kuda itu, dia tidak akan pernah menjadi salah satu alkemis terkemuka di Kekaisaran." Malam itu sudah larut pada suatu malam Middas di King's Ham, dan para pelanggan tetap selalu cenderung ke arah filsafat. "Saya tidak setuju," balas Xiomara, dengan tegas namun sopan. "Ide-ide besar dan penemuan biasanya terbentuk perlahan seiring waktu melalui ketekunan dan kerja keras. Jika Anda ingat cerita saya bulan lalu, gadis muda — yang saya yakinkan berbasis pada orang nyata — baru menyadari satu cinta sejatinya setelah ia tidur dengan hampir semua orang di Northpoint." "Saya berpendapat bahwa tidak ada yang benar," kata Hallgerd sambil menuangkan topper ke dalam mug greef-nya. "Penemuan terbesar diciptakan oleh kebutuhan yang luar biasa. Haruskah saya mengingatkan Anda pada cerita yang saya sampaikan dulu tentang Arslic Oan dan penemuan bonemold?" "Masalah pada teori Anda adalah contoh Anda sepenuhnya fiktif," celetuk Xiomara. "Saya rasa saya tidak ingat cerita tentang Arslic Oan dan penemuan bonemold," Garaz mengerutkan kening. "Apakah Anda yakin sudah menceritakannya kepada kami?" "Yah, ini terjadi bertahun-tahun yang lalu, ketika Vvardenfell masih merupakan tanah hijau yang indah, ketika Dunmer adalah Chimer dan Dwemer serta Nord hidup bersama dalam damai relatif ketika mereka tidak berusaha saling membunuh," Hallgerd bersantai di kursinya, memanaskan tema pembicaraannya. "Ketika matahari dan bulan semua tergantung di langit bersama--" "Tuhan, Ibu, dan Penyihir!" gerutu Xiomara. "Jika saya harus lagi mendengar cerita konyol Anda, tolong jangan memperpanjangnya lebih dari yang diperlukan." Semua ini terjadi di Vvardenfell cukup lama yang lalu (kata Hallgerd, mengabaikan interupsi Xiomara dengan pengekangan yang mengagumkan) pada masa seorang raja yang tidak pernah Anda dengar. Arslic Oan adalah salah satu bangsawan raja itu dan sangat, sangat tidak menyenangkan. Karena kesetiaannya pada mahkota, raja merasa perlu memberinya sebuah kastil dan tanah, namun dia tidak benar‑benar menginginkannya menjadi tetangga, sehingga tanah yang diberikan berada jauh dari peradaban. Tepat di sebuah wilayah Vvardenfell yang, hingga kini, masih belum sepenuhnya beradab. Arslic Oan membangun benteng berdinding dan menetap bersama budak‑budaknya yang tidak bahagia untuk menikmati hidup yang tenang meski suram. Tidak lama kemudian integritas bentengnya diuji. Sebuah suku Nord kanibal telah tinggal di lembah itu selama beberapa waktu, kebanyakan memakan sesama mereka, namun kadang‑kadang berburu apa yang mereka sebut daging gelap, yaitu Dunmer. Xiomara tertawa sambil menghargai. "Luar biasa! Saya tidak mengingat itu sebelumnya. Lucu bagaimana sekarang kita jarang mendengar tentang kanibalisme meluas para Nord." Hal ini jelas, seperti yang saya katakan, terjadi lama sekali (kata Hallgerd, menatap sebagian audiensnya dengan kebencian sipil), dan segalanya dalam banyak hal berbeda. Para Nord kanibal ini mulai menyerang budak‑budak Arslic Oan di ladang, lalu perlahan menjadi lebih berani, hingga mereka mengepung benteng itu sendiri. Anda dapat membayangkan pemandangan menakutkan itu: gerombolan pria dan wanita bermata liar dengan gigi tajam seperti belati, siap merobek daging, memegang tongkat besar, berbalut hanya kulit korban mereka. Arslic Oan menganggap bahwa jika ia mengabaikan mereka, mereka akan pergi. Sayangnya, hal pertama yang dilakukan para Nord adalah memeracuni aliran sungai yang memasok air ke benteng berdinding. Semua ternak dan sebagian besar budak mati sangat cepat sebelum hal ini terdeteksi. Tidak ada harapan untuk Rescue, setidaknya selama beberapa bulan sampai utusan raja datang dengan enggan mengunjungi vasal yang tidak menyenangkan itu. Sumber air terdekat berikutnya berada di seberang bukit, sehingga Arslic Oan mengirim tiga budaknya dengan kendi kosong untuk mengambil air. Mereka dipukuli dengan tongkat dan dimakan sebelum mereka berada beberapa kaki di luar gerbang benteng. Kelompok berikutnya yang ia kirim, ia beri tongkat untuk membela diri. Mereka berhasil menempuh beberapa kaki lagi, namun juga kewalahan, dipukuli, dan dimakan. Jelas bahwa perlindungan pribadi yang lebih baik diperlukan. Arslic Oan pergi berbicara dengan pembuat bajunya, salah satu budak sedikit yang memiliki bakat dan tugas khusus. "Budak‑budak memerlukan baju besi jika mereka akan pergi ke sungai dan kembali," katanya. "Kumpulkan setiap serpihan baja dan besi yang kamu temukan, setiap engsel, pisau, cincin, cangkir, segala sesuatu yang tidak diperlukan untuk menjaga ketahanan dinding, leburkan, dan beri saya baju zirah paling banyak dan terbaik yang kamu bisa, sangat, sangat cepat." Pembuat baju zirah, yang bernama Gorkith, terbiasa dengan tuntutan Arslic Oan, dan tahu bahwa tidak ada kompromi pada kualitas dan kuantitas baju zirah, atau kecepatan kerjanya. Ia bekerja selama tiga puluh jam tanpa istirahat — dan, ingat, tanpa air untuk menghilangkan dahaga saat ia berjuang dengan tungku dan landasan — sampai akhirnya ia memiliki enam set baju zirah campuran logam. Enam budak dipilih, mengenakan baju zirah, dan dikirim dengan kendi untuk mengumpulkan air sungai. Pada awalnya misi berjalan baik. Nord menyerang budak bersenjata dengan tongkat mereka, namun mereka terus maju, menangkis pukulan. Namun secara bertahap, budak‑budak tampak berjalan ragu, kebingungan oleh serangan tak henti. Akhirnya, satu per satu mereka jatuh, baju zirah dilepaskan dari tubuh mereka, dan mereka dimakan. "Budak‑budak tidak dapat bergerak cukup cepat dengan baju zirah berat yang kamu buat," kata Arslic Oan kepada Gorkith. "Aku membutuhkanmu mengumpulkan semua mayat ternak yang teracuni, menguliti mereka, dan memberiku baju zirah kulit paling banyak dan terbaik yang kamu bisa, sangat, sangat cepat." Gorkith melakukan apa yang diperintahkan, meskipun itu tugas yang sangat menjijikkan mengingat keadaan ternak yang busuk. Biasanya diperlukan waktu cukup lama untuk mengolah dan mengawetkan kulit, saya mengerti, tetapi Gorkith bekerja tanpa lelah, dan setengah hari kemudian ia memiliki dua belas set baju zirah kulit. Duabelas budak dipilih, mengenakan baju zirah, dan dikirim dengan kendi untuk mengumpulkan air sungai. Mereka maju, pada awalnya, jauh lebih baik daripada ekspedisi sebelumnya. Dua jatuh hampir seketika, tetapi yang lain beruntung mengelak penyerang sambil menangkis sekilas pukulan tongkat. Beberapa mencapai sungai, tiga dapat mengisi kendi mereka, dan satu orang hampir sampai kembali ke gerbang benteng. Sayangnya, ia jatuh dan dimakan. Para Nord memiliki selera makan yang luar biasa sehat. "Apa yang kita butuhkan sebelum saya kehabisan budak sepenuhnya," kata Arslic Oan dengan bijak kepada Gorkith. "Adalah baju zirah yang lebih kuat dari kulit namun lebih ringan dari logam." Pembuat baju zirah sudah mempertimbangkan hal itu dan menghitung bahan yang tersedia. Ia berpikir membuat sesuatu dari batu atau kayu, namun ada masalah praktis dalam merobohkan lebih banyak bagian benteng. Bahan paling melimpah berikutnya di benteng adalah mayat yang dikupas, potongan otot, lemak, darah, dan tulang. Selama enam jam ia bekerja tanpa henti hingga menghasilkan delapan belas set bonemold, yang pertama kali pernah dibuat. Arslic Oan agak ragu melihat (dan mencium) benda itu, tetapi ia sangat haus, dan bersedia mengorbankan sebelas belas budak lagi jika perlu. "Bolehkah saya menyarankan," tanya Gorkith dengan gemetar, "Agar budak‑budak berlatih bergerak dengan baju zirah di halaman sini, sebelum dikirim menghadapi para Nord?" Arslic Oan dengan tenang mengizinkannya, dan selama beberapa jam budak‑budak berkeliaran di halaman benteng dengan set bonemold mereka. Mereka terbiasa dengan gerakan sendi, kekakuan pelat belakang, beban yang ditekan pada bahu dan pinggul. Mereka menemukan cara menapak sedikit miring untuk menjaga keseimbangan; cara berputar cepat tanpa terjatuh; cara berlari dan berhenti dengan cepat. Saat mereka dikirim keluar gerbang kastil, mereka hampir menjadi amatir dalam penggunaan baju zirah berat menengah itu. Tujuh belas dari mereka terbunuh dan dimakan, tetapi satu berhasil kembali dengan sebuah kendi berisi air. "Itu omong kosong yang sempurna," kata Xiomara. "Namun poin saya tetap berlaku. Seperti semua penemu hebat, bahkan dalam fiksi, pembuat baju zirah bekerja keras untuk menciptakan bonemold." "Saya pikir ada cukup banyak kebetulan juga," gerut Garaz. "Namun ini adalah cerita mengerikan. Saya harap Anda tidak memberitahukannya kepada saya." "Jika Anda menganggap itu mengerikan," tersenyum Hallgerd. "Anda harus mendengar apa yang terjadi selanjutnya."

String.Source: Ralis Sedarys came to Solstheim hoping to find the Relics of Ahzidal and release their maker from his imprisonment in Kolbjorn Barrow. When he found the barrow buried by the ash, he convinced me to fund its excavation, using the miners as blood sacrifices for his rituals. I saw through his lies and killed him for his crimes.
String.Dest: Ralis Sedarys datang ke Solstheim dengan harapan menemukan Relik Ahzidal dan membebaskan pembuatnya dari penjara di Kolbjorn Barrow. Ketika ia menemukan barrow yang terkubur oleh abu, ia meyakinkanku untuk mendanai penggalian itu, menggunakan para penambang sebagai korban darah untuk ritusnya. Aku melihat kebenaran di balik kebohongannya dan membunuhnya atas kejahatannya.

String.Source: Sapphire Gem Albino Spider Pod
String.Dest: Permata Safir Laba-Laba Albino

String.Source: Ralis Sedarys came to Solstheim hoping to find the Relics of Ahzidal and release their maker from his imprisonment in Kolbjorn Barrow. When he found the barrow buried by the ash, he convinced me to fund its excavation, using the miners as blood sacrifices for his rituals. I saw through his lies and decided to kill him for his crimes.
String.Dest: Ralis Sedarys datang ke Solstheim dengan harapan menemukan Relik Ahzidal dan membebaskan penciptanya dari penjara di Kolbjorn Barrow. Ketika ia menemukan barrow yang terkubur oleh abu, ia meyakinkan saya untuk mendanai penggalian tersebut, menggunakan para penambang sebagai korban darah untuk ritualnya. Saya melihat kebenaran di balik kebohongannya dan memutuskan untuk membunuhnya atas kejahatannya.

String.Source: I agreed to continue funding Ralis Sedarys' ill-fated excavation of Kolbjorn Barrow, but when I returned to his mining camp, I found only blood and corpses. Ralis himself was nowhere to be seen.
String.Dest: Saya setuju untuk terus mendanai penggalian malang Ralis Sedarys di Barrow Kolbjorn, tetapi ketika saya kembali ke kamp tambangnya, saya hanya menemukan darah dan mayat. Ralis sendiri tidak terlihat sama sekali.

String.Source: I agreed to continue funding Ralis Sedarys' excavation of Kolbjorn Barrow. I should return and see how the work is going.
String.Dest: Saya setuju untuk terus mendanai penggalian Ralis Sedarys di Barrow Kolbjorn. Saya harus kembali dan melihat bagaimana pekerjaan itu berjalan.

String.Source: I agreed to continue funding Ralis Sedarys' excavation of Kolbjorn Barrow. He told me to return in a few days to see how work was progressing.
String.Dest: Saya setuju untuk terus mendanai penggalian Ralis Sedarys di Barrow Kolbjorn. Dia menyuruh saya kembali dalam beberapa hari untuk melihat bagaimana pekerjaan berkembang.

String.Source: I agreed to continue funding Ralis Sedarys' excavation of Kolbjorn Barrow, but Draugr have attacked the miners again, and only a few managed to escape. Ralis asked if I could wipe them out so the excavation could continue.
String.Dest: Saya setuju untuk terus membiayai penggalian Kolbjorn Barrow oleh Ralis Sedarys, tetapi Draugr telah menyerang penambang lagi, dan hanya beberapa yang berhasil melarikan diri. Ralis menanyakan apakah saya dapat menghabisi mereka agar penggalian dapat dilanjutkan.

String.Source: A vision of Solstheim swims before your eyes and then is gone.
String.Dest: Sebuah visi tentang Solstheim melayang di depan matamu, lalu menghilang.

String.Source: I agreed to fund Ralis Sedarys' expedition to excavate Kolbjorn Barrow, but the ongoing Draugr attacks means he needs more gold in order to hire more miners and guards to protect them.
String.Dest: Saya setuju untuk mendanai ekspedisi Ralis Sedarys mengekstrak Kolbjorn Barrow, namun serangan Draugr yang terus-menerus berarti dia membutuhkan lebih banyak emas untuk mempekerjakan lebih banyak penambang dan penjaga demi melindungi mereka.

String.Source: I agreed to fund Ralis Sedarys' expedition to excavate Kolbjorn Barrow, but work on the site has stopped. At his request, I dealt with the Draugr and found the bodies of the missing miners.
String.Dest: Saya setuju untuk mendanai ekspedisi Ralis Sedarys untuk menggali Barrow Kolbjorn, tetapi pekerjaan di lokasi telah terhenti. Atas permintaannya, saya menangani Draugr dan menemukan mayat para penambang yang hilang.

String.Source: I agreed to fund Ralis Sedarys' expedition to excavate Kolbjorn Barrow, but work on the dig has come to a halt. The excavation had reached a dead end when Draugr within the tomb awoke, killing several miners and causing the rest to flee. I defeated the Draugr, but now need to find a way past the dead end.
String.Dest: Saya setuju untuk mendanai ekspedisi Ralis Sedarys guna menggali Kolbjorn Barrow, tetapi pekerjaan penggalian telah terhenti. Penggalian itu mencapai jalan buntu ketika Draugr di dalam makam bangun, menewaskan beberapa penambang dan membuat sisanya melarikan diri. Saya mengalahkan Draugr, namun kini harus menemukan cara melewati jalan buntu tersebut.

String.Source: I agreed to fund Ralis Sedarys' expedition to excavate Kolbjorn Barrow, but work on the dig has come to a halt. The excavation had reached a dead end when Draugr within the tomb awoke, killing several miners and causing the rest to flee.
String.Dest: Saya setuju untuk mendanai ekspedisi Ralis Sedarys menggali Kolbjorn Barrow, namun pekerjaan penggalian telah terhenti. Penggalian itu mencapai jalan buntu ketika Draugr di dalam makam itu bangkit, menewaskan beberapa penambang dan membuat sisanya melarikan diri.

String.Source: I agreed to fund Ralis Sedarys' expedition to excavate Kolbjorn Barrow. I should visit the site and see how the work is going.
String.Dest: Saya setuju untuk mendanai ekspedisi Ralis Sedarys untuk menggali Barrow Kolbjorn. Saya harus mengunjungi situsnya dan melihat bagaimana kemajuan pekerjaannya.

String.Source: Ralis Sedarys came to Solstheim in search of the Relics of Ahzidal, powerful items said to have been sealed in Kolbjorn Barrow, but found it buried by ash. I agreed to fund his expedition to excavate the Barrow. He set to work, saying he'd send a courier when he had progress to report.
String.Dest: Ralis Sedarys datang ke Solstheim untuk mencari Relik Ahzidal, items kuat yang konon telah disegel di Kolbjorn Barrow, namun menemukan bahwa relik tersebut terkubur oleh abu. Aku setuju untuk mendanai ekspedisinya menggali Barrow itu. Dia mulai bekerja, berkata bahwa dia akan mengirim kurir saat memiliki kemajuan untuk dilaporkan.

String.Source: Outside Kolbjorn Barrow, I met Ralis Sedarys, an explorer who came to Solstheim in search of relics within the barrow. But when he arrived, he found it buried by the ash. He had all but given up on excavating it, but if I can supply the funds, he offered to make me a partner in his expedition.
String.Dest: Di luar Barrow Kolbjorn, saya bertemu Ralis Sedarys, seorang penjelajah yang datang ke Solstheim untuk mencari relik di dalam barrow. Namun ketika ia tiba, ia menemukan barrow itu terkubur oleh abu. Ia hampir menyerah menggali, tetapi jika saya dapat menyediakan dana, ia menawarkan untuk menjadikan saya mitra dalam ekspedisinya.

String.Source:
[pagebreak]

The Poison Song Book VI By Bristin Xel The magnificent sprawl of the stronghold of Indoranyon was aglow in the light of the setting sun. Commander Jasrat watched it slowly disappear into the horizon as he led the caravan southwestward. It was a strange practice for him to lead a night operation, but scarcely more bizarre than anything else he was facing. He was only seventy years of age, far from old for a Bosmer, and yet he felt like he belonged to another era. He had known the land of east Vvardenfell his entire life. Every forest, every garden, every small village between Red Mountain and the Sea of Ghosts had been home to him. But now it was all different, twisted into a world he did not recognize since the eruption and the year of Sun's Death. It made night travel all the more treacherous, but it was a risk he was ordered to take. The ashmire appeared quite suddenly. If a sharp-sighted scout hadn't seen it and given the signal, the entire caravan might have been swallowed whole. Jasrat cursed. It had not been on the map, but that was hardly surprising. It was a huge unnamed scathe stretching as far as anyone could see. The commander considered his options. He might lead his party to the southeast toward Tel Aruhn and then try an approach due west. As he consulted his map, he noticed a glimmer of a campfire in the distance. Accompanied by his lieutenants, Jasrat drove his guar forward to investigate what appeared to be an Ashlander man and woman. "This is no longer your realm," he bellowed. "Don't you know it's been ruled by the Temple that these are House lands now?" The couple shuffled to their feet, and began quietly walking away, toward a narrow ridge between hill and ashmire. Jasrat called them back. "Do you know a way around the scathe?" he asked. They nodded, their eyes still to the ground. Jasrat signaled to his caravan. "You will lead us then." It was a treacherous winding crossing, almost too tight for the guars. The wagons themselves scraped as the drivers pulled to avoid the ashmire. The Ashlander man and woman whispered to one another as they led the caravan. "What are you mumbling about, n'wah?" Jasrat hollered. The man did not turn around. "My sister and I were talking about the Dagoth rebellion, and she was guessing that you were bringing arms to the stronghold at Falensarano, which is why you chose to cross the ashmire rather than taking a road." "I might have known," Jasrat laughed. "You Ashlanders are so hopeful whenever you see signs of trouble in the Houses and the Temple. I hate to dampen your spirits, but what you're speaking of is hardly a rebellion. Merely a few isolated incidents of... unpleasantness. Tell your sister that." As they plodded onward, the narrow ridge began to taper even more. The Ashlanders found a low jagged crevasse in the hills, a crack from a lava flow even predating Sun's Death. The caravan scored the rock walls at it moved through. Commander Jasrat, after twenty years of uncertainty in a land he did not understand, felt a twinge of his old instinct. This, he thought to himself, would be a fine place for an ambush. "Ashlander, how close are we?" he shouted. "We've arrived," Dagoth-Tython replied, and gave the signal. The assault was over in mere minutes, as it had been calculated from the start. When the last body of the House guard had sunk beneath the ashmire, only then was the inventory of the caravan revealed. It was better than they had hoped, virtually everything the rebellion needed. Daedric swords, dozens of suits of armor, quivers of fine ebony bolts, and rations enough to last for weeks. "Go on ahead to the camp," Tython smiled at his sister. "I'll lead the caravan. We should be there within a few hours' time." Acra kissed him passionately, and gave the sign of Recall. In an instant, she was back in her tent, exactly as she had left it. Humming the Song, she removed the Ashlander rags and chose an appropriately diaphanous gown from her trunks. Precisely the sort of dress Tython would love seeing her in when he returned. "Muorasa!" she called to her servant. "Summon the troops together! Tython and the others will be here very soon with all the weapons and rations we need!" "Muorasa can't hear you now," said a voice Acra hadn't heard in weeks. She turned, expertly removed every trace of surprise from her face. It was indeed Indoril-Baynarah, but not the quivering creature she had left behind at the massacre at Sandil House. This woman was an armored warrior, who spoke with mocking confidence. "She wouldn't be able to summon the troops if she could. You may have weapons and rations, Acra, but there's no one left to arm or feed." Dagoth-Acra made the sign of Recall, but nothing happened. "The moment we heard you banging around in the tent, my battlemages cast a diffusion of all magicka," Baynara smiled, opening the tent further to invite a dozen House soldiers in. "You won't be leaving." "If you think that my brother will walk into your trap, you underestimate his allegiance to the Song," Acra sneered. "It tells him everything he needs to know. I have convinced him to no longer fight it, and let it lead him and us to our ultimate victory." "I've known him longer and better than you ever did," said Baynarah coldly. "Now, I want to hear what the Song is saying to you. I want to know where I can find Tay." "Tython, my lady," Acra corrected her. "He is no longer a slave to your House and the Temple's lies. You can torture me all you wish, but I swear to you the next time you see him, it will be because he wishes it, not you. And that will be your very last moment alive." "Don't you worry, serjo," Baynarah's nightblade winked at her. "Everyone says they won't break under torture, but everyone always does." Baynarah left the tent. It was all a part of warfare, she understood that, but there would be little relish in witnessing it. She could not even watch as the House soldiers disposed of the rebel corpses. She had hoped she would grow numb to the bloodshed after weeks of following Tython and Acra, massacre after massacre. It didn't matter to her that now the bodies were of her enemies. Death was still death. She had only been in her tent for a few minutes when her nightblade appeared. "Not so tough as she appeared, that one," he grinned. "In point of fact, all I had to do is ask her nice and point my dagger at her belly, and she was blubbering everything. Not too surprising really. It's always the ones that talk big that crumble fast. I remember way back a couple years ago, before you was even born -" "Garuan, what did she say?" Baynarah asked. "The Song, whatever that is, told her brother that she got herself caught, and not to return to camp," the nightblade replied, only a trifle annoyed at having his fascinating story cut short. "He's got a half dozen mer with him, and they're going to try to assassinate the fella that led the Indoril army in the War. General Indoril-Triffith." "Uncle Triffith," Baynarah gasped. "Where is he stationed now?" "I'm not sure myself, serjo. Do you want me to ask if she knows?" "I'll come with you," said Baynarah. As they walked towards Acra's tent, cries of alarm sounded. The situation became abundantly clear even before they reached the site. Three guards were dead, and the prisoner had escaped. "Interesting woman," said Garuan. "Weak heart, but a strong arm. Should we send word of warning to General Indoril-Triffith?" "If we can find where he is in time," said Baynarah.
String.Dest:
[pagebreak]

The Poison Song Book VI By Bristin Xel Bentangan megah benteng Indoranyon bersinar dalam cahaya matahari terbenam. Komandan Jasrat menyaksikannya perlahan menghilang ke cakrawala saat ia memimpin karavan ke arah barat daya. Memimpin operasi malam adalah hal yang aneh baginya, namun tidak lebih aneh daripada apa pun yang ia hadapi. Usianya baru tujuh puluh tahun, masih muda untuk seorang Bosmer, namun ia merasa seakan berasal dari era lain. Ia telah mengenal tanah timur Vvardenfell sepanjang hidupnya. Setiap hutan, setiap kebun, setiap desa kecil antara Gunung Merah dan Sea of Ghosts pernah menjadi rumahnya. Namun sekarang semuanya berbeda, terdistorsi menjadi dunia yang tak ia kenali sejak letusan dan tahun Kematian Matahari. Hal itu membuat perjalanan malam menjadi lebih berbahaya, namun itu adalah risiko yang diperintahkan kepadanya. Ashmire muncul secara tiba-tiba. Jika seorang pengintai yang tajam penglihatannya tidak melihatnya dan memberi sinyal, seluruh karavan mungkin telah tertelan habis. Jasrat memohon. Itu tidak ada di Map, namun itu tidak mengherankan. Itu adalah sebuah kegagalan besar yang tak bernama, membentang sejauh mata memandang. Komandan mempertimbangkan pilihannya. Ia mungkin memimpin pasukannya ke tenggara menuju Tel Aruhn lalu mencoba pendekatan ke barat. Saat ia berkonsultasi dengan Map, ia melihat kilau api unggun di kejauhan. Didampingi oleh letnan-letnannya, Jasrat menggerakkan guar-nya maju untuk menyelidiki apa yang tampak sebagai pria dan wanita Ashlander. "Ini bukan lagi wilayahmu," teriaknya. "Apakah kau tidak tahu bahwa wilayah ini sekarang dikuasai oleh Kuil, menjadi tanah House?" Pasangan itu bangkit dan mulai berjalan pelan menjauh, menuju punggungan sempit di antara bukit dan ashmire. Jasrat memanggil mereka kembali. "Apakah kalian tahu jalan melewati kegagalan ini?" tanyanya. Mereka mengangguk, mata tetap menunduk. Jasrat memberi isyarat kepada karavannya. "Kalian akan memimpin kami kemudian." Jalan melintasi yang berkelok berbahaya, hampir terlalu sempit untuk guars. Kereta-kereta menggores di tanah saat para pengemudi menariknya untuk menghindari ashmire. Pria dan wanita Ashlander berbisik satu sama lain sambil memimpin karavan. "Apa yang kau bisikkan, n'wah?" teriak Jasrat. Pria itu tidak menoleh. "Saudaraku dan aku sedang membicarakan pemberontakan Dagoth, dan dia menebak bahwa kalian membawa senjata ke benteng di Falensarano, itulah mengapa kalian memilih menyeberangi ashmire alih-alih mengambil jalan." "Mungkin saja aku tahu," Jasrat tertawa. "Kalian Ashlander begitu optimis setiap kali melihat tanda-tanda masalah di House dan Kuil. Aku tidak ingin meredam semangat kalian, namun apa yang kalian bicarakan bukanlah pemberontakan. Hanya beberapa insiden terisolasi yang... tidak menyenangkan. Katakan itu kepada saudaramu." Saat mereka melanjutkan, punggungan sempit mulai semakin menyempit. Para Ashlander menemukan celah rendah bergerigi di perbukitan, retakan aliran lava yang bahkan mendahului Kematian Matahari. Karavan menapaki dinding bebatuan saat melintas. Komandan Jasrat, setelah dua puluh tahun ketidakpastian di tanah yang tak ia mengerti, merasakan dorongan naluri lama. Ini, pikirnya, akan menjadi tempat yang tepat untuk penyergapan. "Ashlander, seberapa dekat kita?" teriaknya. "Kita telah tiba," jawab Dagoth-Tython, dan memberi sinyal. Serangan selesai dalam hitungan menit, sebagaimana telah dihitung sejak awal. Ketika tubuh terakhir penjaga House tenggelam di bawah ashmire, barulah inventaris karavan terungkap. Itu lebih baik dari yang mereka harapkan, hampir semua yang dibutuhkan pemberontakan. Pedang Daedric, puluhan set baju zirah, panah hitam jernih, dan persediaan makanan cukup untuk berminggu-minggu. "Pergilah dulu ke perkemahan," Tython tersenyum pada saudara perempuannya. "Aku akan memimpin karavan. Kami akan sampai dalam beberapa jam ke depan." Acra menciumnya dengan penuh gairah, dan memberi tanda Recall. Dalam sekejap, ia kembali ke tendanya, persis seperti ia meninggalkannya. Menyanyikan Lagu, ia menanggalkan kain sisa Ashlander dan memilih gaun tipis yang sesuai dari barang bawaannya. Itulah jenis gaun yang pasti Tython ingin lihat ketika ia kembali. "Muorasa!" teriaknya kepada pelayannya. "Panggil semua pasukan! Tython dan yang lainnya akan segera tiba dengan semua senjata dan persediaan yang kita butuhkan!" "Muorasa tidak dapat mendengarmu sekarang," kata suara yang tidak didengar Acra selama berminggu-minggu. Ia berbalik, dengan ahli menghilangkan segala tanda kejutan dari wajahnya. Ternyata itu memang Indoril-Baynarah, namun bukan makhluk gemetar yang ia tinggalkan pada pembantaian di Sandil House. Wanita ini adalah prajurit bersenjata, yang berbicara dengan percaya diri mengejek. "Dia tidak akan bisa memanggil pasukan bahkan jika dia bisa. Kamu mungkin memiliki senjata dan persediaan, Acra, namun tidak ada lagi yang bisa bersenjata atau memberi makan." Dagoth-Acra memberi tanda Recall, namun tidak terjadi apa-apa. "Saat kami mendengarmu berteriak-teriak di dalam tenda, para penyihir perangku menyebarkan semua magicka," Baynara tersenyum, membuka tenda lebih lebar untuk mengundang selusin prajurit House masuk. "Kau tidak akan pergi." "Jika kau berpikir saudara ku akan masuk ke dalam perangkapmu, kau meremehkan kesetiaannya pada Lagu," Acra menyindir. "Lagu memberitahunya segala yang perlu ia ketahui. Aku telah meyakinkannya untuk tidak lagi melawannya, dan membiarkannya memimpin kami menuju kemenangan akhir." "Aku telah mengenalnya lebih lama dan lebih baik daripada kau pernah," kata Baynarah dengan dingin. "Sekarang, aku ingin mendengar apa yang dikatakan Lagu kepadamu. Aku ingin tahu di mana aku bisa menemukan Tay." "Tython, nyonya," Acra memperbaiki. "Dia tidak lagi menjadi budak House-mu dan kebohongan Kuil. Kau bisa menyiksaku sesuka hati, namun aku bersumpah kepadamu, ketika kau melihatnya lagi, itu akan karena keinginannya, bukan karena kau. Dan itu akan menjadi saat terakhirmu hidup." "Jangan khawatir, serjo," Nightblade Baynarah kedipkan matanya padanya. "Semua orang berkata mereka tak akan hancur di bawah siksaan, tapi semua orang selalu melakukannya." Baynarah meninggalkan tenda. Itu semua bagian dari peperangan, ia mengerti itu, namun ia tidak akan menikmati menyaksikannya. Ia bahkan tidak dapat menonton saat prajurit House membuang mayat pemberontak. Ia berharap ia akan menjadi kebal terhadap pertumpahan darah setelah berminggu-minggu mengikuti Tython dan Acra, pembantaian demi pembantaian. Tidak penting baginya bahwa tubuh tersebut kini milik musuhnya. Kematian tetaplah kematian. Ia baru berada di dalam tendanya selama beberapa menit ketika Nightblade muncul. "Tidak sekeras yang terlihat, orang itu," dia menyeringai. "Sebenarnya, yang kulakukan hanyalah memintanya dengan sopan dan mengarahkan belati ke perutnya, dan dia langsung mengeluarkan semua. Tidak terlalu mengejutkan. Selalu yang banyak bicara yang cepat runtuh. Aku ingat banyak tahun lalu, sebelum kau lahir -" "Garuan, apa yang dia katakan?" tanya Baynarah. Nightblade menjawab, sedikit terganggu karena ceritanya terpotong. "Dia mempunyai setengah lusin mer bersamanya, dan mereka akan mencoba membunuh orang yang memimpin pasukan Indoril dalam Perang. Jenderal Indoril-Triffith." "Paman Triffith," terengah Baynarah. "Di mana dia ditempatkan sekarang?" "Aku juga tidak yakin, serjo. Apakah kau ingin aku menanyakan apakah dia tahu?" "Aku ikut bersamamu," kata Baynarah. Saat mereka berjalan menuju tenda Acra, teriakan alarm terdengar. Situasinya menjadi jelas bahkan sebelum mereka mencapai lokasi. Tiga penjaga tewas, dan tahanan melarikan diri. "Wanita menarik," kata Garuan. "Hatinya lemah, namun lengannya kuat. Apakah kita harus mengirim pesan tentang Warning ke Jenderal Indoril-Triffith?" "Jika kita dapat menemukan dimana dia berada tepat waktu," kata Baynarah.

String.Source: According to the letter I found on General Carius's remains, he appeared to be responsible for sending what he calls his "men" to attack the town of Raven Rock. I should bring this information to the guards in Raven Rock and let them know the threat has been eliminated.
String.Dest: Menurut surat yang saya temukan pada mayat Jenderal Carius, dia tampaknya bertanggung jawab atas mengirim apa yang dia sebut "men"-nya untuk menyerang kota Raven Rock. Saya harus membawa informasi ini kepada para penjaga di Raven Rock dan memberi tahu mereka bahwa ancaman telah dihilangkan.

String.Source: I've slain General Falx Carius in the ruins of Fort Frostmoth and put an end to any further ash spawn attacking Raven Rock. I should return to Captain Modyn Veleth and inform him of my victory.
String.Dest: Aku telah membunuh General Falx Carius di reruntuhan Fort Frostmoth dan menghentikan semua spawn abu yang menyerang Raven Rock. Aku harus kembali ke Kapten Modyn Veleth dan memberitahunya tentang kemenangan ini.

String.Source: With the Vendil Ulen dead and the Morag Tong eliminated, I've ended the threat to Councilor Morvayn. In appreciation for my actions, I've been awared Severin Manor and all of the contents within and deemed an honorary citizen of Raven Rock.
String.Dest: Dengan Vendil Ulen mati dan Morag Tong dibasmi, saya telah mengakhiri ancaman terhadap Konselor Morvayn. Sebagai penghargaan atas tindakan saya, saya telah diberikan Severin Manor beserta semua isinya dan dinobatkan sebagai warga kehormatan Raven Rock.

String.Source: I agreed to continue funding Ralis Sedarys' excavation of Kolbjorn Barrow, but Draugr again attacked the miners. Once again, I slew the Draugr so work could proceed.
String.Dest: Saya setuju untuk terus mendanai penggalian Ralis Sedarys di Kolbjorn Barrow, tetapi Draugr kembali menyerang para penambang. Sekali lagi, saya membunuh Draugr sehingga pekerjaan dapat berlanjut.

String.Source: I've informed Adril Arano that Tilisu Severin was the mystery vistor leaving offerings in the Ulen Ancestral Tomb. Since this is not enough evidence to accuse her of a crime, he's sending me to Severin Manor in order to uncover solid evidence that exposes Tilisu as an assassin.
String.Dest: Saya telah memberitahu Adril Arano bahwa Tilisu Severin adalah pengunjung misterius yang meninggalkan persembahan di Ulen Ancestral Tomb. Karena ini tidak cukup bukti untuk menuduhnya atas kejahatan, dia mengirim saya ke Severin Manor untuk menemukan bukti kuat yang mengungkap Tilisu sebagai pembunuh.

String.Source: Geldis Sadri has pointed out that someone is leaving ash yam offerings in the Ulen Ancestral Tomb even though no Ulens live on Solstheim. He suggests that I stake the tomb out at night and discover the identity of the mystery visitor. Hopefully this person is either the assassin himself or can lead me to the assassin threatening Councilor Morvayn's life.
String.Dest: Geldis Sadri telah menunjukkan bahwa seseorang meninggalkan persembahan abu di Ulen Ancestral Tomb meskipun tidak ada Ulens yang tinggal di Solstheim. Dia menyarankan saya mengawasi makam pada malam hari dan menemukan identitas pengunjung misterius itu. Semoga orang ini adalah pembunuh itu sendiri atau dapat menuntunku ke pembunuh yang mengancam nyawa Councilor Morvayn.

String.Source: I helped the warriors of Thirsk Mead Hall retake their home from the infestation of Rieklings. Their leader, Bujold, asked me to accompany her to Hrothmund's Barrow, where she was denied the blessings of Thirsk's founder. She expressed a desire to lead the hall anyway, and when I opposed her fraud, she became enraged. I was forced to kill her to defend myself.
String.Dest: Saya membantu para pejuang Thirsk Mead Hall merebut kembali rumah mereka dari serangan Rieklings. Pemimpin mereka, Bujold, meminta saya menemaninya ke Hrothmund's Barrow, dimana dia ditolak berkah pendiri Thirsk. Dia menyatakan keinginan untuk memimpin hall itu meskipun begitu, dan ketika saya menentang penipuannya, dia menjadi marah. Saya terpaksa membunuhnya untuk membela diri.

String.Source: I helped the warriors of Thirsk Mead Hall retake their home from the infestation of Rieklings. Their leader, Bujold, asked me to accompany her to Hrothmund's Barrow, where she was denied the blessings of Thirsk's founder. She expressed a desire to lead the hall anyway, and plans to begin a new tradition at Thirsk, focused on the present instead of the past.
String.Dest: Saya membantu para prajurit Thirsk Mead Hall merebut kembali rumah mereka dari serangan Rieklings. Pemimpin mereka, Bujold, meminta saya menemaninya ke Hrothmund's Barrow, di mana dia ditolak menerima berkat dari pendiri Thirsk. Ia menyatakan keinginan untuk tetap memimpin hall tersebut, dan berencana memulai tradisi baru di Thirsk yang berfokus pada masa kini alih-alih masa lalu.

String.Source: I helped the warriors of Thirsk Mead Hall retake their home from the infestation of Rieklings. Their leader, Bujold, has asked me to accompany her to Hrothmund's Barrow, where she hopes to receive the blessing of Thirsk's founder to continue her leadership.
String.Dest: Saya membantu para prajurit Thirsk Mead Hall merebut kembali rumah mereka dari infestasi Rieklings. Pemimpin mereka, Bujold, telah meminta saya untuk menemaninya ke Hrothmund's Barrow, di mana dia berharap menerima berkat pendiri Thirsk untuk melanjutkan kepemimpinannya.

String.Source: I helped the warriors of Thirsk Mead Hall retake their home from the infestation of Rieklings.
String.Dest: Saya membantu para prajurit Thirsk Mead Hall merebut kembali rumah mereka dari infestasi Rieklings.

String.Source: I've agreed to help the Nords from Thirsk Mead Hall take their home back from the Rieklings who have infested it.
String.Dest: Saya telah setuju membantu para Nord dari Thirsk Mead Hall merebut kembali rumah mereka dari para Rieklings yang telah menginfestasi tempat itu.

String.Source: I retrieved one of Hermaeus Mora's Black Books from <Alias=Dungeon> for Neloth.
String.Dest: Saya mengambil satu Black Books milik Hermaeus Mora dari <Alias=Dungeon> untuk Neloth.

String.Source: I met Wulf Wild-Blood, whose brother disappeared many years ago. Wulf believes he may have become a werebear, and warned me to keep an eye out for him.
String.Dest: Saya bertemu Wulf Wild-Blood, yang saudara laki‑lakinya menghilang bertahun‑tahun yang lalu. Wulf percaya bahwa dia mungkin telah menjadi werebear, dan memperingatkan saya untuk mengawasinya.

String.Source:
[pagebreak]

Where were you when the Dragon Broke? by Various

[pagebreak]

brief description and multiple accounts of the Dragon Break Corax, Cyrodiil, Elder Council: "No one understands what happened when the Selectives danced on that tower. It would be easy to dismiss the whole matter as nonsense were it not for the Amulet of Kings. Even the Elder Scrolls do not mention it -- let me correct myself, the Elder Scrolls cannot mention it. When the Moth priests attune the Scrolls to the timeless time their glyphs always disappear. The Amulet of Kings, however, with its oversoul of emperors, can speak of it at length. According to Hestra, Cyrodiil became an Empire across the stars. According to Shor-El, Cyrodiil became an egg. Most say something in a language they can only speak sideways. The Council has collected texts and accounts from all of its provinces, and they only offer stories that never coincide, save on one point: all the folk of Tamriel during the Middle Dawn, in whatever 'when' they were caught in, tracked the fall of the eight stars. And that is how they counted their days." Mehra Nabisi, Dunmer, Triune Mistress of the New Temple: "Accounts of the Middle Dawn are the province of the Empire of Men, and proof of the deceit that call themselves the Aedra. Eight stars fell on Tamriel, one for each iniquity that Lorkhan made clear to the world. Veloth read these signs, and he told Boethiah, who confirmed them, and he told Mephala, who made wards against them, and he told Azura, who sent ALMSIVI to steer the True Folk clear of harm. Even the Four Corners of the House of Troubles rose to protect the periphery of your madness. We watched our borders and saw them shift like snakes, and saw you run around in it like the spirits of old, devoid of math, without your if-thens, succumbing to the Ever Now like slaves of the slim folly, stasis. Do not ask us where we were when the Dragon Broke, for, of all the world, only we truly know, and we might just show you how to break it again." R'leyt-harhr, Khajiit, Tender to the Mane: "Do you mean, where were the Khajiit when the Dragon Broke? R'leyt tells you where: recording it. 'One thousand eight years,' you've heard it. You think the Cyro-Nordics came up with that all on their own. You humans are better thieves than even Rajhin! While you were fighting wars with phantoms and giving birth to your own fathers, it was the Mane that watched the ja-Kha'jay, because the moons were the only constant, and you didn't have the sugar to see it. We'll give you credit: you broke Alkosh something fierce, and that's not easy. Just don't think you solved what you accomplished by it, or can ever solve it. You did it again with Big Walker, not once, but twice! Once at Rimmen, which we'll never learn to live with. The second time it was in Daggerfall, or was it Sentinel, or was it Wayrest, or was it in all three places at once? Get me, Cyrodiil? When will you wake up and realize what really happened to the Dwarves?" Mannimarco, God of Worms, the Necromancers: "The Three Thieves of Morrowind could tell you where they were. So could the High King of Alinor, who was the one who broke it in the first place. There are others on this earth that could, too: Ysmir, Pelinal, Arnand the Fox or should I say Arctus? The Last Dwarf would talk, if they would let him. As for myself, I was here and there and here again, like the rest of the mortals during the Dragon Break. How do you think I learned my mystery? The Maruhkati Selectives showed us all the glories of the Dawn so that we might learn, simply: as above, so below."
String.Dest:
[pagebreak]

Di mana kamu ketika Naga Pecah? oleh Berbagai

[pagebreak]

deskripsi singkat dan banyak catatan tentang Pecahan Naga Corax, Cyrodiil, Elder Council: "Tidak ada yang mengerti apa yang terjadi ketika Para Selektif menari di atas menara itu. Akan mudah menganggap seluruh masalah ini sebagai omong kosong jika bukan karena The Amulet of Kings. Bahkan Gulungan Elder tidak menyebutkannya -- izinkan saya memperbaiki, Gulungan Elder tidak dapat menyebutkannya. Ketika para pendeta Ngengat menyelaraskan Gulungan dengan waktu yang tak terikat, glyph mereka selalu menghilang. The Amulet of Kings, bagaimanapun, dengan oversoul para kaisar, dapat berbicara panjang lebar tentangnya. Menurut Hestra, Cyrodiil menjadi sebuah Kekaisaran melintasi bintang-bintang. Menurut Shor-El, Cyrodiil menjadi sebuah telur. Kebanyakan mengucapkan sesuatu dalam bahasa yang hanya bisa mereka ucapkan secara miring. Dewan telah mengumpulkan teks dan catatan dari seluruh provinsinya, dan mereka hanya menawarkan cerita-cerita yang tidak pernah bersinggungan, kecuali pada satu titik: semua orang Tamriel selama Fajar Menengah, dalam 'kapan' apa pun yang mereka alami, melacak jatuhnya delapan bintang. Dan begitulah mereka menghitung hari-hari mereka." Mehra Nabisi, Dunmer, Triune Mistress of the New Temple: "Catatan tentang Fajar Menengah adalah wilayah Kekaisaran Manusia, dan bukti penipuan yang menyebut diri mereka Aedra. Delapan bintang jatuh di Tamriel, satu untuk setiap kejahatan yang Lorkhan tunjukkan kepada dunia. Veloth membaca tanda-tanda ini, dan dia memberitahu Boethiah, yang mengkonfirmasikannya, lalu memberitahu Mephala, yang membuat pelindung terhadapnya, lalu memberitahu Azura, yang mengirim ALMSIVI untuk menuntun Bangsa Sejati menjauh dari bahaya. Bahkan Empat Penjuru The House of Troubles bangkit untuk melindungi pinggiran kegilaanmu. Kami mengawasi perbatasan kami dan melihatnya bergeser seperti ular, serta menyaksikanmu berlarian di dalamnya seperti roh-roh kuno, tanpa matematika, tanpa 'jika-maka'mu, menyerah pada Selalu Sekarang bak budak kebodohan sempit, stagnasi. Jangan tanyakan kepada kami di mana kami berada ketika Naga Pecah, karena, dari seluruh dunia, hanya kami yang benar‑benar tahu, dan kami mungkin akan menunjukkan cara memecahkannya sekali lagi." R'leyt-harhr, Khajiit, Tender to the Mane: "Apakah maksudmu, di mana Khajiit ketika Naga Pecah? R'leyt memberitahumu: mencatatnya. 'Seribu delapan tahun,' kau telah mendengarnya. Kau berpikir orang Cyro-Nordik menciptakannya sendiri. Kalian manusia adalah pencuri yang lebih baik bahkan dibandingkan Rajhin! Sementara kalian berperang melawan hantu dan melahirkan ayah kalian sendiri, itulah Mane yang mengawasi ja‑Khaʼjay, karena bulan adalah satu-satunya hal yang konstan, dan kalian tidak memiliki gula untuk melihatnya. Kami memberi kalian pujian: kalian memecahkan Alkosh dengan sesuatu yang ganas, dan itu tidak mudah. Janganlah mengira kalian telah memecahkan apa yang kalian capai dengan itu, atau dapat memecahkannya selamanya. Kalian melakukannya lagi dengan Big Walker, bukan sekali, melainkan dua kali! Sekali di Rimmen, yang tidak akan pernah kami terima. Kali kedua terjadi di Daggerfall, atau di Sentinel, atau di Wayrest, atau di ketiga tempat sekaligus? Paparkan padaku, Cyrodiil? Kapan kalian akan terbangun dan menyadari apa yang sebenarnya terjadi pada Dwarves?" Mannimarco, God of Worms, the Necromancers: "Three Thieves dari Morrowind dapat memberitahumu di mana mereka berada. Begitu pula Raja Tinggi Alinor, yang lah yang memecahkannya pertama kali. Ada yang lain di bumi ini yang juga dapat: Ysmir, Pelinal, Arnand Rubah atau seharusnya saya menyebut Arctus? Orang Dwarf Terakhir akan berbicara, bila mereka mengizinkannya. Adapun diriku, aku berada di sini dan di sana, lalu kembali di sini, seperti semua mortal lainnya selama Pecahan Naga. Bagaimana kau pikir aku mempelajari misteriku? Para Selektif Maruhkati menunjukkan semua kemuliaan Fajar kepada kami sehingga kami dapat belajar, singkatnya: sebagaimana di atas, demikian pula di bawah."

String.Source:
[pagebreak]

The Poison Song Book VII By Bristin Xel

[pagebreak]

riffith stood on the parapets of Barysimayn and considered the volcano. Metaphors the poets used fell rather flat in his view. A festering wound it could be called with its blood-like lava. The King of Ash, too, could be applied, when one looked at its perpetual crown of smoke. And yet, none of that would do, for nothing in his experience could convey the sheer magnitude of the mountain. Red Mountain was many miles away from the fortress, and yet it filled the horizon utterly. Before he could feel too small, however, he heard his name being called within. It was some consolation that though he was insignificant compared to the mountain, he was still in possession of certain power and influence. "General Indoril-Triffith," said Commander Rael. "There's trouble at the east gate." The trouble was scarcely more than a skirmish. An Ashlander, drunk perhaps on shein, had begun a fight with the House guards at the back gate. As they tried to drive him away, his cousins joined him, and soon there were six Ashlanders altogether brawling with a dozen of Triffith's guards. If the n'wahs had not been well-armed, the fight could have been finished almost before it began. As it was, by the time the General arrived with more of his guards, two of the Ashlanders were dead and the others had taken flight. "It's the smoke in their brains," Rael shrugged. "Makes them mad." Triffith climbed back up the stairs and returned to his chamber to dress for dinner. General Redoran-Vorilk and Counselor Hlaalu-Nothoc would be arriving very shortly to discuss the Temple's plans for reorganizing the House lands of Morrowind. Mournhold was to be renamed Almalexia. A great new city in honor of Vivec was to be built, but with whose gold? It made his head hurt. There were so many details, a long night of argument, threats, and compromises were ahead. The General's mind was so occupied that he nearly put his House robes on backwards. He also did not notice the shadowy figure steal out from behind the tapestry and close the door to the bedchamber. It was not until Triffith heard the sound of the latch-bolt fall that he turned around. 'Slipped in when I was distracted by the fracas at the back gate. Very clever, Tay," he said simply. "Or do you call yourself Dagoth-Tython these days?" "You should know all my names," the young man snarled, unsheathing his sword. "I was Tython before you butchered my family and sought to dispel my tribe. I was Tay when you brought me into your House to poison me against my own people. Now you may call me Vengeance." There was a knock on the door. Tython and Triffith did not move their eyes from one another. The knocking became a loud pounding. "General Indoril-Triffith, are you well? Is there something wrong?" "If you're going to kill me, boy, you'd best do it quickly," Triffith growled. "My men will have that door down in two minutes." "You don't tell me what to do, 'Uncle,'" Tython shook his head. "I have the Song of my ancestors to instruct me. It tells me you made my father beg for his life before you killed him, and I want to see you do the same." "If your ancestors are all-knowing," Triffith smiled. "Why are they all dead?" Tython made an inhuman noise in the back of his throat and advanced. The door began to buckle at the pounding, but it was sturdy and secure. The general's estimate of its life expectancy at two minutes seemed clearly erroneous. The pounding suddenly stopped. A familiar voice replaced the sound. "Tay," called Baynarah. "Listen to me." Tython smirked, "You're just in time to hear your uncle beg for his miserable life, 'cousin.' I was afraid you'd be too late. The next sound you'll hear will be the death rattle of the man who slaved my House." "The Song is what's enslaved you, not Uncle Triffith. You can't trust it. It's poisoning you. It let you be manipulated first by that mad old woman, and now by that evil witch Acra who calls herself your sister." Tython pressed the tip of his sword so it touched the general's throat. The older man stepped backwards and Tython advanced. His eyes followed the length of his arm to the grip of the blade. The silver ring of Dagoth caught the red light of the volcano from the battlements outside the window. "Tay, please don't hurt anyone anymore. Please. If you just listen to me, and not the Song just a moment, you'll know what's right. I love you." Baynarah stifled her sobs to keep her voice clear and calm. There was a noise on the stairwell behind her. The general's guard had finally arrived with the battering ram. The door splintered and burst open in two strikes. General Indoril-Triffith was holding his throat, staring out the window. "Uncle! Are you all right?" Baynara ran to him. He nodded his head slowly, and removed his hand. There was only the barest of scratches on his neck. "Where's Tay?" "He jumped out the window," said Triffith, pointing out into the distance where a figure was riding a guar toward the volcano. "I thought he was going to kill himself, but he had an escape figured out." "We'll get him, serjo general," said Commander Rael, calling to the guards to get their mounts. Baynarah watched them go, and then kissed her uncle quickly and ran out to her own guar in the courtyard. Sweat drenched Tay's body as he rode closer and closer toward the summit of Red Mountain. The guar was breathing hard, trudging along even more slowly, letting out little grunts of complaint about the heat. Finally, he abandoned his steed and began to climb the near vertical surface. Ash blew down the face of the volcano into his eyes. Near-blind, it was almost impossible to ignore the persistent, clamorous notes of the Song. A silken stream of crimson lava studded with crystalline formations surged a few feet away, close enough that Tay could feel his flesh begin to burn and blister. He turned from it, and saw a figure emerge through the smoke. Baynarah. "What are you doing, Tay?" she cried over the howl of the volcano. "Didn't I tell you not to listen to the Song?" "For the first time, the Song and I both want the same thing!" he yelled back. "I can't ask you to forgive me, but please try to forget!" He pulled himself higher, out of Baynarah's sight. She screamed his name, scaling the rocks until she found she was close to the open crater. Waves of boiling gas washed over her, and she dropped to her knees, gasping. Through the rippling miasma, she saw Tay standing at the mouth of the volcano. Flames erupted from his clothes and hair. He turned to her just for a moment and smiled. Then he leapt. Baynarah was in a daze as she began the long, treacherous climb down the volcano. She began to think of the projects ahead. Were there enough provisions in storage at her house in Gorne for the meeting of the Houses? The councilors were bound to stay there for weeks, maybe months. There was much work to be done. Slowly, as she descended, she began to forget. It would not last, but it would be a start. Dagoth-Acra stood as near to the mouth of the volcano as she could stand, blinking her eyes at the ash, soaked by the heat. She watched all, and smiled. On the ground was the silver ring with the seal of the House Dagoth. Tython had been sweating so much, it had slipped off. She picked it up and put it on her own finger. Touching her belly, she heard a new refrain of the Poison Song of Morrowind begin.
String.Dest:
[pagebreak]

The Poison Song Book VII By Bristin Xel

[pagebreak]

riffith berdiri di atas parapet Barysimayn dan memandang gunung berapi itu. Metafora yang dipakai penyair terasa datar baginya. Bisa disebut sebagai luka yang berinfeksi dengan lava merah seperti darahnya. Raja Abu juga cocok bila dilihat mahkota asapnya yang tak berujung. Namun semua itu tak cukup, karena tidak ada apa pun dalam pengalamannya yang dapat menggambarkan kebesaran pegunungan itu. Gunung Merah terletak jauh di luar benteng, namun tetap menguasai cakrawala sepenuhnya. Sebelum ia sempat merasa terlalu kecil, ia mendengar namanya dipanggil di dalam. Itu menjadi sedikit penghiburan bahwa meskipun ia tak signifikan dibandingkan gunung, ia masih memiliki kekuasaan dan pengaruh tertentu. "General Indoril-Triffith," kata Komandan Rael. "Ada masalah di gerbang timur." Masalah itu nyaris tak lebih dari sekadar bentrok kecil. Seorang Ashlander, mungkin mabuk shein, memulai perkelahian dengan penjaga House di gerbang belakang. Saat mereka berusaha mengusirnya, sepupu‑sepupunya bergabung, dan tak lama kemudian ada enam Ashlander yang bertarung melawan selusin penjaga Triffith. Jika n'wah tidak bersenjata lengkap, pertempuran itu bisa selesai sebelum dimulai. Namun, ketika Sang Jenderal tiba bersama lebih banyak penjaganya, dua Ashlander sudah mati dan yang lainnya melarikan diri. "Itu asap di otak mereka," Rael mengangkat bahu. "Membuat mereka gila." Triffith naik kembali ke atas tangga dan kembali ke kamarnya untuk berpakaian makan malam. Jenderal Redoran-Vorilk dan Penasihat Hlaalu-Nothoc akan segera datang untuk membahas rencana Kuil dalam merestrukturisasi tanah House di Morrowind. Mournhold akan diubah namanya menjadi Almalexia. Sebuah kota baru yang megah untuk menghormati Vivec akan dibangun, tetapi dengan emas siapa? Hal itu membuat kepalanya sakit. Ada begitu banyak detail, malam panjang berargumen, ancaman, dan kompromi menanti. Pikiran Jenderal begitu terganggu sehingga ia hampir memakai jubah House terbalik. Ia juga tidak menyadari sosok bayangan mencuri keluar dari belakang tapet dan menutup pintu kamar tidur. Baru ketika Triffith mendengar suara kait pintu jatuh, ia berbalik. "Aku masuk saat kau terganggu oleh keributan di gerbang belakang. Sangat cerdik, Tay," katanya singkat. "Atau kini kau menyebut dirimu Dagoth‑Tython?" "Kau seharusnya tahu semua namaku," pria muda itu menggeram, menghunus pedangnya. "Aku adalah Tython sebelum kau membantai keluargaku dan berusaha membubarkan sukuku. Aku menjadi Tay ketika kau memasukkanku ke House‑mu untuk memujarmu melawan bangsaku sendiri. Sekarang kau dapat memanggilku Balas Dendam." Terdengar ketukan pada pintu. Tython dan Triffith tidak melepaskan pandangan satu sama lain. Ketukan itu berubah menjadi pukulan keras. "General Indoril‑Triffith, apakah Anda baik‑baik saja? Ada yang salah?" "Jika kau berencana membunuhku, anak muda, sebaiknya lakukan dengan cepat," geram Triffith. "Pasukanku akan menghancurkan pintu itu dalam dua menit." "Kau tak berhak memberi perintah kepadaku, 'Paman'," Tython menggelengkan kepala. "Aku memiliki Nyanyian leluhurkku sebagai petunjuk. Nyanyian itu memberitahuku bahwa kau memaksa ayahku memohon hidupnya sebelum kau membunuhnya, dan aku ingin melihatmu melakukan hal yang sama." "Jika leluhurmu maha tahu," Triffith tersenyum. "Mengapa mereka semua sudah mati?" Tython mengeluarkan suara tak manusiawi dari tenggorokannya dan maju. Pintu mulai berkelok di tengah pukulan, namun tetap kuat dan kokoh. Perkiraan Jenderal bahwa pintu itu akan hancur dalam dua menit jelas keliru. Pukulan itu tiba‑tiba berhenti. Suara yang akrab menggantikan suara itu. "Tay," panggil Baynarah. "Dengarkan aku." Tython menyeringai, "Kau tepat waktu untuk mendengar pamanmu memohon hidupnya yang menyedihkan, 'sepupu.' Aku khawatir kau akan terlambat. Suara berikutnya yang kau dengar akan menjadi raungan terakhir pria yang memperbudak House‑ku." "Nyanyian itulah yang memperbudakmu, bukan Paman Triffith. Kau tidak dapat mempercayainya. Ia meracuni kau. Ia membuatmu dimanipulasi pertama kali oleh wanita tua gila itu, dan sekarang oleh penyihir jahat Acra yang menyebut dirinya saudaramu." Tython menekan ujung pedangnya hingga menyentuh leher Jenderal. Pria tua itu melangkah mundur dan Tython maju. Matanya mengikuti panjang lengan hingga ke gagang pedang. Cincin perak Dagoth memantulkan cahaya merah vulkanik dari benteng di luar jendela. "Tay, tolong jangan sakiti siapa pun lagi. Tolong. Jika kau mendengarku saja, dan tidak pada Nyanyian sesaat, kau akan tahu apa yang benar. Aku mencintaimu." Baynarah menahan isakannya agar suaranya tetap jelas dan tenang. Ada suara di tangga belakangnya. Penjaga Jenderal akhirnya tiba dengan ram pemukul. Pintu pecah dan terbuka dalam dua hentakan. Jenderal Indoril‑Triffith memegang lehernya, menatap keluar jendela. "Paman! Apakah kau baik‑baik saja?" Baynara berlari kepadanya. Ia mengangguk perlahan, dan melepaskan tangannya. Hanya ada goresan tipis di lehernya. "Di mana Tay?" "Dia melompat keluar jendela," kata Triffith, sambil menunjuk ke kejauhan di mana sebuah sosok menunggang guar menuju gunung berapi. "Kupikir dia akan membunuh dirinya, tapi dia sudah menyiapkan pelarian." "Kami akan menangkapnya, serjo jenderal," kata Komandan Rael, memerintahkan penjaga untuk mengambil kuda mereka. Baynarah menyaksikan mereka pergi, lalu mencium pamannya dengan cepat dan berlari keluar dengan guar miliknya di halaman. Keringat membasahi tubuh Tay saat ia menunggang mendekati puncak Gunung Merah. Guar bernafas berat, melaju lebih lambat, mengeluarkan keluhan kecil tentang panas. Akhirnya, ia meninggalkan tunggangannya dan mulai memanjat permukaan hampir vertikal. Abu beterbangan menuruni wajah gunung berapi ke matanya. Hampir buta, hampir tak mungkin mengabaikan catatan nyaring dan terus‑menerus dari Nyanyian. Sebuah aliran halus lava merah kristal berhiaskan formasi kristal mengalir beberapa kaki jauhnya, cukup dekat sehingga Tay merasakan dagingnya mulai terbakar dan berkerut. Ia berbalik, dan melihat sosok muncul dari asap. Baynarah. "Apa yang kau lakukan, Tay?" dia berteriak melampaui raungan gunung berapi. "Bukankah aku sudah memberitahumu untuk tidak mendengarkan Nyanyian?" "Untuk pertama kalinya, Nyanyian dan aku menginginkan hal yang sama!" dia berteriak kembali. "Aku tak dapat meminta kau memaafkanku, tapi tolong cobalah melupakan!" Dia menarik diri lebih tinggi, keluar dari pandangan Baynarah. Dia berteriak namanya, memanjat batu hingga ia menyadari dirinya hampir di tepi kawah terbuka. Gelombang gas mendidih melanda dia, dan ia jatuh berlutut, terengah‑engah. Melalui kabut bergerak, ia melihat Tay berdiri di mulut gunung berapi. Api menyembur dari pakaian dan rambutnya. Ia menoleh kepadanya sejenak dan tersenyum. Lalu ia melompat. Baynarah berada dalam keadaan pusing saat ia memulai pendakian panjang dan berbahaya turun gunung berapi. Ia mulai memikirkan proyek‑proyek yang akan datang. Apakah cukup persediaan di gudangnya di Gorne untuk pertemuan House? Para penasihat terikat tinggal di sana selama beberapa minggu, mungkin berbulan‑bulan. Banyak pekerjaan yang harus dilakukan. Perlahan, saat ia menuruni, ia mulai melupakan. Itu tidak akan bertahan lama, tapi setidaknya menjadi awal. Dagoth‑Acra berdiri sedekat mungkin dengan mulut gunung berapi, mengedipkan mata pada abu, terendam oleh panas. Ia menyaksikan semuanya, lalu tersenyum. Di tanah terletak cincin perak dengan segel House Dagoth. Tython telah berkeringat begitu banyak sehingga cincin itu terlepas. Ia memungutnya dan memasang di jarinya sendiri. Menyentuh perutnya, ia mendengar bait baru dari Poison Song Morrowind mulai terdengar.

String.Source: Your Conjuration and Rune spells cost <25>% more, but can be cast at greater range.
String.Dest: Biaya Conjuration dan Rune spells Anda <25>% lebih tinggi, namun dapat digunakan pada jarak yang lebih jauh.

String.Source:
[pagebreak]

Nchunak's Fire and Faith

[pagebreak]

his book is a translated account of Nchunak's travels among the various colonies of the Dwemer explaining the theories of Kagrenac. I made inquiry as to the state of enlightenment among the people he spoke for. He answered that with respect to the theories of Kagrenac, there was but one scholar near who could guide the people through the maze that leads to true misunderstanding. He informed me, however, that in Kherakah the precepts of Kagrenac were taught. He said that nothing pleased him more than to see the Dwemer of Kherakah, the most learned people in the world, studying Kagrenac's words and giving consideration to their place in the life to come, and where neither planar division nor the numeration of amnesia nor any other thing of utility was more valued than the understanding of the self and its relationship to the Heart. I was gracious enough to receive this as a high compliment, and, removing my helm, I thanked him and departed with an infinity of bows.
String.Dest:
[pagebreak]

Nchunak's Fire and Faith

[pagebreak]

buku ini adalah sebuah terjemahan catatan perjalanan Nchunak di antara berbagai koloni Dwemer yang menjelaskan teori‑teori Kagrenac. Saya menanyakan keadaan pencerahan di antara orang‑orang yang dia wakili. Ia menjawab bahwa terkait teori‑teori Kagrenac, hanya ada satu sarjana terdekat yang dapat membimbing orang‑orang melalui labirin yang mengarah pada kesalahpahaman sejati. Namun ia memberitahuku bahwa di Kherakah doktrin Kagrenac diajarkan. Ia berkata tidak ada yang lebih menyenangkan baginya selain melihat Dwemer Kherakah, orang‑orang paling terpelajar di dunia, mempelajari kata‑kata Kagrenac dan mempertimbangkan tempat mereka dalam kehidupan yang akan datang, di mana tidak ada pembagian planar, maupun penomoran amnesia, maupun hal‑hal berguna lainnya yang lebih dihargai daripada pemahaman diri dan hubungannya dengan Heart. Aku cukup berterima kasih menerima ini sebagai pujian tinggi, dan, melepas helmku, kuucapkan terima kasih padanya dan berangkat dengan tak terhingga salam.

String.Source: I agreed to fund Ralis Sedarys' expedition to excavate Kolbjorn Barrow, but work on the site has stopped. Most of the miners were killed by another wave of Draugr attacks, and two more were unaccounted for. I found the bodies of the missing miners, but still need to deal with the Draugr threat.
String.Dest: Saya setuju untuk mendanai ekspedisi Ralis Sedarys untuk menggali Kolbjorn Barrow, tetapi pekerjaan di situs itu telah terhenti. Sebagian besar penambang terbunuh oleh gelombang serangan Draugr lagi, dan dua orang lagi tidak ditemukan. Saya menemukan mayat penambang yang hilang, tetapi masih harus menangani ancaman Draugr.

String.Source:
[pagebreak]

The Poison Song Book III By Bristin Xel

[pagebreak]

ay was eighteen in the year 685 of the First Era when he first saw Mournhold, the city of spires, home of the goddess. His cousin Kalkorith, already a senior initiate in the Temple, gave him a couple rooms on the ground floor of the house he had purchased. They were small and unfurnished, but bittergreen grew outside the windows, and when the wind blew, they filled his bedroom with a lovely spicy air. The chords of the Song did not trouble him anymore. Sometimes he was even unconscious to it, so low and melodic it had become. Occasionally when he was passing through the streets on the way to the Temple for his instruction, someone would pass him and the Song would rise in intensity before falling away again. Whatever was different about those people, Tay never tried to ascertain. He remembered the last time he had let the Song lead him, and called for him to murder his young cousin Vaster.
