The memory did not trouble him unduly, but he did not want to hurt anyone again unless he had to. House couriers regularly brought Tay letters from Baynarah, still back in Sandil House on the island of Gorne. She might have gone to study at the Temple, she was certainly intelligent enough, but she chose not to. In a year or two at most, she would have to leave and assume her place in House Indoril, but she was not in a hurry. Tay welcomed the trivial gossipy news the letters brought, and responded back with news of his own studies and romances. In his third month in Mournhold, he had already met a girl. She was also a student at the Temple, and her name was Acra. Tay wrote enthusiastically about her to Baynarah, describing her as having the mind of Sotha Sil, the wit of Vivec, and the beauty of Almalexia. Baynarah replied back merrily that if she had known how blasphemous students of the Temple were allowed to be, she might have become an initiate herself. "You are very devoted to your cousin," Acra laughed when Tay showed her the letter. "Am I looking at the last remains of a thwarted romance?" "She's lovely, but I never thought of her that way," Tay scoffed. "Incest never particularly interested me." "Is she a very close cousin then?" Tay thought for a moment: "I don't know. Truthfully, no one spoke much of either her parents or mine, so I really don't know how we were connected. They were casualties of the War of the Red Mountain, that I know, and it seemed to cast rather a pall on the adults' humor whenever we asked about her parents or mine. After a while, we stopped asking. But you're an Indoril too. Perhaps you're a closer cousin to me than Baynarah." "Perhaps so," Acra smiled, rising from her chair. She uncoiled her hair, which had been pulled up in the formal arrangement reserved for well-born priestesses. As Tay watched transfigured, she removed the small brooch that fastened her robe to her shoulder cape. The soft silken fabric slipped down slowly, exposing her dark, slender body to him for the first time. "If we are, does incest particularly interest you now?" As they made love, the Song began a slow, rhythmic ascension in Tay's head. The vision of Acra before him darkened and was replaced by images from his nightmares before returning again. When finally he collapsed, spent, the room seemed filled with the fiery red clouds of his dream, and the scream of the woman and her child facing death echoed in his head. He opened his eyes, and there was Acra, smiling at him. Tay kissed her, grateful to have her in his arms. For the next two weeks, Tay and Acra were never far apart. Even when they were at study in opposite wings of the Temple, Tay thought of her, and somehow knew she was thinking of him. They would rush to be together afterwards, ravishing one another in his rooms every night, and in a private corner of the Temple garden every day. It was while Tay was rushing to see his beloved one afternoon that the Song rose up in powerful strident tones at the approach of an old, ragged woman. He closed his eyes and tried to quiet it, but when he looked again at her purchasing corkbulb papyrus from a street vendor, he knew who she was. His old nursemaid from Gorne, Edebah. She who had abandoned him without even a farewell to join her family on the mainland. She didn't see him, and as she passed down the street, Tay turned and began to follow. They walked through shadowy passageways into the very poorest part of the city, a quarter which was as alien to him as the wildest principality of Akavir. She unlocked a small wooden door on a street without a name, and he finally called out her name. She didn't turn, but when he followed, he found that the door had been left ajar. The chamber was murky and damp like a cave. She stood facing him, her face even more wrinkled than he had remembered it, etched with lines of sorrow. He closed the door behind him, and she took his hand and kissed it. "You are so tall and strong," Edebah said, beginning to weep. "I should have killed myself before I let them take me away from you." "How is your family?" Tay asked coldly. "You are my only family," she whispered. "The Indoril pigs forced me to leave, thrusting their blades in my face, when they discovered that I serve you and your family, not them. That bitch girl Baynarah saw me at a prayer of mourning." "You're speaking like a madwoman," Tay sneered. "How could you love me and my family, but hate the House Indoril? I am of the House Indoril." "You are old enough to know the truth," Edebah said fiercely. Tay had bitterly joked about her madness, but he saw something close to it burning in her ancient eyes. "You were not born of House Indoril; they brought you into their house after the War, like they and the other Houses brought in all the orphans. It was the only way they saw to erase history and remove all traces of their enemies, by raising their enemies as one of them." Tay turned toward the door: "I can see why you were taken away from Gorne, old woman. You are delusional." "Wait!" Edebah cried, rushing to a musty cabinet. She retrieved from it a glass globe that shimmered with a spectrum of color even in the chamber's gloom. "Do you remember this? You slew that little boy Vaster because he possessed it, and I took it from your room because you were not ready to face the facts of your inheritance and responsibility then. Did you not wonder why this bauble drew you so?" Tay gasped, and though he did not want to, he said, "I hear a Song sometimes." "That is the Song of your ancestors, of your true family," she said, nodding. "You must not fight it, for it is a song of destiny. It will lead you to do what must be done." "Shut up!" Tay howled, "Everything you say is a lie! You're insane!" Edebah threw the globe to the ground with all her might, shattering it with a deafening retort. The shards melted into the air. All that was left was a small silver ring, simply wrought with a flat crown. The old woman quietly picked it up and handed it to him, while he stood with his back against the door, trembling. "This is your inheritance, as the bearer of the Sixth House." The ring's crown was meant for stamping and sealing official House proclamations. Tay had seen his uncle Triffith's similar ring, crested with the wing which was the seal of House Indoril. This ring was different, with an insect design which he remembered from the day when Kena Gafrisi had taught the House heraldry to Baynarah and him. It was the symbol of the accursed House Dagoth. The Song took over all of Tay's senses. He heard its music, smelled its horror, tasted its sadness, felt its power, and the only thing he could see before him was the flames of its destruction. When he took the ring and placed it on his finger, his mind was not aware of what he was doing. Nor was Tay aware of anything but the Song when he removed his dagger from its sheath and thrust it into his old nursemaid's heart. Tay did not even hear her final words, when Edebah fell bleeding to the ground, and groaned with a blood-streaked smile, "Thank you." When the veil of the Song lifted, Tay did not realize at first he was no longer dreaming. Before him had been flames, the very ones that destroyed the home of his birth, and flames were before him again. But they were flames from a fire he had struck outside the crumbling tenement that were already bursting through walls, consuming the body of his old nursemaid. Tay fled through the streets as people began to call for the guards.
String.Dest:
[pagebreak]

The Poison Song Book III Oleh Bristin Xel

[pagebreak]

Tay berusia delapan belas pada tahun 685 Era Pertama ketika ia pertama kali melihat Mournhold, kota menara, rumah sang dewi. Sepupunya, Kalkorith, yang sudah menjadi inisiat senior di Kuil, memberinya beberapa kamar di lantai dasar rumah yang ia beli. Kamar-kamar itu kecil dan tak berperabot, namun tanaman pahit hijau tumbuh di luar jendela, dan ketika angin berhembus, ruangan itu dipenuhi aroma pedas yang indah. Akor-akor Lagu tidak lagi mengganggunya. Kadang-kadang ia bahkan tidak menyadari melodi itu, yang kini menjadi sangat rendah dan melodius. Sesekali ketika ia melewati jalan menuju Kuil untuk belajar, seseorang lewat di depannya dan Lagu naik dengan intensitas sebelum kembali mereda. Apapun yang berbeda dari orang‑orang itu, Tay tak pernah mencoba menelusurnya. Ia mengingat kali terakhir ia membiarkan Lagu memimpinnya, memerintahkan membunuh sepupu mudanya, Vaster. Kenangan itu tidak terlalu mengganggunya, namun ia tidak ingin melukai siapa pun lagi kecuali memang harus. Kurir rumah secara rutin mengirimkan surat‑surat kepada Tay dari Baynarah, yang masih berada di Sandil House di pulau Gorne. Mungkin ia bisa pergi belajar ke Kuil; ia memang cukup pintar, namun ia memilih tidak melakukannya. Dalam satu atau dua tahun paling lama, ia harus pergi dan mengambil tempatnya di House Indoril, namun ia tidak terburu‑buru. Tay menyambut kabar gosip sepele yang dibawa surat‑surat itu, dan membalasnya dengan kabar tentang studinya dan percintaannya. Pada bulan ketiga di Mournhold, ia sudah bertemu seorang gadis. Ia juga seorang murid di Kuil, bernama Acra. Tay menulis dengan antusias tentangnya kepada Baynarah, menggambarkannya mempunyai akal Sotha Sil, kepintaran Vivec, dan kecantikan Almalexia. Baynarah membalas dengan riang, mengatakan jika ia mengetahui betapa blasfemnya murid‑murid Kuil boleh menjadi, ia mungkin sudah menjadi inisiat sendiri. "Kau sangat setia pada sepupumu," tawa Acra saat Tay menunjukkan surat itu kepadanya. "Apakah aku melihat sisa‑sisa terakhir dari sebuah percintaan yang gagal?" "Dia cantik, tapi aku tidak pernah memikirkannya begitu," Tay mengejek. "Inses tidak pernah menarik perhatianku." "Apakah dia sepupu yang sangat dekat?" Tay berpikir sejenak: "Aku tidak tahu. Sejujurnya, tak ada yang banyak bercerita tentang orang tua dia atau orang tuaku, jadi aku memang tak tahu bagaimana kami terhubung. Mereka adalah korban Perang Gunung Merah, yang kuketahui, dan hal itu sepertinya menggelapkan humor orang dewasa setiap kali kami menanyakan tentang orang tua mereka atau orang tuaku. Setelah beberapa saat, kami berhenti menanya. Namun kau juga Indoril. Mungkin kau sepupu yang lebih dekat dariku daripada Baynarah." "Mungkin begitu," Acra tersenyum, bangkit dari kursinya. Ia melonggarkan rambutnya, yang sebelumnya diikat rapi seperti biasanya bagi pendeta kelahiran baik. Saat Tay menyaksikannya berubah, ia melepas bros kecil yang menahan jubahnya pada jubah bahu. Kain sutra halus itu perlahan meluncur, memperlihatkan tubuhnya yang gelap dan ramping untuk pertama kalinya. "Jika memang begitu, apakah inses kini menarik bagimu?" Saat mereka berhubungan intim, Lagu memulai sebuah Slow, ascensi ritmis di kepala Tay. Penglihatan Acra di depannya menggelap dan digantikan oleh gambaran mimpi buruknya, lalu kembali lagi. Ketika akhirnya ia terjatuh lemah, ruangan terasa dipenuhi awan merah menyala dari mimpinya, dan jeritan wanita serta anaknya yang menghadapi kematian bergema di kepalanya. Ia membuka mata, dan di sana Acra tersenyum padanya. Tay mencium bibirnya, bersyukur memeluknya. Selama dua minggu berikutnya, Tay dan Acra tak pernah jauh terpisah. Bahkan ketika mereka belajar di sayap Kuil yang berlawanan, Tay memikirkannya, dan entah bagaimana ia tahu ia juga memikirkannya. Mereka bergegas bersatu setelahnya, memabukkan satu sama lain di kamar Tay setiap malam, dan di pojok pribadi taman Kuil setiap hari. Suatu sore ketika Tay bergegas menemui kekasihnya, Lagu menggelegak dengan nada keras menyambut kedatangan seorang wanita tua lusuh. Ia menutup mata dan berusaha menenangkannya, tapi ketika ia menengok lagi pada wanita itu yang membeli papirus bola gabus dari pedagang kaki lima, ia tahu siapa itu. Perawatnya yang lama dari Gorne, Edebah. Ia yang meninggalkan Tay tanpa perpisahan untuk bergabung dengan keluarganya di daratan. Edebah tak melihatnya, dan saat ia melintas di jalan, Tay berbalik dan mulai mengikutinya. Mereka berjalan melalui lorong gelap ke bagian paling miskin kota, sebuah wilayah yang asing baginya seperti wilayah paling liar di Akavir. Ia membuka sebuah pintu kayu kecil di sebuah jalan yang tak bernama, dan akhirnya Tay memanggil namanya. Ia tak berbalik, tapi ketika Tay mengikutinya, ia menemukan pintu itu terbuka lebar. Ruangan itu suram dan lembap seperti gua. Ia berdiri menghadap Tay, wajahnya lebih berkerut daripada yang ia ingat, terukir garis‑garis duka. Tay menutup pintu di belakangnya, dan wanita itu mengambil tangannya dan menciumnya. "Kau sangat tinggi dan kuat," kata Edebah, mulai menangis. "Seharusnya aku bunuh diri sebelum mereka memisahkanku darimu." "Bagaimana keluargamu?" tanya Tay dengan dingin. "Kau satu‑satunya keluargaku," bisiknya. "Babi‑babi Indoril memaksa aku pergi, menusuk wajahku dengan pedang mereka, ketika mereka tahu aku melayani kau dan keluargamu, bukan mereka. Gadis jalang Baynarah melihatku saat doa duka." "Kau berbicara seperti seorang Madwoman," Tay mengejek. "Bagaimana mungkin kau mencintaiku dan keluargaku, tapi membenci House Indoril? Aku adalah bagian dari House Indoril." "Kau cukup tua untuk mengetahui kebenaran," kata Edebah dengan garang. Tay pernah melontarkan lelucon pahit tentang kegilaannya, namun ia melihat sesuatu yang hampir seperti itu menyala di mata tuanya. "Kau tidak dilahirkan dari House Indoril; mereka mengangkatmu ke rumah mereka setelah Perang, seperti mereka dan House‑House lain mengangkat semua anak yatim. Itu satu‑satunya cara mereka melihat untuk menghapus sejarah dan menyingkirkan jejak musuh‑musuh mereka, dengan membesarkan musuh‑musuh mereka sebagai salah satu dari mereka." Tay berbalik ke arah pintu: "Aku mengerti mengapa kau dibawa pergi dari Gorne, wanita tua. Kau delusional." "Tunggu!" seru Edebah, bergegas ke lemari berbau apek. Ia mengambil sebuah bola kaca yang berkilau dengan spektrum warna meski di dalam kegelapan ruangan. "Apakah kau ingat ini? Kau membunuh bocah Vaster karena ia memilikinya, dan aku mengambilnya dari kamarmu karena kau belum siap menghadapi warisan dan tanggung jawabmu saat itu. Bukankah kau bertanya-tanya mengapa benda kecil ini menarikmu begitu?" Tay terengah‑engah, dan meskipun ia tak ingin, ia berkata, "Aku kadang mendengar Lagu." "Itu Lagu leluhurmu, keluarga sejati mu," jawabnya sambil mengangguk. "Jangan lawan itu, karena itu adalah lagu takdir. Ia akan menuntunmu melakukan apa yang harus dilakukan." "Diam!" Tay meraung, "Semua yang kau katakan bohong! Kau gila!" Edebah melemparkan bola itu ke tanah dengan sekuat tenaga, menghancurkannya dengan dentuman memekakkan telinga. Pecahan‑pecahan itu menguap ke udara. Hanya tersisa sebuah cincin perak kecil, sederhana dengan mahkota datar. Wanita tua itu diam-diam mengambilnya dan menyerahkannya kepadanya, sementara ia berdiri bersandar pada pintu, gemetar. "Inilah warisanmu, sebagai pemegang House Keenam." Mahkota cincin itu dipakai untuk mencap dan menutup resmi‑resmi House. Tay pernah melihat cincin serupa milik pamannya, Triffith, yang bertatahkan sayap sebagai segel House Indoril. Cincin ini berbeda, dengan desain serangga yang ia ingat dari hari ketika Kena Gafrisi mengajarkan heraldik House kepada Baynarah dan dirinya. Itu simbol dari House Dagoth yang terkutuk. Lagu menguasai semua indera Tay. Ia mendengar musiknya, mencium kengerian, merasakan kesedihan, menyentuh kekuatannya, dan satu‑satunya yang ia lihat hanyalah nyala api kehancurannya. Saat ia menaruh cincin itu di jari, pikirannya tidak menyadari apa yang dilakukannya. Tay sendiri tidak menyadari apa pun selain Lagu ketika ia mengeluarkan belati dari sarungnya dan menusukkannya ke hati perawatnya yang lama. Tay bahkan tak mendengar kata‑kata terakhirnya, ketika Edebah terjatuh berdarah, berbisik dengan senyum berlumuran darah, "Terima kasih." Saat tirai Lagu terangkat, pada awalnya Tay tidak menyadari bahwa ia tidak lagi bermimpi. Di depannya ada nyala api, api yang menghancurkan rumah kelahirannya, dan api kembali muncul. Namun kali ini itu adalah api dari kebakaran yang ia nyalakan di luar atap rusak yang sudah melubangi dinding, melahap tubuh perawatnya yang lama. Tay melarikan diri menyusuri jalanan saat orang‑orang mulai memanggil penjaga.

String.Source: Sapphire Gem Damaged Albino Spider Pod
String.Dest: Permata Safir Kapsul Laba-laba Albino Rusak

String.Source: I agreed to fund Ralis Sedarys' ill-fated excavation of Kolbjorn Barrow, but when I returned to his mining camp, I found only blood and corpses. Deep within the barrow, I found Ralis performing a ritual to release Ahzidal, the Dragon Priest that had been sealed there.
String.Dest: Saya setuju untuk mendanai penggalian malang Ralis Sedarys di Kolbjorn Barrow, tetapi ketika saya kembali ke kamp tambangnya, saya menemukan hanya darah dan mayat. Di dalam kedalaman barrow, saya menemukan Ralis sedang melakukan ritual untuk membebaskan Ahzidal, Pendeta Naga yang telah disegel di sana.

String.Source: Summons Karstaag to fight for you for <120> seconds. You may only use this ability <1> time, and only while outdoors.
String.Dest: Memanggil Karstaag untuk bertarung demi anda selama <120> detik. Anda hanya dapat menggunakan kemampuan ini <1> kali, dan hanya saat berada di luar ruangan.

String.Source: Sapphire Gem Salt Pile Albino Spider Pod
String.Dest: Permata Safir Salt Pile Kapsul Laba-laba Albino

String.Source:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"> Day 32 It's been almost a month since unearthing the crypt at Fort Frostmoth, and I haven't seen a single spark of life in the general's remains. Grafting the heartstone to the subject is proving much more difficult than I originally anticipated. I've used almost every method I can think of, and still there's no sign of reanimation. At this rate, it could be years before I make any progress... which is time that I just can't afford right now. If my vengeance is to come to fruition, I need results. If not, I may need to resort to more drastic measures.
Day 47 It finally appears that I'm making some progress. After my latest experiment, General Carius's eyes briefly opened and he moved his arms. It lasted for less than a few moments, but it's the first sign of progress I've seen since I arrived here. A few of my assistants were insisting that I was imagining things, but I dismissed them for their insolence. They won't be bothering anyone ever again.
Day 55 General Carius awoke fully today. He bolted upright after my incantations and began staggering around like a blind man. He seemed to ignore my commands... in fact, hearing my voice seemed to increase his hostility. I was able to remove the heartstone before he became violent, but this isn't a result that I expected. Even though he's able to be awakened, I feel as though the real work has just begun.
Day 59 The general is still unable or unwilling to listen to my commands. He's acting increasingly paranoid, and appears to have his own free will. He's convinced that I am a "spy" or the "enemy," and I've had to restrain him to prevent him from outright attacking me. This is becoming intolerable. I'm beginning to wonder if someone with a heartstone can be commanded at all. If my experiments with General Carius fail, I may have to resort to self-experimentation... something I've been avoiding for a long time. </font>
String.Dest:
<font face=\"$HandwrittenFont\"> Day 32 Sudah hampir sebulan sejak saya menggali ruang bawah tanah di Benteng Frostmoth, dan saya belum melihat secercah kehidupan pada jenazah sang jenderal. Menempelkan heartstone ke subjek ternyata jauh lebih sulit daripada yang saya perkirakan. Saya telah mencoba hampir semua cara yang terlintas dalam pikiran, namun belum ada tanda‑tanda reanimasi. Pada kecepatan ini, mungkin akan bertahun‑tahun sebelum saya membuat kemajuan... waktu yang saya tidak mampu luangkan saat ini. Jika balas dendam saya hendak terwujud, saya membutuhkan hasil. Jika tidak, saya mungkin harus beralih ke langkah yang lebih drastis.
Day 47 Akhirnya tampaknya saya membuat sedikit kemajuan. Setelah percobaan terakhir saya, mata Jenderal Carius terbuka sebentar dan ia menggerakkan lengannya. Itu berlangsung hanya beberapa saat, namun itu adalah tanda kemajuan pertama yang saya lihat sejak tiba di sini. Beberapa asisten saya bersikeras bahwa saya berhalusinasi, namun saya menolak mereka karena insolensi mereka. Mereka tidak akan lagi mengganggu siapa pun.
Day 55 Jenderal Carius sepenuhnya bangun hari ini. Ia langsung berdiri tegak setelah mantra saya dan mulai tersungkur seperti orang buta. Ia tampaknya mengabaikan perintah saya... bahkan mendengar suara saya tampak meningkatkan kemarahannya. Saya berhasil mengeluarkan heartstone sebelum ia menjadi agresif, tetapi ini bukan hasil yang saya harapkan. Meskipun ia dapat dibangkitkan, saya merasa pekerjaan sesungguhnya baru saja dimulai.
Day 59 Jenderal itu masih tidak dapat atau tidak mau mendengarkan perintah saya. Ia semakin paranoid, dan tampaknya memiliki kehendak bebasnya sendiri. Ia yakin bahwa saya adalah \"mata-mata\" atau \"musuh\", dan saya harus menahannya agar tidak langsung menyerang saya. Situasi ini menjadi tak tertahankan. Saya mulai bertanya-tanya apakah seseorang yang memiliki heartstone dapat dikendalikan sama sekali. Jika percobaan saya dengan Jenderal Carius gagal, saya mungkin harus beralih ke eksperimen pada diri sendiri... sesuatu yang telah saya hindari sejak lama. </font>

String.Source:
[pagebreak]

Nerevar at Red Mountain

[pagebreak]

he following is from the Apographa, the hidden writings of the Tribunal Temple. It is a scholarly retelling of a tradition transmitted through the Ashlanders concerning the battle at Red Mountain and subsequent events. The Ashlanders associate this tale with the telling of Alandro Sul, a shield-companion of Nerevar who came to live among the Ashlanders after the death of Nerevar and during the ascension of the Tribunal. There are many variant treatments of this story, but the primary elements are consistent throughout the tradition. The murder of Nerevar, the tragic fate of Dagoth Ur, and the profane source of the Tribunal's divine power are denied by Temple doctrine as ignorant Ashlander superstition, and not widely known among civilized Dunmer. Resdayn, present day Morrowind, was contested ground between two very different types of mer: the Chimer, who worshipped Daedra, and the Dwemer, who worshipped a profane and secret power. These two people warred with each other constantly until their lands were invaded by a young, vibrant, and violent alien culture, the Nords. Two heroes, one from the Chimer and one from the Dwemer, Indoril Nerevar and Dumac Dwarf-Orc, made peace between their people and together ousted the alien invaders. Then these two heroes worked long and hard to maintain that peace thereafter, though their counselors thought it could not last or, worse, that it shouldn't. Nerevar's queen and his generals-- Almalexia, Sotha Sil, Vivec-- told him to claim all Resdayn for his own. But Nerevar would not listen, for he remembered his friendship with Dumac. There would be only peace. Until Dagoth-Ur arrived. House Dagoth had discovered the source of the profane and secret power of the Dwemer: the legendary Heart of Lorkhan, which Dumac's people had used to make themselves immortal and beyond the measure of the gods. In fact, one of the their high priests, Kagrenac, was building a New God so that the Dwemer could claim Resdayn for their own. The Tribunal urged Nerevar again to make war on the Dwarves. Nerevar was troubled. He went to Dumac, his friend of old, and asked if what Dagoth-Ur said was true. But Kagrenac and the high priests of the Dwemer had kept their New God secret from their King, and Dumac said the Dwemer were innocent of any wrongdoing. Nerevar was troubled again and made pilgrimage to Holamayan, the sacred temple of Azura, who confirmed that all that Dagoth-Ur said was indeed true and that the New God of the Dwemer should be destroyed for the safety of not only Resdayn, but for the whole world. When Nerevar went back and told his Tribunal what the goddess had said, his queen and generals felt themselves proved aright and again counseled him to war. There were reasons that the Dwemer and Chimer had hated each other forever. Finally, Nerevar, angered that his friend Dumac would lie to him, went back to Vvardenfell. This time the Chimer King was arrayed in arms and armor and had his hosts around him, and he spoke harshly to Dumac Dwarf-Orc, King of Red Mountain. "You must give up your worship of the Heart of Lorkhan or I shall forget our friendship and the deeds that were accomplished in its name!" And Dumac, who still knew nothing of Kagrenac's New God, but proud and protective as ever of his people, said, "We shall not relinquish that which has been our way for years beyond reckoning, just as the Chimer will not relinquish their ties to the Lords and Ladies of Oblivion. And to come at my door in this way, arrayed in arms and armor and with your hosts around you, tells me you have already forgotten our friendship. Stand down, my sweet Nerevar, or I swear by the fifteen-and-one golden tones I shall kill you and all your people." And so the Chimer and Dwemer went to war. The Dwemer were well-defended by their fortress at Red Mountain, but the bravery and cleverness of Nerevar's queen and generals drew most of Dumac's armies out into the field and kept them there, so that Nerevar and Dagoth-Ur could make their way into the Heart Chamber by secret means. There, Nerevar met Dumac and the Dwarf King and they both fell from grievous wounds. Dagoth-Ur slew Kagrenac and took the tools the Dwemer used to tap the power of the Heart. He went to his dying lord Nerevar and asked him what to do with these tools. And Nerevar summoned Azura again, and she showed them how to use the tools to separate the power of the Heart from the Dwemer people. And on the fields, the Tribunal and their armies watched as the Dwemer turned into dust all around them as their stolen immortality was taken away. Back in Red Mountain, Nerevar told Dagoth-Ur to protect the tools and the Heart Chamber until he returned. Dagoth-Ur said, "But shouldn't we destroy these tools at once, so that they might never be used for evil again?" But Nerevar was confused by his wounds and his sorrow (for he still loved Dumac and the Dwemer people) and so went to the fields outside of Red Mountain to confer with his queen and his generals, who had foreseen that this war would come and whose counsel he would not ignore again. "I will ask the Tribunal what we shall do with them, for they have had wisdom in the past that I had not. Stay here, loyal Dagoth-Ur, until I return." Then Nerevar told his queen and generals all that had transpired under Red Mountain and how the Dwemer had used special tools to turn their people into immortals and of the wondrous power of the Heart of Lorkhan. The Tribunal decided that the Chimer should learn how to use this power so that Nerevar might claim Resdayn and the world for their people. Nerevar did not expect or want this, so he asked his queen and generals to help him summon Azura yet again for her guidance. But the Tribunal had become as greedy as Kagrenac upon hearing of the power of the Heart and they coveted it. They made ritual as if to summon Azura as Nerevar wanted but Almalexia used poisoned candles and Sotha Sil used poisoned robes and Vivec used poisoned invocations. Nerevar was murdered. Then Azura came forth anyway and cursed the Tribunal for their foul deeds. She told them that she would use her powers over dusk and dawn to make sure Nerevar would come back and make things right again. But the Tribunal laughed at her and said that soon they would be gods themselves and that the Chimer people would forget their old ways of worship. And Azura knew this would be true and that it would take a long time before her power might bring Nerevar back. "What you have done here today is foul beyond measure and you will grow to regret it, for the lives of gods are not what mortals think and matters that weigh only years to mortals weigh on gods forever." And so that they might know forever their wicked deeds Azura changed the Chimer into Dunmer, and their skin turned ashen and their eyes into fire. "Let this mark remind you of your true selves who, like ghouls, fed on the nobility, heroism, and trust of their king." And then the Tribunal went into Red Mountain and met with Dagoth-Ur. Dagoth-Ur saw what had been done, for his skin had changed as well, and he tried to avenge the death of Nerevar but to no avail. He was driven off and thought dead. The Tribunal found the tools he had been guarding and, through study of Kagrenac's methods, turned themselves into gods. Thousands of years after their apotheosis, the Tribunal are still the gods of Morrowind and the old ways of worship are remembered only by a few. And the murder of Nerevar is known to fewer. But his queen and generals still fear his return, for the words of Azura linger long and they see the mark of her curse on their people every day.
String.Dest:
[pagebreak]

Nerevar at Red Mountain

[pagebreak]

Berikut ini diambil dari Apographa, tulisan tersembunyi Kuil Tribunal. Ini adalah sebuah penuturan ilmiah atas tradisi yang diturunkan oleh orang Ashlander mengenai pertempuran di Gunung Merah dan peristiwa-peristiwa berikutnya. Orang Ashlander mengaitkan kisah ini dengan kisah Alandro Sul, sahabat perisai Nerevar yang hidup di antara mereka setelah kematian Nerevar dan pada masa kenaikan Tribunal. Ada banyak versi cerita ini, namun unsur‑unsur utama tetap konsisten dalam tradisi tersebut. Pembunuhan Nerevar, nasib tragis Dagoth‑Ur, dan sumber profan kekuatan ilahi Tribunal dibantah oleh doktrin Kuil sebagai takhayul orang Ashlander yang bodoh, dan tidak dikenal luas di antara Dunmer yang berperadaban. Resdayn, Morrowind masa kini, adalah tanah yang diperebutkan oleh dua jenis mer yang sangat berbeda: Chimer, yang menyembah Daedra, dan Dwemer, yang menyembah kekuatan profan dan rahasia. Kedua bangsa ini terus berseteru hingga tanah mereka diinvasi oleh budaya asing yang muda, semarak, dan kejam, para Nord. Dua pahlawan, satu dari Chimer dan satu dari Dwemer, Indoril Nerevar dan Dumac Dwarf‑Orc, menengahi perdamaian antara kaum mereka dan bersama‑sama mengusir penjajah asing. Setelah itu kedua pahlawan itu bekerja keras demi menjaga perdamaian, meskipun para penasihat mereka mempercayai bahwa perdamaian tak akan bertahan, bahkan tidak seharusnya ada. Ratu Nerevar serta para jenderalnya — Almalexia, Sotha Sil, Vivec — menasihatinya untuk mengklaim seluruh Resdayn untuk dirinya. Namun Nerevar menolak, karena ia mengingat persahabatannya dengan Dumac. Hanya perdamaian yang diinginkannya. Sampai Dagoth‑Ur muncul. Rumah Dagoth menemukan sumber kekuatan profan dan rahasia Dwemer: Hati Legendaris Lorkhan, yang oleh kaum Dumac dipakai untuk menjadikan mereka abadi, melampaui ukuran para dewa. Bahkan, salah satu pendeta tinggi mereka, Kagrenac, sedang merancang Dewa Baru agar Dwemer dapat menguasai Resdayn untuk kepentingan mereka. Tribunal kembali mendesak Nerevar untuk berperang melawan Dwarves. Nerevar gelisah. Ia pergi menemui Dumac, sahabat lamanya, dan menanyakan apakah perkataan Dagoth‑Ur benar. Namun Kagrenac dan para pendeta tinggi Dwemer menyembunyikan Dewa Baru mereka dari Raja, dan Dumac bersikeras bahwa Dwemer tidak bersalah. Nerevar kembali merasa gelisah dan menunaikan ziarah ke Holamayan, kuil suci Azura, yang memastikan semua yang dikatakan Dagoth‑Ur memang benar dan Dewa Baru Dwemer harus dihancurkan demi keselamatan bukan hanya Resdayn, melainkan seluruh dunia. Saat Nerevar kembali dan melaporkan kepada Tribunal apa yang dikatakan dewi itu, ratu dan jenderalnya merasa mereka terbukti benar dan kembali menasihatinya untuk berperang. Ada alasan‑alasan mengapa Dwemer dan Chimer saling membenci sejak lama. Akhirnya, Nerevar, marah karena Dumac berbohong, kembali ke Vvardenfell. Kali ini Raja Chimer berdiri bersenjata lengkap dengan baju zirah serta rombongan di sekelilingnya, dan ia berbicara keras kepada Dumac Dwarf‑Orc, Raja Gunung Merah. "Engkau harus meninggalkan pemujaanmu terhadap Hati Lorkhan atau aku akan melupakan persahabatan kita dan perbuatan-perbuatan yang telah kita lakukan demi namanya!" Dumac, yang masih belum mengetahui apa‑apa tentang Dewa Baru Kagrenac, tetapi tetap bangga dan protektif terhadap kaumnya, menjawab, "Kami tidak akan melepaskan apa yang telah menjadi cara hidup kami selama bertahun‑tahun, sebagaimana Chimer tak akan melepaskan ikatan mereka dengan Tuan‑Tuan dan Nyonya‑Nyonya Oblivion. Datang ke pintuku dengan bersenjata lengkap dan rombongan di sekitarmu menandakan bahwa kau telah melupakan persahabatan kita. Mundurlah, Nerevarku yang tercinta, atau aku bersumpah dengan lima belas satu nada emas, aku akan membunuhmu serta seluruh bangsamu." Begitulah Chimer dan Dwemer berperang. Dwemer berbekal benteng kuat di Gunung Merah, namun keberanian dan kecerdikan ratu serta jenderal Nerevar memaksa sebagian besar pasukan Dumac keluar ke medan perang dan menahannya di sana, memberi kesempatan Nerevar dan Dagoth‑Ur menembus Kamar Hati secara rahasia. Di sana, Nerevar bertemu Dumac serta Raja Dwarf dan keduanya jatuh karena luka parah. Dagoth‑Ur menumpas Kagrenac dan merebut peralatan yang dipakai Dwemer untuk menyalurkan kekuatan Hati. Ia pergi kepada Nerevar yang sekarat dan menanyakan apa yang harus dilakukan dengan peralatan itu. Nerevar memanggil kembali Azura, dan ia memperlihatkan cara menggunakan peralatan tersebut untuk memisahkan kekuatan Hati dari kaum Dwemer. Di padang rumput, Tribunal dan pasukannya menyaksikan Dwemer berubah menjadi debu di sekeliling mereka ketika keabadian yang dicuri itu diserap kembali. Di Gunung Merah, Nerevar memerintahkan Dagoth‑Ur untuk melindungi peralatan dan Kamar Hati sampai ia kembali. Dagoth‑Ur bertanya, "Bukankah seharusnya kita menghancurkan peralatan ini sekaligus, agar tak pernah disalahgunakan lagi?" Namun Nerevar, lemah oleh luka dan kesedihannya (karena masih mencintai Dumac serta kaum Dwemer), pergi ke padang di luar Gunung Merah untuk berdiskusi dengan ratu dan jenderalnya, yang telah meramalkan perang ini dan nasihat mereka tak ingin ia abaikan lagi. "Aku akan menanyai Tribunal apa yang harus kami lakukan dengannya, karena mereka memiliki kebijaksanaan yang belum kumiliki. Tinggallah di sini, Dagoth‑Ur yang setia, hingga aku kembali." Nerevar kemudian menceritakan kepada ratu dan jenderalnya segala yang terjadi di bawah Gunung Merah, serta bagaimana Dwemer memakai peralatan khusus untuk menjadikan kaumnya abadi dan kekuatan luar biasa Hati Lorkhan. Tribunal memutuskan bahwa Chimer harus belajar memanfaatkan kekuatan ini supaya Nerevar dapat menguasai Resdayn dan dunia bagi rakyatnya. Nerevar tidak mengharapkan atau menginginkannya, sehingga ia meminta ratu serta jenderalnya membantu memanggil lagi Azura untuk petunjuknya. Tetapi Tribunal menjadi serakah seperti Kagrenac sesudah mendengar tentang kekuatan Hati dan menginginkannya. Mereka menjalankan ritual seolah‑olah memanggil Azura seperti yang diminta Nerevar, namun Almalexia memakai lilin beracun, Sotha Sil memakai jubah beracun, dan Vivec mengucapkan mantra beracun. Nerevar dibunuh. Meskipun begitu, Azura muncul dan mengutuk Tribunal atas perbuatan buruk mereka. Ia berkata bahwa ia akan menggunakan Powersnya saat senja dan fajar agar Nerevar kembali dan memperbaiki segala sesuatu. Tribunal menertawakannya dan berkata bahwa mereka akan segera menjadi dewa sendiri dan kaum Chimer akan melupakan cara penyembahan lama mereka. Azura mengetahui hal itu akan terjadi dan bahwa dibutuhkan waktu lama sebelum kekuatannya dapat mengembalikan Nerevar. "Apa yang kalian lakukan hari ini jauh melampaui keburukan; kalian akan menyesal karena kehidupan dewa bukanlah apa yang dipikirkan makhluk fana, dan urusan yang hanya menghitung tahun bagi manusia akan menimpa dewa selamanya." Agar mereka selamanya ingat kejahatan mereka, Azura mengubah Chimer menjadi Dunmer, kulit mereka menjadi abu-abu dan mata mereka menyala seperti api. "Biarlah tanda ini mengingatkan kalian pada diri sejati kalian yang, bagai hantu, memakan kebangsawanan, kepahlawanan, dan kepercayaan raja mereka." Kemudian Tribunal masuk ke Gunung Merah dan bertemu Dagoth‑Ur. Dagoth‑Ur melihat apa yang telah terjadi, karena kulitnya pun berubah, dan berusaha membalas kematian Nerevar namun sia‑sia. Ia dipaksa mundur dan diperkirakan mati. Tribunal menemukan peralatan yang dijaga Dagoth‑Ur dan, melalui studi metode Kagrenac, menjadikan diri mereka dewa. Ribuan tahun setelah apoteosis mereka, Tribunal masih menjadi dewa Morrowind dan The Old Ways pemujaan hanya diingat oleh sedikit orang. Pembunuhan Nerevar diketahui oleh lebih sedikit lagi. Namun ratu dan jenderalnya masih takut kepulangannya, karena kata‑kata Azura berlama‑lamanya bergaung dan mereka melihat tanda kutukan dewi itu pada bangsanya setiap hari.

String.Source: Amethyst Gem Salt Pile Albino Spider Pod
String.Dest: Permata Ametis Salt Pile Kapsul Laba-laba Albino

String.Source:
Seeker of Might: Combat skills are all 10%% more effective.
You may only accept one ability from this book at a time.
String.Dest:
Pencari Kekuatan: Pertarungan skills semuanya 10%% lebih efektif.
Anda hanya dapat menerima satu kemampuan dari buku ini sekaligus.

String.Source: I agreed to fund Ralis Sedarys' expedition to excavate Kolbjorn Barrow. I should return and see how the work is going.
String.Dest: Saya setuju untuk mendanai ekspedisi Ralis Sedarys dalam menggali Kolbjorn Barrow. Saya harus kembali dan melihat bagaimana pekerjaan itu berjalan.

String.Source: I met Wulf Wild-Blood, who told me about his brother Torkild running off many years ago. Wulf's worst fears of his brother proved true, unfortunately. I found Torkild wandering Solstheim, out of his mind, and I killed him before he could hurt me. I told Wulf the sad story of his brother's final chapters, and he taught me how to fight better for setting his mind to rest.
String.Dest: Saya bertemu Wulf Wild-Blood, yang memberitahuku tentang saudara laki-lakinya Torkild yang melarikan diri bertahun-tahun lalu. Ketakutan terburuk Wulf terhadap saudaranya terbukti benar, sayangnya. Saya menemukan Torkild berkeliaran di Solstheim, kehilangan akal, dan saya membunuhnya sebelum dia sempat melukiku. Saya menceritakan kisah menyedihkan tentang babak terakhir saudaranya kepada Wulf, dan dia mengajarku cara bertarung lebih baik untuk menenangkan pikirannya.

String.Source:
Seeker of Shadows: Stealth skills are all 10%% more effective.
You may only accept one ability from this book at a time.
String.Dest:
Pencari Bayangan: Stealth skills semuanya 10%% lebih efektif.
Anda hanya dapat menerima satu kemampuan dari buku ini pada satu waktu.

String.Source: I've slain General Falx Carius in the ruins of Fort Frostmoth. I should examine his remains to determine what he was doing here.
String.Dest: Saya telah membunuh General Falx Carius di reruntuhan Fort Frostmoth. Saya harus memeriksa sisa-sisanya untuk menentukan apa yang dia lakukan di sini.

String.Source:
[pagebreak]

The Poison Song Book V By Bristin Xel

[pagebreak]

or two days, the House healers attended Tay in his bed, and Baynarah sat by his side, holding his hand. He was feverish, neither asleep nor awake, screaming at invisible phantoms. The healers complimented the young man's fortitude. Bodies had washed ashore on the island of Gorne several times, many during the War, but never once had they seen one that lived afterwards. Aunt Ulliah came in several times to bring Baynarah food: "You must be careful, dear, or when he's all well, he'll have to attend you on your sickbed." Tay's fever broke, and at last he was able to open his eyes and see the young woman with whom he had spent seventeen years, all but the first year of his life. She smiled at him, and called for food. In silence, she helped him eat. "I knew you wouldn't die, cousin," she whispered fondly. "I hoped to, but somehow I knew I wouldn't either," he groaned. "Baynarah, do you remember all those nightmares I told you about? They're all true." "We can talk about it when you've rested some more." "No," he croaked. "I must tell you everything now, so you'll know what kind of a monster you call your dear cousin Tay. If there was some way you could have known before, you might not have been so eager to see me well again." A tear rolled Baynarah's cheek. She had grown into a beauty, even in the few months he had been away in Mournhold. "How can you think I would stop loving you, no matter what you've done?" "I saw my old nursemaid Edebah, and spoke to her." "Oh," Baynarah had feared this moment. "Tay, I don't know what she told you, but it was all my fault. You remember when Kena Grafisi taught us about the House Dagoth, and its corruption. That night, I saw your nursemaid making some kind of altar out on the north lawn, using the symbol of the Sixth House. She must have been doing it for years, but I never knew what it meant. I told Uncle Triffith, and he sent her away. I've wanted to tell you so many times now, but I was afraid to. She was so devoted to you." Tay smiled. "And didn't it frighten you even more to wonder if there was any connection between her devotion to me, and her devotion to the accursed House? I know you, Baynarah. You're not one of those women who doesn't choose to use her mind." "Tay, I don't know what she told you, but I think she was very troubled, and whatever she thought about you and the Sixth House was wrong. You have to remember that. The ramblings of one madwoman are proof of nothing." "There's more," Tay sighed, and held up his hand. For a moment he blinked, and then turned to Baynarah angrily. "What happened to my ring? If you saw it, you must have known already that everything I'm saying to you is true." "I threw the filthy thing away," Baynarah stood up. "Tay, I'm going to let you rest now." "I am the heir of House Dagoth," Tay was wild-eyed, almost screaming. "Raised after the War as House Indoril, but driven by the Song of my ancestors. When we were young, I killed Vaster because the Song told me he had stolen my inheritance. When Edebah told me who I was and gave me this ring, I killed her and burned her house to the ground, because the Song told me she had served her purpose. When I returned to Kalkorith's house, my love was there, telling me that she was of the House Dagoth too, and my sister. I fled, and when Kalkorith tried to stop me, I slew him, because the Song told me he was an enemy." "Tay, stop," Baynarah sobbed. "I don't believe a word of it. You've been feverish..." "Not Tay," he shook his head, breathing heavily. "The name my parents gave me was Dagoth-Tython." "You can't have killed Edebah, you loved her. And Vaster and Kalkorith? They were our cousins!" "They were not my true cousins," Tay said coldly. "The Song told me they were my foes. Just as it's telling me now that you're my foe, but I won't listen. And I'll keep from listening... as long as I can." Baynarah fled from the room, slamming the door behind her. She took a key from the her startled maid Hillima, and secured the lock. "Serjo Indoril-Baynarah," Hillima whispered, with great sympathy. "Is all well with your cousin, Serjo Indoril-Tay?" "He'll be perfectly fine once he rests," Baynarah recovered her dignity, wiping the tears from her face. "No one is to disturb him under any circumstances. I'll take the key with me. Now I have much work to do. I don't suppose anyone's spoken to the fishermen about restocking Sandil House's supplies?" "I don't know, serjo," said the maid. "I don't think so." Baynarah marched down to the docks, and relieved her troubled heart the only way she knew how, by concentrating on small things. Tay's words never left her, but she found temporary comfort talking to the fishermen about their haul, helping determine how much should be smoked, how much should be sent to the village, how much should be delivered fresh to the House larder. Her aunt Ulliah joined the discussion, oblivious to Baynarah's well-disguised agony. Together, they discussed how many provisions Uncle Triffith and his commanders had devoured during their weeks on the island, when they would be expected to return, and how best to prepare. One of the fishermen on the docks called out, interrupting. "A boat is coming!" Ulliah and Baynarah greeted the visitor as she arrived. It was a young woman dressed in the robes of a Temple priestess. As she docked her small boat, Baynarah marveled at how beautiful she was, and strangely familiar. "Welcome to Gorne," said Baynarah. "I am Indoril-Baynarah and this is my aunt Indoril-Ulliah. Have we met before?" "I don't believe so, serjo," the woman bowed. "I was sent by the Temple to inquire whether word had come from your cousin, Indoril-Tay. He has been missing from his classes for some days now, and the priests have become concerned." "Oh, we should have sent word," Ulliah fretted. "He came here a few days ago, half-drowned. He's better now. Let us escort you up to the house." "Tay's resting now, and I asked that he not be disturbed," Baynarah stammered. "Actually, I know it's dreadful manners, but I need to talk to my aunt for a moment. Would it be too terrible if I asked you to wait for us at the house? You have only to follow the path up the hill and across the lawn." The priestess bowed again humbly, and began the walk. Ulliah was scandalized. "You know better than to treat a representative of the Temple that way," she snapped. "You can't be so exhausted from tending your cousin to have lost all sense of civility." "Aunt Ulliah," Baynarah whispered, drawing the woman away from the ears of the fishermen. "Is Tay truly my cousin? He believes himself to be ... of the House Dagoth." Ulliah took a moment to respond. "It's true. You were just a baby yourself during the War, so you couldn't know what it was like. There was not a part of Morrowind that wasn't ravaged. There was even a battle here on the island. Do you remember that burned pile of wreckage you and Tay and poor little Vaster discovered so many years ago? That was the remains. And after the War, when that accursed House was finally defeated, we saw the little innocents, the orphans whose only crime had been born to wicked parents. I admit there were some in our armies, the combined forces of the Houses, who would have had them all slaughtered to annihilate the legacy of Dagoth. In the end, compassion prevailed, and the children of the Sixth House were adopted into the other five. And so we thought that we had won the war and the peace." "By the Mother, Lord, and Wizard, if all that Tay believes is true, then there is no peace," Baynarah trembled. "He claims that the Song of his ancestors called to him, and forced him to slay three people, two of them our Housemen. Cousin Kalkorith and ... when he was a little boy ... Vaster." Ulliah held her hands over her tearful face and could not speak. "And it is only beginning," said Baynara. "The Song still calls to him. He said there were others who knew, who would help him raise up the Sixth House. His sister..." "It must be an evil fantasy," Ulliah murmured. She noticed that Baynarah's gaze was now upon the path leading from the docks towards the house. "Niece, what are you thinking?" "Did that priestess give us her name?" The two women ran up the path, calling for guards. The fishermen, who had never seen the mistresses of the house so undone, looked briefly at one another and then followed quickly behind, pulling out their hooks and blades. The front gate to Sandil House stood wide open, the first of the corpses lying close within. It was now an abattoir, painted fresh with blood. There was Aner, uncle Triffith's valet, gutted but still seated at the foyer table where he had been enjoying his afternoon glass of flin. Leryne, one of the chambermaids, had been decapitated while carrying some once-clean linens up the stairs. The bodies of guards and servants sprawled about the hall like blown leaves. At the top of the stairs, Baynarah had to hold back a sob when she saw Hillima. She lay like a broken doll, slain as she tried to pull herself out onto the narrow window ledge. No one spoke, not Baynarah, nor Aunt Ulliah, nor the fishermen, as they walked slowly through the blood-drenched house. They passed Tay's sick-room, its door broken open, and no one within. When they heard the sound of footsteps in Baynarah's room down the hall, they approached slowly, cautiously, with great dread. The priestess from the docks was standing by the bed. In her hand was the silver ring Baynarah had taken from Tay's finger. In her other hand was a long, curved blade, splashed like her once pristine gown, with gore. She smiled prettily and bowed when she saw she was no longer alone. "Acra, I should have recognized you by Tay's description in his letters," Baynarah said in her steadiest voice. "Where is my cousin?" "I prefer to call myself Dagoth-Acra," she replied. "Your false cousin, my true brother, has already gone to fulfill his destiny. I'm sorry you were not here so he could give you a more permanent farewell." Baynarah's face twisted in fury. She motioned for the fishermen, who advanced with their weaponry. "Tear her apart." "The Sixth House will rise again, and Dagoth-Tython will lead us!" Acra laughed. Her words were still echoing as she gave the sign of Recall and vanished like a ghost.
String.Dest:
[pagebreak]

The Poison Song Buku V Oleh Bristin Xel

[pagebreak]

Selama dua hari, penyembuh Rumah merawat Tay di tempat tidurnya, dan Baynarah duduk di sisinya, memegang tangannya. Ia demam, tidak tertidur maupun terjaga, berteriak pada hantu tak terlihat. Penyembuh memuji ketabahan pemuda itu. Beberapa kali jenazah terdampar di pantai Pulau Gorne, banyak di antaranya selama Perang, namun tak pernah sekali pun mereka melihat satu yang masih hidup setelahnya. Bibi Ulliah masuk berkali‑kali membawa makanan untuk Baynarah: "Kau harus berhati‑hati, sayang, karena bila dia sehat kembali, ia harus mengurusmu di ranjang sakitmu." Demam Tay akhirnya reda, dan akhirnya ia dapat membuka mata dan melihat wanita muda yang telah menghabiskan tujuh belas tahun bersamanya, kecuali tahun pertama hidupnya. Ia tersenyum padanya, dan memanggil makanan. Dengan diam, ia membantu Tay makan. "Aku tahu kau tidak akan mati, sepupu," bisiknya penuh kasih. "Aku berharap begitu, tapi entah bagaimana aku tahu aku tidak akan," Tay mengerang. "Baynarah, apakah kau ingat semua mimpi buruk yang kututurkan padamu? Semua itu benar." "Kita bisa membicarakannya setelah kau beristirahat lebih lama." "Tidak," geramnya. "Aku harus memberitahumu semuanya sekarang, agar kau tahu betapa mengerikannya monster yang kau sebut sepupumu yang tercinta, Tay. Seandainya kau sudah mengetahui sebelumnya, mungkin kau tak akan begitu bersemangat melihatku sehat kembali." Air mata mengalir di pipi Baynarah. Ia telah menjadi seorang cantik, bahkan dalam beberapa bulan singkat ia berada di Mournhold. "Bagaimana kau bisa berpikir aku akan berhenti mencintaimu, apa pun yang kau lakukan?" "Aku melihat perawat lama ku, Edebah, dan berbicara dengannya." "Oh," Baynarah takut momen ini. "Tay, aku tidak tahu apa yang dia katakan padamu, tetapi itu semua salahku. Kau ingat ketika Kena Grafisi mengajarkan kami tentang House Dagoth, dan korupsinya. Malam itu, ku lihat perawatmu membuat semacam altar di halaman utara, menggunakan simbol House Keenam. Ia pasti telah melakukannya selama bertahun‑tahun, tapi aku tak pernah tahu artinya. Aku memberitahu Paman Triffith, dan dia mengusirnya. Aku sudah berkali‑kali ingin memberitahumu, tapi takut. Ia sangat setia padamu." Tay tersenyum. "Bukankah itu membuatmu lebih takut membayangkan ada hubungan antara kesetiaannya padaku dan kesetiaannya pada House terkutuk itu? Aku tahu kau, Baynarah. Kau bukan salah satu wanita yang tak mau menggunakan akalnya." "Tay, aku tidak tahu apa yang dia katakan padamu, tetapi aku pikir dia sangat terganggu, dan apapun yang dipikirkannya tentangmu dan House Keenam itu salah. Kau harus ingat itu. Omong kosong satu Madwoman tidak membuktikan apa‑apa." "Masih ada lagi," Tay menghela napas, mengangkat tangannya. Sesaat ia berkedip, lalu berbalik pada Baynarah dengan marah. "Apa yang terjadi pada cincinnya? Jika kau melihatnya, kau pasti sudah tahu bahwa semua yang kukatakan padamu itu benar." "Aku membuang barang kotor itu," Baynarah berdiri. "Tay, aku akan membiarkanmu beristirahat sekarang." "Aku adalah pewaris House Dagoth," Tay berteriak hampir berteriak, matanya liar. "Dibesarkan setelah Perang sebagai House Indoril, namun dipandu oleh Lagu leluhurku. Saat masih muda, aku membunuh Vaster karena Lagu memberitahuku bahwa ia mencuri warisanku. Ketika Edebah memberitahuku siapa aku dan memberiku cincin ini, aku membunuhnya dan membakar rumahnya menjadi abu, karena Lagu berkata ia telah menjalankan tugasnya. Ketika aku kembali ke rumah Kalkorith, cintaku ada di sana, memberitahuku bahwa dia juga dari House Dagoth, dan saudara perempuanku. Aku melarikan diri, dan ketika Kalkorith mencoba menghentikanku, aku membunuhnya, karena Lagu mengatakan ia musuh." "Tay, hentikan," Baynarah terisak. "Aku tidak percaya satu kata pun. Kau demam..." "Bukan Tay," ia menggeleng, bernafas berat. "Nama yang diberikan orang tuaku kepadaku adalah Dagoth‑Tython." "Kau tidak mungkin membunuh Edebah, kau mencintainya. Dan Vaster serta Kalkorith? Mereka sepupu kita!" "Mereka bukan sepupu sejati ku," Tay berkata dingin. "Lagu memberitahuku bahwa mereka musuhku. Sama seperti sekarang lagu mengatakan engkau musuhku, tapi aku takkan mendengarnya. Dan aku akan terus menutup telinga... selagi ku masih bisa." Baynarah melarikan diri dari ruangan, membanting pintu di belakangnya. Ia mengambil kunci dari pelayan Hillima yang kaget, dan mengunci pintu. "Serjo Indoril‑Baynarah," Hillima berbisik dengan simpati. "Apakah sepupumu, Serjo Indoril‑Tay, baik‑baik saja?" "Dia akan baik-baik saja setelah beristirahat," Baynarah memulihkan martabatnya, menghapus air mata. "Jangan seorangpun mengganggunya dalam keadaan apapun. Aku akan membawa kunci ini bersamaku. Sekarang aku ada banyak pekerjaan. Aku tidak yakin ada yang sudah berbicara dengan para nelayan tentang mengisi kembali persediaan Sandil House?" "Aku tidak tahu, serjo," kata pelayan. "Kurasa tidak." Baynarah berbaris turun ke pelabuhan, dan melegakan hatinya yang gelisah dengan cara yang dia tahu, yaitu memusatkan perhatian pada hal‑hal kecil. Kata‑kata Tay tak pernah lepas darinya, namun ia menemukan penghiburan sementara dengan berbicara pada para nelayan tentang hasil tangkapan mereka, membantu menentukan berapa banyak yang harus diasapi, berapa banyak dikirim ke desa, dan berapa banyak diserahkan segar ke gudang House. Bibi Ulliah bergabung dalam diskusi, tak menyadari penderitaan Baynarah yang tersamar. Bersama‑sama mereka membahas berapa banyak bekal yang telah dikonsumsi Paman Triffith dan komandonya selama minggu‑minggu mereka di pulau, kapan mereka diharapkan kembali, dan cara terbaik mempersiapkannya. Salah satu nelayan di pelabuhan berseru, memotong pembicaraan. "Sebuah perahu sedang datang!" Ulliah dan Baynarah menyambut pengunjung saat dia tiba. Itu seorang wanita muda berbalut jubah pendeta Kuil. Saat ia menambatkan perahu kecilnya, Baynarah terkagum pada kecantikannya, dan rasa kenalan yang aneh. "Selamat datang di Gorne," kata Baynarah. "Aku Indoril‑Baynarah dan ini bibiku Indoril‑Ulliah. Apakah kami pernah bertemu sebelumnya?" "Aku rasa tidak, serjo," wanita itu membungkuk. "Aku dikirim Kuil untuk menanyakan apakah ada kabar dari sepupumu, Indoril‑Tay. Dia telah menghilang dari Classesnya selama beberapa hari, dan para pendeta menjadi khawatir." "Oh, kami seharusnya mengirim kabar," Ulliah gugup. "Dia datang ke sini beberapa hari lalu, hampir tenggelam. Sekarang dia lebih baik. Izinkan kami mengantarmu ke rumah." "Tay sedang beristirahat, dan aku meminta dia tidak diganggu," Baynarah tercekik. "Sebenarnya, aku tahu ini sopan yang mengerikan, tapi aku perlu berbicara dengan bibiku sebentar. Apakah terlalu berlebihan jika aku memintamu menunggu kami di rumah? Kau hanya perlu mengikuti jalan setapak menanjak bukit dan melintasi halaman." Pendeta itu membungkuk lagi dengan rendah hati, dan mulai berjalan. Ulliah tercengang. "Kau tahu lebih baik daripada memperlakukan perwakilan Kuil seperti itu," ia memarahi. "Kau tak seharusnya begitu lelah mengurus sepupumu sampai kehilangan semua rasa kesopanan." "Bibi Ulliah," Baynarah berbisik, menarik wanita itu menjauh dari telinga para nelayan. "Apakah Tay benar‑benar sepupuku? Dia percaya dirinya ... dari House Dagoth." Ulliah meluangkan waktu menjawab. "Itu benar. Kau masih bayi saat Perang, jadi kau tak bisa tahu seperti apa. Tidak ada bagian Morrowind yang tidak dilanda. Bahkan ada pertempuran di pulau ini. Apakah kau ingat tumpukan puing terbakar yang kau, Tay, dan Vaster temukan bertahun‑tahun lalu? Itu sisa-sisanya. Dan setelah Perang, saat House terkutuk itu akhirnya dikalahkan, kami melihat anak‑anak kecil tak bersalah, anak yatim piatu yang satu‑satunya dosa mereka dilahirkan dari orangtua jahat. Aku mengakui ada beberapa di pasukan kami, gabungan kekuatan House, yang ingin membunuh mereka semua untuk memusnahkan warisan Dagoth. Pada akhirnya, belas kasihan menang, dan Children House Keenam diadopsi ke lima House lainnya. Maka kami kira kami telah memenangkan perang dan perdamaian." "Demi Ibu, Tuan, dan Penyihir, bila semua yang diyakini Tay itu benar, maka tidak ada perdamaian," Baynarah bergetar. "Dia mengklaim Lagu leluhur memanggilnya, memaksanya membunuh tiga orang, dua di antaranya anggota House kami. Sepupu Kalkorith dan ... ketika ia masih kecil ... Vaster." Ulliah menutupi wajah berkaca airnya dan tak dapat berkata-kata. "Dan itu baru permulaan," kata Baynarah. "Lagu masih memanggilnya. Dia bilang ada orang lain yang tahu, yang akan membantunya mengangkat House Keenam. Saudara perempuannya..." "Itu pasti khayalan jahat," gumam Ulliah. Ia melihat pandangan Baynarah kini tertuju pada jalan yang mengarah dari pelabuhan ke rumah. "Keponakan, apa yang kau pikirkan?" "Apakah pendeta itu memberi kami namanya?" Kedua wanita berlari menuruni jalan, memanggil penjaga. Para nelayan, yang belum pernah melihat nyonya‑nyonya House begitu terpuruk, saling melirik sebentar lalu bergegas mengikutinya, mengeluarkan kail dan pedang. Gerbang depan Sandil House terbuka lebar, mayat pertama tergeletak dekat di dalam. Sekarang menjadi tempat pemotongan, berlumur darah segar. Ada Aner, pelayan Paman Triffith, yang dipotong perutnya namun masih duduk di meja foyer tempat ia menikmati segelas flin sore. Leryne, salah satu pelayan kamar, telah dipenggal saat mengangkat linen bersih ke atas tangga. Mayat penjaga dan pelayan berserakan di aula seperti daun yang ditiup angin. Di puncak tangga, Baynarah menahan isak ketika ia melihat Hillima. Ia tergeletak seperti boneka rusak, terbunuh saat ia berusaha menggapai tepi jendela sempit. Tak ada yang berbicara, bukan Baynarah, bukan Bibi Ulliah, bukan pula para nelayan, saat mereka berjalan perlahan melewati rumah yang berlumur darah. Mereka melewati kamar sakit Tay, pintunya terbuka lebar, dan tak ada siapa‑siapa di dalam. Ketika mereka mendengar langkah kaki di kamar Baynarah di sepanjang lorong, mereka mendekat perlahan, berhati‑hati, dengan rasa takut yang mendalam. Pendeta dari pelabuhan berdiri di samping tempat tidur. Di tangannya ada cincin perak yang diambil Baynarah dari jari Tay. Di tangan lain ia memegang pedang melengkung panjang, berlumuran darah seperti jubahnya yang dulu bersih. Ia tersenyum manis dan membungkuk ketika menyadari tidak lagi sendiri. "Acra, seharusnya aku mengenalmu dari deskripsi Tay dalam surat‑suratnya," Baynarah berkata dengan suara paling mantap. "Di mana sepupuku?" "Aku lebih suka menyebut diriku Dagoth‑Acra," jawabnya. "Sepupumu yang palsu, saudaraku yang sejati, sudah pergi menunaikan takdirnya. Maaf kau tidak berada di sini sehingga ia bisa memberi perpisahan yang lebih abadi." Wajah Baynarah memucat dengan amarah. Ia mengisyaratkan para nelayan, yang maju dengan senjata mereka. "Robeklah dia." "House Keenam akan bangkit lagi, dan Dagoth‑Tython akan memimpin kami!" Acra tertawa. Kata‑katanya masih bergema ketika ia memberi isyarat Recall dan menghilang seperti hantu.
