<font face='$HandwrittenFont'>Ini adalah pengingat bahwa Anggur Emberbrand dan barang selundupan serupa dilarang bagi kalian semua. Setiap penjaga yang ditemukan memiliki items seperti ini dalam kepemilikannya akan dikenai disiplin dan dapat diusir dari Penjaga Redoran.
Captain Veleth

String.Source:
<font face='$HandwrittenFont'>Dearest Dinya,
I know that your father doesn't approve of us, but I'm willing to do whatever it takes to make our relationship work. I think the time has come to speak to him in person and stop letting him hear about us through gossip and rumor. I love you, and I don't care if the entire world knows. Please think about it.
Modyn
String.Dest:
<font face='$HandwrittenFont'>Dearest Dinya,
Saya tahu bahwa ayahmu tidak menyetujui kami, tetapi saya bersedia melakukan apa saja untuk membuat hubungan kami berhasil. Saya rasa saatnya telah tiba untuk berbicara dengannya secara langsung dan berhenti membiarkannya mendengar tentang kami lewat gosip dan rumor. Aku mencintaimu, dan aku tidak peduli kalau seluruh dunia mengetahuinya. Tolong pikirkanlah.
Modyn

String.Source:
<font face='$HandwrittenFont'>Councilor Morvayn,
Below are the results of the survey you requested.
The Bulwark needs extensive repair. Ash is beginning to seep through the cracks inside the barracks and weakening the structure.
Repairs to the docks have been completed. We can now accommodate two ships at once if need be.
We've lost a total of twenty-six Redoran Guard in the last two years. We've seen ten replacements in the last five.
There's been no improvement in the condition of the water around the island. While there are fish still present, there are nowhere near enough to sustain us as a fishing town.
As you can see, we are in desperate need of relief. Sorry to be the bearer of such bad news, but I'm only doing as you requested.
Adril
String.Dest:
<font face='$HandwrittenFont'>Penasihat Morvayn,
Berikut adalah hasil survei yang Anda minta.
The Bulwark membutuhkan perbaikan ekstensif. Abu mulai merembes melalui retakan di dalam barak dan melemahkan struktur.
Perbaikan pelabuhan telah selesai. Kami kini dapat menampung dua kapal sekaligus bila diperlukan.
Kami telah kehilangan total dua puluh enam Penjaga Redoran dalam dua tahun terakhir. Kami telah menerima sepuluh pengganti dalam lima tahun terakhir.
Tidak ada perbaikan kondisi air di sekitar pulau. Meskipun masih ada ikan, jumlahnya jauh tidak cukup untuk menopang kami sebagai sebuah kota nelayan.
Seperti yang Anda lihat, kami berada dalam kebutuhan bantuan yang mendesak. Maaf harus menyampaikan kabar buruk ini, namun saya hanya melakukan apa yang Anda minta.
Adril

String.Source:
<font face='$HandwrittenFont'>Milore,
I hope the day finds you well. Well, Athras and I have finally mustered the courage to return to Mournhold and pick up the pieces. We haven't been back to the manor in almost fifty years, but things haven't changed much. The city feels a bit empty... Barenziah's palace is still completely unoccupied and most of the Redoran Guard have been reassigned to other parts of Morrowind. They've continued to make improvements to Mournhold Temple, removing the last vestiges of Almalexia's mark and adding a new sanctuary. Plaza Brindisi Dorom has changed as well. House Indoril has erected a large building there to house all of the new pilgrims and priests that seem to have flocked here to pay their respects at the temple.
Athras has returned to work as a jewelcrafter and he's gaining quite a following. He's bringing in a good bit of coin, a little of which I've sent to you as usual. Things are going well, and at this rate, we'll have the manor restored to its former glory by winter. I know you're tired of hearing about it, but I implore you to reconsider my offer. We have plenty of room here, and both of you are always welcome to join us. I know it's tough out there, but suffering in that horrible place just to prove a point isn't necessary anymore. Just a little sisterly advice.
Nilara
String.Dest:
<font face='$HandwrittenFont'>Milore,
Semoga hari ini menemukanmu dalam keadaan baik. Nah, akhirnya Athras dan aku berhasil mengumpulkan Courage untuk kembali ke Mournhold dan memperbaiki semuanya. Kami belum kembali ke manor selama hampir lima puluh tahun, namun keadaan tidak banyak berubah. Kota terasa agak sepi... Istana Barenziah masih kosong total dan kebanyakan Penjaga Redoran telah dipindahkan ke bagian lain Morrowind. Mereka terus melakukan perbaikan pada Kuil Mournhold, menghapus sisa-sisa jejak Almalexia dan menambahkan sanctuary baru. Plaza Brindisi Dorom juga telah berubah. House Indoril telah mendirikan sebuah bangunan besar di sana untuk menampung semua peziarah dan pendeta baru yang tampaknya berbondong-bondong datang ke sini untuk memberi penghormatan di kuil.
Athras kembali bekerja sebagai pembuat perhiasan dan kini mendapatkan banyak pengikut. Ia menghasilkan cukup banyak uang, sebagian kecilnya telah ku kirim kepadamu seperti biasa. Semuanya berjalan baik, dan pada kecepatan ini, manor akan kembali pulih ke kemegahan masa lalunya sebelum musim dingin. Aku tahu kau lelah mendengar cerita ini, namun aku mohon pertimbangkan kembali tawaranku. Kami memiliki banyak ruang di sini, dan kalian berdua selalu dipersilakan bergabung dengan kami. Aku tahu situasinya sulit di luar sana, namun menderita di tempat mengerikan itu hanya untuk membuktikan sesuatu tidak lagi diperlukan. Hanya sedikit nasihat adik perempuan.
Nilara

String.Source:
<font face='$HandwrittenFont'>Councilor Morvayn,
While I appreciate the urgency of the situation on Solstheim, I'm afraid that I can't approve the request for supplies and funds at this time. This is nothing personal, Lleril. Your island is one of seventy-four outlying settlements of Morrowind at this time. House Redoran must rank these outposts in terms of economic and strategic importance. We have limited coin in our coffers to send to these settlements, so we have to decide which ones take precedence. Unfortunately, Solstheim is very low on the list. I'm doing everything I can for you. All I ask is that you hang on a little longer.
Dralis Rorlen Councilmember, House Redoran
String.Dest:
<font face='$HandwrittenFont'>Konselor Morvayn,
Sementara saya menghargai urgensi situasi di Solstheim, saya khawatir saya tidak dapat menyetujui permintaan pasokan dan dana saat ini. Ini bukan hal pribadi, Lleril. Pulau Anda merupakan salah satu dari tujuh puluh empat pemukiman terpencil di Morrowind saat ini. House Redoran harus menilai pos-pos ini berdasarkan pentingnya secara ekonomi dan strategis. Kami memiliki koin terbatas di brankas kami untuk dikirim ke pemukiman-pemukiman tersebut, sehingga kami harus memutuskan mana yang harus diprioritaskan. Sayangnya, Solstheim berada sangat rendah dalam daftar. Saya melakukan segala yang saya bisa untuk Anda. Semua yang saya minta adalah Anda bersabar sedikit lagi.
Dralis Rorlen Anggota Dewan, House Redoran

String.Source:
[pagebreak]

The History of Raven Rock Volume II by Lyrin Telleno

[pagebreak] [pagebreak]

Forward Raven Rock is one of the more interesting colonies of Morrowind of the last two centuries. So much has happened to this tiny town in such a short amount of time, and so many lives have been affected by it, I felt it necessary to describe its rich history within these volumes. During my research, I lived in Raven Rock for almost three years, and I got to know many of my fellow Dunmer who call Raven Rock their home. I hope that my readers will appreciate the amount of fortitude and perseverance that it must take to endure life in such an inhospitable and untamed land. [pagebreak]

fter a few years, the relentless ash storms from the ever-erupting Red Mountain had transformed Solstheim's southern reaches into pure ash wastes reminiscent of those present on Vvardenfell itself. The storms would leave behind deep dunes of ash that made life exceedingly difficult in Raven Rock. In order to protect the town from these drifts, Brara Morvayn proposed that the East Empire Company construct a large wall of her own design to protect the east end of town. The company quickly agreed and provided the necessary funds. After almost a year, the construction was complete and the huge edifice was named "The Bulwark." The wall proved to be extremely effective and allowed work to continue unabated in the mines. In 4E 16, when Solstheim was passed into the hands of the Dunmer people, the East Empire Company was forced to relinquish Raven Rock's control to House Redoran. The Council quickly named Brara Morvayn as councilor of their new town, and allowed her to rule Solstheim as she saw fit. As a result of this changing of the guard, almost the entire Imperial population left Raven Rock and returned to Cyrodiil. Brara continued to welcome the Dunmer that elected to settle on Solstheim. Some chose to stay in Raven Rock to work in the mines, and other took to more familiar territory and began a nomadic lifestyle in the ash wastes. The next few decades were the golden years for Raven Rock. Brara Morvayn was keeping the peace, the mines were still producing large quantities of ebony and the Dunmer that lived on the island were happy. After almost fifty years of prosperity, in 4E 65, Brara Morvayn finally succumbed to old age and passed away. She was interred in the family's ancestral tomb and her son, Lleril Morvayn, took her place. The people who had lived in Raven Rock during Brara's time as councilor were pleased to discover that Lleril shared his mother's notions of rulership. He was fair and compassionate, which kept the people on the island quite happy for many decades.
String.Dest:
[pagebreak]

The History of Raven Rock Volume II oleh Lyrin Telleno

[pagebreak] [pagebreak]

Pengantar Raven Rock adalah salah satu koloni Morrowind yang paling menarik selama dua abad terakhir. Begitu banyak yang terjadi pada kota kecil ini dalam waktu yang singkat, dan begitu banyak kehidupan yang terpengaruh olehnya, saya merasa perlu menggambarkan sejarahnya yang kaya dalam volume ini. Selama penelitian saya, saya tinggal di Raven Rock selama hampir tiga tahun, dan saya belajar mengenal banyak rekan Dunmer saya yang menyebut Raven Rock sebagai rumah mereka. Saya berharap para pembaca saya akan menghargai keberanian dan ketekunan yang diperlukan untuk bertahan hidup di tanah yang begitu tidak ramah dan liar. [pagebreak]

Setelah beberapa tahun, badai abu yang tak henti‑hentinya dari Gunung Merah yang terus meletus telah mengubah wilayah selatan Solstheim menjadi padang abu murni yang mengingatkan pada yang ada di Vvardenfell sendiri. Badai tersebut meninggalkan bukit abu yang dalam sehingga kehidupan di Raven Rock menjadi sangat sulit. Untuk melindungi kota dari pasir abu ini, Brara Morvayn mengusulkan agar East Empire Company membangun sebuah tembok besar dengan desainnya sendiri untuk melindungi ujung timur kota. Perusahaan dengan cepat menyetujui dan menyediakan dana yang diperlukan. Setelah hampir setahun, pembangunan selesai dan bangunan besar itu dinamai "The Bulwark." Tembok tersebut terbukti sangat efektif dan memungkinkan pekerjaan di tambang terus berlanjut tanpa gangguan. Pada 4E 16, ketika Solstheim diserahkan kepada bangsa Dunmer, East Empire Company dipaksa menyerahkan kontrol Raven Rock kepada House Redoran. Dewan dengan cepat menamakan Brara Morvayn sebagai anggota dewan kota baru mereka, dan mengizinkannya mengatur Solstheim sesuka hatinya. Sebagai akibat dari perubahan kepemimpinan ini, hampir seluruh populasi Imperial meninggalkan Raven Rock dan kembali ke Cyrodiil. Brara terus menyambut Dunmer yang memilih menetap di Solstheim. Beberapa memilih tetap di Raven Rock untuk bekerja di tambang, dan yang lain beralih ke wilayah yang lebih familiar dan memulai gaya hidup nomaden di padang abu. Beberapa dekade berikutnya menjadi masa keemasan bagi Raven Rock. Brara Morvayn menjaga perdamaian, tambang tetap menghasilkan banyak ebony, dan Dunmer yang tinggal di pulau itu bahagia. Setelah hampir lima puluh tahun kemakmuran, pada 4E 65, Brara Morvayn akhirnya menyerah pada usia tua dan meninggal. Ia dimakamkan di makam leluhur keluarga dan putranya, Lleril Morvayn, menggantikannya. Orang-orang yang tinggal di Raven Rock pada masa Brara sebagai anggota dewan senang mengetahui bahwa Lleril berbagi pandangan ibunya tentang kepemimpinan. Ia adil dan berbelas kasih, yang membuat penduduk pulau tersebut sangat bahagia selama beberapa dekade.

String.Source:
[pagebreak]

The History of Raven Rock Volume III by Lyrin Telleno

[pagebreak] [pagebreak]

Forward Raven Rock is one of the more interesting colonies of Morrowind of the last two centuries. So much has happened to this tiny town in such a short amount of time, and so many lives have been affected by it, I felt it necessary to describe its rich history within these volumes. During my research, I lived in Raven Rock for almost three years, and I got to know many of my fellow Dunmer who call Raven Rock their home. I hope that my readers will appreciate the amount of fortitude and perseverance that it must take to endure life in such an inhospitable and untamed land. [pagebreak]

ll was going well in Raven Rock until 4E 95, when an attempt on Lleril's life was made without warning. Fortunately, the attack was unsuccessful thanks to the prowess of the Redoran Guard. Under questioning by Captain Modyn Veleth, the assassin was revealed to be Vilur Ulen of House Hlaalu. House Hlaalu had been at odds with House Redoran for years following their removal from the Council of Great Houses. The Hlaalu believe that House Redoran was instrumental in this reorganization, and have held a grudge ever since. Their attempt on Lleril's life was meant to send a message to the Council that House Redoran was not as mighty as they purported to be and that they were truly vulnerable and weak. The Redoran Guard investigated futhur and discovered that Vilur had been organizing a coup in Raven Rock in an attempt to fully wrest control of the island from Lleril's grasp. Vilur and his conspirators were executed and the coup was quelled. Several recent events have served to solidify the Dunmer people's respect for Lleril Morvayn. In 4E 130, the Bulwark began to show its age and threatened to crumble. The councilor elected to use the bulk of his personal fortune to have it repaired. In 4E 150, a small force of Argonians landed on Solstheim with the intent of wreaking havoc on the island, and Councillor Morvayn led the charge against them personally. And in 4E 170, when the ebony mine finally began to dry up, he drained the remainder of his coffers keeping the people fed. By 4E 181, the mine's ebony veins were completely exhausted. Lleril ordered the mine to be shut down, and Raven Rock turned to hunting and fishing for its trade. A few Dunmer families departed Solstheim and returned to the mainland, but most stayed behind. At present, Lleril Morvayn is still the ruler of Raven Rock. The Redoran Guard continues to maintain order within the town and the surrounding area, keeping Raven Rock's residents safe, and in line. If even so much as a rumor of dissent reaches Lleril's ears, he has it quashed immediately. He's well aware that there may be a few Hlaalu loyalists still present among her population that would like to see him dead. The future may appear bleak for Raven Rock, but the spirit of its inhabitants will never be broken.
String.Dest:
[pagebreak]

The History of Raven Rock Volume III by Lyrin Telleno

[pagebreak] [pagebreak]

Pengantar Raven Rock adalah salah satu koloni Morrowind yang paling menarik dalam dua abad terakhir. Begitu banyak hal telah terjadi pada kota kecil ini dalam waktu yang singkat, dan begitu banyak kehidupan yang terpengaruh olehnya, saya merasa perlu menggambarkan sejarahnya yang kaya dalam volume ini. Selama penelitian saya, saya tinggal di Raven Rock hampir tiga tahun, dan saya mengenal banyak Dunmer sesama yang menyebut Raven Rock sebagai rumah mereka. Saya berharap pembaca saya akan menghargai betapa banyak keberanian dan ketekunan yang diperlukan untuk bertahan hidup di tanah yang begitu tidak ramah dan liar ini. [pagebreak]

Semua berjalan baik di Raven Rock sampai tahun 4E 95, ketika sebuah percobaan pembunuhan terhadap Lleril dilakukan tanpa Warning. Untungnya, serangan itu gagal berkat kehebatan Redoran Guard. Dalam interogasi oleh Kapten Modyn Veleth, pembunuh tersebut terungkap sebagai Vilur Ulen dari House Hlaalu. House Hlaalu telah berseteru dengan House Redoran selama bertahun-tahun setelah mereka dicopot dari Dewan Great Houses. Hlaalu percaya bahwa House Redoran berperan penting dalam reorganisasi ini, dan sejak itu menyimpan dendam. Percobaan mereka terhadap hidup Lleril dimaksudkan untuk mengirim pesan kepada Dewan bahwa House Redoran tidak sekuat yang mereka klaim dan sebenarnya rapuh serta lemah. Redoran Guard menyelidiki lebih lanjut dan menemukan bahwa Vilur telah mengatur kudeta di Raven Rock dengan tujuan sepenuhnya merebut kendali pulau dari genggaman Lleril. Vilur dan konspiratornya dieksekusi dan kudeta tersebut dipadamkan. Beberapa peristiwa terbaru telah memperkuat rasa hormat rakyat Dunmer terhadap Lleril Morvayn. Pada 4E 130, The Bulwark mulai menunjukkan usianya dan mengancam runtuh. Anggota dewan tersebut memutuskan menggunakan sebagian besar kekayaan pribadinya untuk memperbaikinya. Pada 4E 150, sekelompok kecil Argonian mendarat di Solstheim dengan niat mengacaukan pulau, dan Dewan Morvayn memimpin serangan secara pribadi. Dan pada 4E 170, ketika tambang ebony akhirnya mulai mengering, ia mengosongkan sisa kekayaannya untuk memberi makan penduduk. Pada 4E 181, urat-urat ebony tambang habis sepenuhnya. Lleril memerintahkan tambang ditutup, dan Raven Rock beralih ke perburuan dan memancing untuk berdagang. Beberapa keluarga Dunmer meninggalkan Solstheim dan kembali ke daratan, tetapi mayoritas tetap tinggal. Saat ini, Lleril Morvayn masih menjadi penguasa Raven Rock. Redoran Guard terus menjaga ketertiban di dalam kota dan daerah sekitarnya, memastikan penduduk Raven Rock tetap aman dan terkendali. Jika sekecil apapun rumor pemberontakan sampai ke telinga Lleril, ia segera memadamkannya. Ia sangat menyadari bahwa mungkin masih ada beberapa pendukung setia Hlaalu di antara penduduknya yang ingin melihatnya mati. Masa depan mungkin tampak suram bagi Raven Rock, tetapi semangat penduduknya tidak akan pernah patah.

String.Source:
[pagebreak]

Children of the All-Maker by Tharstan of Solitude

[pagebreak]

f the title of this text rings familiar, then perhaps you, like me, have had the great pleasure to become acquainted with a most remarkable people, the Skaal of Solstheim. Upon first meeting these gentle wild-folk, I was immediately impressed with their great hospitality. They welcomed me into their homes, one and all, without the slightest hint of suspicion or uncertainty. Trust, it seems, comes readily to the Skaal. In appearance, the Skaal are clearly of Nord ancestry. However, they are culturally distinct in several significant ways, the most notable of which is their faith. Having never adopted the pantheon of the Empire, the Skaal recognize only a single deity whom they call the All-Maker. For the Skaal, the All-Maker is the source of all life and creation. When a creature dies, its spirit returns to the All-Maker, who shapes it into something new and returns it to Mundus. The concept of death as an ending to life is unknown to the Skaal. Rather, death is seen as simply the beginning of the next stage of an endless journey. This great respect for life is evident in one of the most important Skaal beliefs, a concept the villagers call "one-ness with the land". The Skaal try to live in harmony with their surroundings, making as small an impact on their environment as possible. When a Skaal villager sets out to collect firewood, for example, he or she takes it from fallen, dead trees. When the Skaal hunt, it is only out of necessity, and not for sport. Because they hold all life in great reverence, the Skaal people will resort to violence only as a last resort. This has understandably led to a rather austere lifestyle for these simple, good-natured folk. For the Skaal, the word "luxury" is nearly an alien concept, though I was intrigued to note that one villager, Edla, has taken to trading basic goods with travelers who pass through the village in exchange for small luxury items. Such an enterprising outlook is something of a novelty for the Skaal. Though it saddens me to conclude this account on such a somber note, it is impossible to deny the hard truth that the Skaal people are dwindling. In a century or two, it is possible that their unique way of life will be lost to the world forever, reduced to little more than a footnote in the great epoch of history. This comes as little surprise, given the immense hardships of a life lived in such an extreme environment. For the Skaal, it is a daily struggle to survive the perpetual wintry climate of northern Solstheim, but other challenges have recently appeared. The ashfall from Vvardenfell has taken its toll on the plants and animals upon which the Skaal depend for their survival, and life is now a struggle for all who call Solstheim home. Therefore, I humbly beseech any students of history who might encounter this modest text to travel to Solstheim and learn all that can be learned of this noble people and their ancient customs. The Skaal people might not be long for this world, but let us assure that their proud and noble legacy lasts well into the future.
String.Dest:
[pagebreak]

Children of the All-Maker oleh Tharstan of Solitude

[pagebreak]

Jika judul teks ini terasa familiar, maka mungkin Anda, seperti saya, telah menikmati kehormatan besar untuk mengenal sebuah suku yang luar biasa, yaitu Skaal dari Solstheim. Ketika pertama kali bertemu dengan suku liar yang lembut ini, saya langsung terkesan dengan keramahan mereka yang luar biasa. Mereka menyambut saya ke dalam rumah mereka, satu demi satu, tanpa sedikitpun kecurigaan atau keraguan. Kepercayaan, tampaknya, datang dengan mudah bagi Skaal. Dalam penampilan, Skaal jelas memiliki keturunan Nord. Namun, mereka berbeda secara budaya dalam beberapa cara penting, yang paling menonjol adalah kepercayaan mereka. Karena tidak pernah mengadopsi panteon Kekaisaran, Skaal hanya mengakui satu dewa yang mereka sebut All-Maker. Bagi Skaal, All-Maker adalah sumber semua kehidupan dan penciptaan. Ketika makhluk mati, rohnya kembali kepada All-Maker, yang membentuknya menjadi sesuatu yang baru dan mengembalikannya ke Mundus. Konsep kematian sebagai akhir kehidupan tidak dikenal oleh Skaal. Sebaliknya, kematian dipandang hanya sebagai awal tahap berikutnya dalam perjalanan yang tak berujung. Penghormatan besar terhadap kehidupan ini terlihat dalam salah satu kepercayaan paling penting Skaal, sebuah konsep yang disebut penduduk desa sebagai "kesatuan dengan tanah". Skaal berusaha hidup selaras dengan lingkungan mereka, memberikan dampak Impact sekecil mungkin pada alam sekitarnya. Misalnya, ketika seorang penduduk Skaal pergi mengumpulkan kayu bakar, dia mengambilnya dari pohon-pohon yang telah tumbang dan mati. Saat Skaal berburu, hal itu hanya karena kebutuhan, bukan untuk hiburan. Karena mereka menghormati semua kehidupan secara mendalam, orang Skaal hanya akan menggunakan kekerasan sebagai pilihan terakhir. Hal ini secara wajar menghasilkan gaya hidup yang cukup sederhana bagi orang-orang yang ramah dan sederhana ini. Bagi Skaal, kata "kemewahan" hampir menjadi konsep asing, meskipun saya tertarik mencatat bahwa seorang penduduk, Edla, mulai berdagang barang-barang dasar dengan para pelancong yang lewat desa dengan imbalan items mewah kecil. Pandangan yang begitu berjiwa wirausaha ini merupakan sesuatu yang baru bagi Skaal. Meskipun membuat saya sedih mengakhiri laporan ini dengan nada suram, tidak dapat dipungkiri kebenaran pahit bahwa suku Skaal semakin berkurang. Dalam satu atau dua abad, mungkin cara hidup mereka yang unik akan hilang selamanya, tereduksi menjadi sekadar catatan kecil dalam era sejarah yang besar. Hal ini tidak mengherankan, mengingat kesulitan besar yang dihadapi hidup di lingkungan yang begitu ekstrem. Bagi Skaal, tiap hari adalah perjuangan untuk bertahan hidup di iklim beku yang terus-menerus di Solstheim utara, namun tantangan lain baru-baru ini muncul. Hujan abu dari Vvardenfell telah memberikan dampak besar pada tumbuhan dan hewan yang menjadi sumber hidup Skaal, dan kini kehidupan menjadi perjuangan bagi semua yang menyebut Solstheim sebagai rumah. Oleh karena itu, saya dengan rendah hati memohon kepada semua pelajar sejarah yang mungkin menemukan teks sederhana ini untuk mengunjungi Solstheim dan mempelajari segala hal yang dapat dipelajari tentang bangsa mulia ini dan adat kuno mereka. Mungkin suku Skaal tidak akan lama lagi di dunia ini, namun marilah kita memastikan bahwa warisan mereka yang bangga dan mulia tetap bertahan hingga masa depan.

String.Source:
[pagebreak]

The History of Raven Rock Volume I by Lyrin Telleno

[pagebreak] [pagebreak]

Forward Raven Rock is one of the more interesting colonies of Morrowind of the last two centuries. So much has happened to this tiny town in such a short amount of time, and so many lives have been affected by it, I felt it necessary to describe its rich history within these volumes. During my research, I lived in Raven Rock for almost three years, and I got to know many of my fellow Dunmer who call Raven Rock their home. I hope that my readers will appreciate the amount of fortitude and perseverance that it must take to endure life in such an inhospitable and untamed land. [pagebreak]

aven Rock was founded in 3E 427 by the East Empire Company in response to the discovery of a rich ebony mine on the southern edge of the island of Solstheim. The construction of the town took several months, and the mine immediately started yielding ebony ore that the miner's shipped to Windhelm in Skyrim. By 3E 432, the town was home to over thirty people, all of whom depended on the mine for their livelihood. At this time, Raven Rock was almost exclusively inhabited by Imperials and a few Nords who were drawn to the mine's wealth. When the Oblivion Crisis arose in 3E 433, Raven Rock remained largely untouched by Mehrunes Dagon's forces and work continued as usual. The bulk of the Imperial Guard that was stationed in Raven Rock was recalled to Cyrodiil to fight the invading forces, but a few soldiers remained behind in order to protect the ebony mine from bandits. It's uncertain whether any Oblivion Gates ever opened on Solstheim, as there appears to be no record of such an event ever occurring there. In the first year of the Fourth Era, after the destruction of Ald'ruhn, many of the Dunmer Great Houses sent out small groups of their own to seek places to reestablish themselves. House Redoran's group was led by Brara Morvayn who immediately struck out for Solstheim. After some quick negotiations with the East Empire Company (and some speculate quite a bit of coin changing hands), Brara's group was allowed to settle in Raven Rock where they quickly became a part of the mining colony's way of life. The Dunmer proved to be both hard-working and reliable when it came to working in the mines, impressing the East Empire Company and solidifying their relationship. All was going quite well until that fateful day in 4E 5 when the Red Mountain suddenly erupted, sending a massive blast across the Sea of Ghosts that struck Solstheim with its full fury. Raven Rock was heavily damaged by this wave of force, which toppled several of its stone structures and obliterated many of the wooden ones. Ironically, the mine once again proved to be the town's saving grace, as most of the population of Raven Rock was working underground at the time, and was completely shielded from the blast. This event wasn't without cost, however. Raven Rock was heavily dependent on nearby Fort Frostmoth for its defense, but the eruption had almost completely wiped it from the face of Solstheim. The few soldiers that survived took residence in Raven Rock itself and attempted to set up a makeshift garrison there, but these scant few were hardly a match for potential threats to their town. With the East Empire Company's permission, Brara brought in some of House Redoran's elite "Redoran Guard" to fill the void. The guard proved to be an ideal replacement for the fallen Imperial soldiers and have been guarding the town ever since.
String.Dest:
[pagebreak]

The History of Raven Rock Volume I oleh Lyrin Telleno

[pagebreak] [pagebreak]

Forward Raven Rock adalah salah satu koloni Morrowind yang paling menarik selama dua abad terakhir. Begitu banyak yang terjadi di kota kecil ini dalam waktu singkat, dan begitu banyak kehidupan yang terpengaruh olehnya, saya merasa perlu menggambarkan sejarahnya yang kaya dalam jilid ini. Selama penelitian saya, saya tinggal di Raven Rock hampir tiga tahun, dan saya mengenal banyak Dunmer yang menjadikan Raven Rock rumah mereka. Saya harap para pembaca saya akan menghargai jumlah ketabahan dan kegigihan yang diperlukan untuk bertahan hidup di tanah yang begitu tidak ramah dan liar ini. [pagebreak]

aven Rock didirikan pada 3E 427 oleh East Empire Company sebagai respons terhadap penemuan tambang ebony yang kaya di tepi selatan pulau Solstheim. Pembangunan kota memakan waktu beberapa bulan, dan tambang segera mulai menghasilkan bijih ebony yang dikirim para penambang ke Windhelm di Skyrim. Pada 3E 432, kota ini dihuni oleh lebih dari tiga puluh orang, yang semuanya bergantung pada tambang untuk mata pencaharian mereka. Pada masa itu, Raven Rock hampir seluruhnya dihuni oleh Imperials dan beberapa Nord yang tertarik pada kekayaan tambang. Ketika The Oblivion Crisis muncul pada 3E 433, Raven Rock tetap sebagian besar tidak tersentuh oleh pasukan Mehrunes Dagon dan pekerjaan berlanjut seperti biasa. Sebagian besar Penjaga Imperial yang ditempatkan di Raven Rock dipanggil kembali ke Cyrodiil untuk melawan pasukan penjajah, namun beberapa prajurit tetap tinggal untuk melindungi tambang ebony dari bandit. Tidak pasti apakah ada Pintu Oblivion yang pernah terbuka di Solstheim, karena tampaknya tidak ada catatan tentang kejadian semacam itu di sana. Pada tahun pertama Era Keempat, setelah penghancuran Ald'ruhn, banyak Dunmer Great Houses mengirimkan kelompok kecil mereka sendiri untuk mencari tempat guna memulihkan diri. Kelompok House Redoran dipimpin oleh Brara Morvayn yang segera berangkat ke Solstheim. Setelah beberapa negosiasi cepat dengan East Empire Company (dan sebagaimana spekulasi ada pertukaran koin yang cukup banyak), kelompok Brara diizinkan menetap di Raven Rock dimana mereka dengan cepat menjadi bagian dari cara hidup koloni penambangan. Dunmer terbukti pekerja keras dan dapat diandalkan dalam bekerja di tambang, mengesankan East Empire Company dan memperkuat hubungan mereka. Semua berjalan cukup baik hingga hari malapetaka pada 4E 5 ketika Gunung Merah tiba-tiba meletus, memuntahkan ledakan dahsyat melintasi Sea of Ghosts yang menghantam Solstheim dengan seluruh kemarahannya. Raven Rock mengalami kerusakan parah akibat gelombang kekuatan ini, yang menjatuhkan beberapa bangunan batu dan menghancurkan banyak bangunan kayu. Ironisnya, tambang kembali menjadi penyelamat kota, karena sebagian besar penduduk Raven Rock sedang bekerja di bawah tanah pada saat itu, dan sepenuhnya terlindungi dari ledakan. Namun peristiwa ini tidak tanpa biaya. Raven Rock sangat bergantung pada Fort Frostmoth di sekitarnya untuk pertahanan, namun letusan hampir sepenuhnya menghilangkan benteng itu dari permukaan Solstheim. Beberapa prajurit yang selamat mengambil tempat tinggal di Raven Rock sendiri dan mencoba mendirikan garnisun darurat di sana, tetapi sedikit mereka tidak cukup untuk menghadapi ancaman potensial terhadap kota mereka. Dengan izin East Empire Company, Brara membawa beberapa anggota elite "Redoran Guard" dari House Redoran untuk mengisi kekosongan. Penjaga ini terbukti menjadi pengganti ideal bagi tentara The Fallen Imperial dan telah menjaga kota sejak itu.

String.Source: Increases your stamina by 60 points and allows wearer to release the Breath of Nchuak, a powerful steam attack.
String.Dest: Meningkatkan stamina Anda sebanyak 60 poin dan memungkinkan pemakainya melepaskan Breath of Nchuak, serangan uap yang kuat.

String.Source:
[pagebreak]

The Guardian and the Traitor by Lucius Gallus Fellow of the Imperial Library Year 376 of the Third Era

[pagebreak]

ne of the more intriguing legends found on the island of Solstheim is the story of a mythical figure whose name is long forgotten, but whom time remembers as "the Traitor." Certain that this myth is rooted in history I set out to learn what I could and perhaps piece together a presumptive account of the events that gave rise to the legend. The tale is remembered best by the shamans of the Skaal, that unique tribe of Nords whose culture evolved along an entirely divergent path than that of their brethren in Skyrim. I spoke at length to the shaman of Skaal Village, a wise and hospitable man named Breigr Winter-Moon. He described an age long ago when dragons ruled over the whole world and were worshipped as gods by men. Presiding over this cult of dragon-worshippers were the Dragon Priests, powerful mages who could speak the dragon language and call upon the power of the thu'um, or Voice. According to the legend, one such Dragon Priest was seduced by a dark spirit named Herma-Mora, an unmistakable analogue for the Daedric prince Hermaeus Mora. Lured by promises of power, this treacherous priest secretly plotted against his dragon master. The Traitor's plot was discovered by one of his contemporaries, another Dragon Priest whom legend named The Guardian. The two fought a mighty battle that lasted for days, each hurling terrible arcane energies and thu'um shouts at the other. So great and terrible were the forces unleashed in this contest that Solstheim was torn apart from the mainland of Skyrim. Here, the myth clearly descends into the realm of pure fantasy. The Guardian, whom the legend presents as a paragon of loyalty and nobility, finally defeats the despicable Traitor, who seems to represent all that is corrupt and evil in men. Their epic duel is clearly representative of a greater struggle between good and evil. Perhaps it is this timeless quality that has kept the tale alive for so long. Unlike many similar myths, the tale of the Guardian and the Traitor does not feature a suitably heroic ending. Herma-Mora snatches the Traitor away just as the Guardian is about to strike the killing blow. The dragons appoint the Guardian ruler of Solstheim, but not before he is compelled to swear an oath of vigilance to watch for the Traitor's return. His reign is, by all accounts, a time of peace and prosperity for the people of the island, and he is remembered as a wise and just leader. No further mention is made of the Traitor, but neither is he thought to be dead. The legend ends on a cautionary note that the people of Solstheim, the heirs of the Guardian, must remain wary, lest the dark influence of Herma-Mora, or even the Traitor himself, return someday. Although no physical clues exist now on Solstheim to suggest the presence of the dragon cult, is it hardly difficult to believe that it might once have flourished here. Perhaps some hidden tomb still waits to be discovered that will tell the truth of the tale. There are other tantalizing clues, though perhaps these connections strain the bonds of credibility. For example, is it possible that the Skaal deity, the All-Maker, is some distant echo of mighty Alduin, the World-Eater of the ancient Nord pantheon? Perhaps not, but one thing is certain: Solstheim's history is riddled with unanswered questions. Perhaps future generations will pull aside the veils of mystery and reveal the truth about the origins of the Skaal and the identities of the Guardian and the Traitor.
String.Dest:
[pagebreak]

The Guardian and the Traitor by Lucius Gallus Fellow of the Imperial Library Year 376 of the Third Era

[pagebreak]

ne dari legenda yang paling menarik yang ditemukan di pulau Solstheim adalah kisah tentang sosok mitos yang namanya telah lama terlupakan, namun waktu mengingatnya sebagai "Pengkhianat". Yakin bahwa mitos ini berakar pada sejarah, saya berusaha mempelajari apa yang saya bisa dan mungkin menyusun sebuah akun dugaan tentang peristiwa yang melahirkan legenda tersebut. Kisah ini paling dikenal oleh para dukun Skaal, suku Nord yang unik yang budayanya berkembang di jalur yang sepenuhnya berbeda dari saudara‑saudaranya di Skyrim. Saya berbicara lama dengan dukun Desa Skaal, seorang pria bijak dan ramah bernama Breigr Winter-Moon. Dia menggambarkan zaman kuno ketika Dragons memerintah seluruh dunia dan disembah sebagai dewa oleh manusia. Memimpin kultus penyembah naga ini adalah Pendeta Naga, penyihir kuat yang dapat berbicara dalam bahasa naga dan memanggil kekuatan thu'um, atau Suara. Menurut legenda, salah satu Pendeta Naga itu tergoda oleh roh gelap bernama Herma-Mora, analog yang jelas untuk pangeran Daedra Hermaeus Mora. Dihiaskan dengan janji-janji kekuasaan, pendeta pengkhianat ini diam‑diam merencanakan pemberontakan melawan sang master naga. Rencana Pengkhianat itu terungkap oleh salah satu rekannya, Pendeta Naga lain yang dalam legenda disebut Sang Penjaga. Kedua mereka bertarung dalam pertempuran dahsyat yang berlangsung berhari‑hari, masing‑masing melontarkan energi arcanic mengerikan dan teriakan thu'um kepada lawannya. Begitu besar dan mengerikannya kekuatan yang dilepaskan dalam kontes ini sehingga Solstheim terbelah dari daratan Skyrim. Di sini, mitos jelas menuruni ranah fantasi murni. Sang Penjaga, yang dalam legenda digambarkan sebagai teladan kesetiaan dan kebangsawanan, akhirnya mengalahkan Pengkhianat yang keji, yang tampaknya mewakili segala keburukan dan kejahatan dalam manusia. Duel epik mereka jelas melambangkan pergulatan yang lebih besar antara kebaikan dan kejahatan. Mungkin kualitas abadi inilah yang membuat cerita tetap hidup selama itu lama. Berbeda dengan banyak mitos serupa, kisah The Guardian and the Traitor tidak berakhir dengan pahlawan yang heroik. Herma-Mora mencabut Pengkhianat tepat ketika Sang Penjaga hendak memberikan pukulan mematikan. Dragons mengangkat Sang Penjaga menjadi penguasa Solstheim, namun tidak sebelum ia dipaksa mengucapkan ikrar Vigilance untuk mengawasi kepulangan Pengkhianat. Pemerintahannya, menurut semua catatan, adalah masa damai dan kemakmuran bagi penduduk pulau itu, dan ia dikenang sebagai pemimpin yang bijaksana dan adil. Tidak ada lagi penyebutan tentang Pengkhianat, namun ia tidak dianggap mati. Legenda berakhir dengan peringatan bahwa penduduk Solstheim, pewaris Sang Penjaga, harus tetap waspada, agar pengaruh gelap Herma-Mora, atau bahkan Pengkhianat sendiri, tidak kembali suatu hari. Meskipun tidak ada petunjuk fisik yang kini ada di Solstheim yang menunjukkan keberadaan kultus naga, tidak sulit mempercayai bahwa itu pernah berkembang di sini. Mungkin ada makam tersembunyi yang masih menunggu untuk ditemukan yang akan mengungkap kebenaran kisah itu. Ada petunjuk lain yang menggoda, meskipun mungkin koneksi ini memeras ikatan kredibilitas. Misalnya, apakah mungkin dewa Skaal, Sang Pencipta Segala, adalah gema jauh dari Alduin yang perkasa, Penghancur Dunia dalam pantheon Nord kuno? Mungkin tidak, namun satu hal pasti: sejarah Solstheim dipenuhi pertanyaan yang belum terjawab. Mungkin generasi mendatang akan mengungkap tirai misteri dan mengungkap kebenaran tentang asal usul Skaal dan identitas The Guardian and the Traitor.

String.Source:
[pagebreak]

The Reclamations: The Fall of the Tribunal and the Rise of the New Temple by Thara of Rihad

[pagebreak] [pagebreak]

he destruction of Vivec City and the subsequent eruption of Red Mountain in 4E 5 was not just a crisis in terms of the physical destruction it caused - it also cut deeply into the ancient religious beliefs of the Dunmer. The fall of the Ministry of Truth was the last straw in the tottering support for the Temple's worship of Almalexia, Sotha Sil, and Vivec. With all three of the Tribunes now widely believed dead or disappeared, what had been a simmering schism within the ranks of the Temple priesthood burst into the open. While outsiders may never know the full tale of this internal struggle, when the smoke cleared a few years later, the former Dissident Priests were in full control of the Temple heirarchy, with Tribunal loyalists either purged or recanted. The so-called "New Temple" now declared the worship of the Tribunes a result of misguided teaching, blaming the mistakes on the former Tribunal. The Temple now taught that the daedra venerated by the Ashlander tribes (Azura, Mephala and Boethia) were the "true way" and should be revered by the Dunmer people. Fittingly, the daedra were named the "Reclamations," as if they were reclaiming their status from the Tribunal. In an elegant comprise, no doubt intended to reconcile the large majority of the Temple priesthood who were neither Dissidents nor fanatic Tribunal loyalists, Almalexia, Sotha Sil and Vivec were relegated to the status of "saints," a traditional way to venerate the most honored Dunmer ancestors. This apparently satisfied enough of the existing priesthood that the New Temple was able to maintain at least a semblance of outward continuity. The rise of the New Temple almost completely vindicated the previously persecuted Ashlanders, who had continued to worship the three daedra throughout the Tribunal's rule. The Ashlanders are now lauded as the keepers of the old ways and having "true vision." It is now quite common for many of the Dunmer people to make the arduous pilgrimages into the ash wastes to seek the counsel of the Wise Women. These women have supposedly opened the eyes of those who they claim were "blinded by the Tribunal," and directly connect the eruption of the Red Mountain and the Argonian invasion to the anger of the three daedra. House Indoril, whose fortunes were so entwined with the Tribunal Temple, suffered greatly from its fall. While House Indoril still technically exists, the priesthood of the Temple are now considered one and the same with House Indoril - those who become priests are now considered to have "joined Indoril." The political power of the Indoril has thus passed entirely into the hands of the Temple (although members of the old House Indoril are still over-represented in the priesthood). The rise of the New Temple has a number of interesting parallels with the rise of House Redoran - each filled the vacuum of power resulting from the crisis of Red Year. How durable these new arrangements will prove, religious and political, remains to be seen. The span of two centuries is quite brief in the long history of the ancient Dunmer people.
String.Dest:
[pagebreak]

The Reclamations: Kejatuhan Tribunal dan Kebangkitan Kuil Baru oleh Thara of Rihad

[pagebreak] [pagebreak]

The destruction of Vivec City and the subsequent eruption of Red Mountain in 4E 5 was not just a crisis in terms of the physical destruction it caused - it also cut deeply into the ancient religious beliefs of the Dunmer. Kehancuran Kota Vivec serta letusan Gunung Merah yang terjadi pada 4E 5 bukan hanya merupakan krisis dalam hal kehancuran fisik yang ditimbulkannya — ia juga menusuk dalam kepercayaan agama kuno bangsa Dunmer. Jatuhnya Kementerian Kebenaran menjadi titisan terakhir dalam dukungan yang goyah terhadap pemujaan Kuil terhadap Almalexia, Sotha Sil, dan Vivec. Dengan ketiga Tribun kini secara luas diyakini mati atau menghilang, apa yang sebelumnya merupakan perpecahan yang mendidih di dalam barisan pendeta Kuil meletus ke permukaan. Meskipun orang luar mungkin tidak pernah mengetahui keseluruhan cerita perjuangan internal ini, ketika asap mereda beberapa tahun kemudian, para Pendeta Pemberontak sebelumnya menguasai penuh hierarki Kuil, dengan para pendukung Tribunal yang dibersihkan atau mengingkari. Kuil yang disebut "Kuil Baru" kini menyatakan pemujaan terhadap Tribun sebagai hasil ajaran yang keliru, menyalahkan kesalahan kepada Tribunal sebelumnya. Kuil kini mengajarkan bahwa daedra yang dipuja oleh suku Ashlander (Azura, Mephala dan Boethia) adalah "jalan sejati" dan harus dihormati oleh bangsa Dunmer. Secara tepat, daedra tersebut dinamakan "Reclamations," seolah-olah mereka merebut kembali status mereka dari Tribunal. Dalam sebuah kompromi yang elegan, jelas dimaksudkan untuk mendamaikan mayoritas besar pendeta Kuil yang bukan Pemberontak maupun pendukung fanatik Tribunal, Almalexia, Sotha Sil, dan Vivec diturunkan ke status "santo," cara tradisional untuk memuja leluhur Dunmer yang paling terhormat. Hal ini tampaknya memuaskan cukup banyak pendeta yang ada sehingga Kuil Baru mampu mempertahankan setidaknya sekilas kontinuitas luar. Kebangkitan Kuil Baru hampir sepenuhnya membenarkan Ashlander yang sebelumnya dianiaya, yang terus memuja tiga daedra selama pemerintahan Tribunal. Ashlander kini dipuji sebagai penjaga The Old Ways dan memiliki "penglihatan sejati." Sekarang sudah cukup umum bagi banyak orang Dunmer untuk melakukan perjalanan suci yang melelahkan ke padang abu demi mencari nasihat dari Wanita Bijak. Wanita-wanita ini konon telah membuka mata mereka yang mereka klaim "dibutakan oleh Tribunal," dan secara langsung menghubungkan letusan Gunung Merah serta invasi Argonian dengan Anger dari tiga daedra. House Indoril, yang keberuntungannya begitu terjalin dengan Kuil Tribunal, menderita berat akibat kejatuhannya. Meskipun House Indoril secara teknis masih ada, pendeta Kuil kini dianggap satu dan sama dengan House Indoril — mereka yang menjadi pendeta dianggap telah "bergabung dengan Indoril." Kekuasaan politik Indoril dengan demikian sepenuhnya beralih ke tangan Kuil (meskipun anggota House Indoril lama masih terlalu banyak di dalam pendeta). Kebangkitan Kuil Baru memiliki sejumlah paralel menarik dengan kebangkitan House Redoran — masing‑masing mengisi kekosongan kekuasaan yang dihasilkan oleh krisis Tahun Merah. Seberapa tahan lama pengaturan baru ini, baik religius maupun politik, masih belum dapat diprediksi. Rentang dua abad sangat singkat dalam sejarah panjang bangsa Dunmer kuno.

String.Source:
[pagebreak]

The Red Year Volume I by Melis Ravel

[pagebreak] [pagebreak]

Foreword When I originally decided to write this accounting of the Red Year, I elected to travel across Morrowind and speak to the Dunmer people themselves. I sought first-hand accounts and personal views about the cataclysmic event. I felt that if I simply did the research in the library stacks at the College of Winterhold, I wasn't really telling the tale that needed to be told. What struck me as I moved from city to city, town to town, camp to camp is that all of the Dunmer I met shared an incredible bond of sheer courage and unshakable faith. So what began as a chronicle of one of the worst events in the history of Morrowind became something altogether different, the celebration of a people who can never be defeated. [pagebreak]

Drallin Vess Tear "The ground... it just turned into mush. There was almost no warning. I mean, we were what... perhaps a mile from the nearest swamps? It was like the swamp suddenly swallowed up half of the city." I asked him to describe what happened from the beginning. "I owned a farm just outside of Tear at the time. We were planting the next season's crops and getting ready to store what we had harvested. Everything was going well until the Red Mountain exploded. Almost immediately, the ground rumbled and shook. Cracks started forming everywhere and then the water just started seeping through. It was awful. In a matter of hours, I was knee-deep in swamp water running for my life. Where I was running, I had no idea. At first I ran towards the city itself, but it looked like the walls were cracking. All around me, people were desperately trying to save their livestock and their families from the rising water. Just when the ground shaking finally died down, and I had a moment to think, there was a horrible cracking noise. I'll never forget it, because I knew what it was before I looked. The entire southern wall of Tear collapsed sending guards tumbling into the swamp. I heard people screaming as they were covered by the rubble and forced down into the water. Forgetting my own problems, I looked over at my fellow farmers who were all staring at the carnage unfolding before us. Suddenly, we all just forgot our own problems and ran to help. There must have been hundreds of the poorer folks who lived outside the walls helping the richer ones who lived in the city. Never saw anything like that. I think we must have saved hundreds more that day." [pagebreak] Neria Relethyl Gnisis Neria was badly burned by the eruption, and had trouble speaking to me. She is currently convalescing at the Temple of Azura in Blacklight even after all these years. I've tried to record her story to the best of my ability. "It was such a terrible thing... the fire. It burned everything in its path. It flattened trees, turned our huts into splinters and knocked over towers like they were made from parchment. It all happened in an instant. A rumbling sound, then a massive wall of flame... it was so high it blocked out the sun. I thought that the world itself had split apart. It passed over the water and turned it to steam... vaporized everything it touched. When it finally hit us, I was blown off of my feet... didn't even have time to run away or seek shelter. I ended up in the riverbed next to town, which kept some of the flames off of me. All around... could smell the charred stench of death. There were Dunmer that were burned alive and some never even saw it coming. I lay in that riverbed for two days before the healers found me. When I could finally stand, Gnisis was gone. There wasn't a thing left... it's as though it was wiped from the face of Tamriel."
String.Dest:
[pagebreak]

The Red Year Volume I by Melis Ravel

[pagebreak] [pagebreak]

Kata Pengantar Ketika saya pada awalnya memutuskan menulis catatan tentang The Red Year, saya memutuskan untuk berkeliling Morrowind dan berbicara langsung dengan orang‑orang Dunmer itu sendiri. Saya mencari kesaksian langsung dan pandangan pribadi tentang peristiwa kataklysmik tersebut. Saya merasa bahwa bila saya sekadar melakukan riset di tumpukan Library di The College of Winterhold, saya tidak benar‑benar menceritakan kisah yang perlu diceritakan. Apa yang saya rasakan saat berpindah dari kota ke kota, desa ke desa, perkemahan ke perkemahan adalah semua Dunmer yang saya temui memiliki ikatan luar biasa berupa Courage murni dan kepercayaan yang tak tergoyahkan. Jadi apa yang dimulai sebagai kronik salah satu peristiwa terburuk dalam sejarah Morrowind berubah menjadi sesuatu yang benar‑benar berbeda, sebuah perayaan bagi sebuah bangsa yang tidak pernah dapat dikalahkan. [pagebreak]

Drallin Vess Tear "Tanah... tiba‑tiba berubah menjadi lunak seperti bubur. Hampir tidak ada Warning sama sekali. Maksud saya, kami berada... mungkin satu mil dari rawa terdekat? Rasanya seperti rawa itu tiba‑tiba menelan setengah kota." Saya memintanya untuk menjelaskan apa yang terjadi sejak awal. "Pada saat itu saya memiliki sebuah pertanian di luar kota Tear. Kami sedang menanam Crops musim berikutnya dan bersiap menyimpan hasil panen. Semuanya berjalan lancar sampai Gunung Merah meletus. Hampir seketika, tanah bergetar dan bergoyang. Retakan muncul di mana‑mana dan air mulai merembes masuk. Itu mengerikan. Dalam hitungan jam, saya terendam air rawa sampai lutut sambil berlari menyelamatkan diri. Ke mana saya berlari, saya tidak tahu. Awalnya saya berlari menuju kota itu sendiri, tapi tampak tembok‑temboknya mulai retak. Di sekeliling saya, orang‑orang berusaha menyelamatkan ternak dan keluarga mereka dari air yang naik. Saat getaran tanah akhirnya mereda, dan saya sempat berpikir, terdengar suara retakan yang mengerikan. Saya tidak akan pernah melupakannya, karena saya sudah tahu apa itu sebelum melihatnya. Seluruh tembok selatan Tear runtuh, menjatuhkan penjaga ke dalam rawa. Saya mendengar orang berteriak saat mereka tertutup puing‑puing dan terjatuh ke dalam air. Melupakan masalah saya sendiri, saya menoleh ke sesama petani yang menatap kepunahan yang terjadi di depan kami. Tiba‑tiba, kami semua melupakan masalah kami masing‑masing dan berlari membantu. Pasti ada ratusan orang miskin yang tinggal di luar tembok membantu orang kaya yang tinggal di dalam kota. Saya belum pernah melihat hal seperti itu. Saya rasa kami menyelamatkan ratusan orang lagi hari itu." [pagebreak] Neria Relethyl Gnisis Neria terbakar parah akibat letusan, dan kesulitan berbicara dengan saya. Saat ini ia sedang dalam masa pemulihan di Kuil Azura di Blacklight meskipun sudah bertahun‑tahun berlalu. Saya telah berusaha merekam ceritanya sebaik mungkin. "Itu memang sesuatu yang mengerikan... api itu. Ia membakar segala sesuatu yang dilaluinya. Ia menebas pohon‑pohon, mengubah pondok‑pondok kami menjadi serpihan, dan menjatuhkan menara‑menara seolah‑olah terbuat dari kertas. Semua itu terjadi dalam sekejap. Suara gemuruh terdengar, lalu dinding api yang besar... begitu tinggi hingga menutupi matahari. Saya pikir dunia itu sendiri telah terbelah. Ia melintas di atas air dan mengubahnya menjadi uap... menguapkan segala sesuatu yang disentuhnya. Saat akhirnya ia menghantam kami, saya terlempar dari kaki… bahkan tak sempat berlari menjauh atau mencari perlindungan. Saya berakhir di atap sungai dekat kota, yang melindungi saya dari sebagian api. Di sekeliling... kami bisa mencium bau hangus kematian. Ada Dunmer yang terbakar hidup‑hidup dan beberapa tidak pernah menyadarinya. Saya terbaring di atap sungai itu selama dua hari sebelum penyembuh menemukan saya. Saat saya akhirnya bisa berdiri, Gnisis telah hilang. Tidak ada apa‑apa yang tersisa... seolah‑olah itu dihapus dari permukaan Tamriel."

String.Source: <font face="$HandwrittenFont"> I finally caved and told Ulyn that I would help him retrieve this "Visage of Mzund" that he has been so obsessed over. Why he wants some dwarven helmet so much is beyond me, but I owe him so whatever. [pagebreak] We've stopped to take a breather after crossing over the gears. This place is amazing but it seems to serve no purpose that I can tell. Why the dwarves would waste so much good metal on gears, pipes and constructs is completely beyond me. We had to fight off several of the metal spiders while spinning around on the gears. Got so dizzy we almost fell off. </font>
String.Dest: <font face="$HandwrittenFont"> Saya akhirnya menyerah dan memberi tahu Ulyn bahwa saya akan membantunya mendapatkan "Visage of Mzund" yang dia begitu terobsesi. Mengapa dia menginginkan helm dwarf itu begitu banyak masih di luar saya, tapi saya berhutang padanya jadi saya melakukannya. [pagebreak] Kami berhenti sejenak untuk menghirup napas setelah menyeberangi roda gigi. Tempat ini menakjubkan namun tampaknya tidak memiliki tujuan yang saya mengerti. Mengapa Dwarves menghabiskan begitu banyak logam bagus untuk roda gigi, pipa, dan bangunan benar‑benar di luar pemahaman saya. Kami harus melawan beberapa laba‑laba logam saat berputar di atas roda gigi. Kami hampir pusing sampai hampir terjatuh. </font>

String.Source:
[pagebreak]

The Red Year Volume II by Melis Ravel

[pagebreak] [pagebreak]

Foreword When I originally decided to write this accounting of the Red Year, I elected to travel across Morrowind and speak to the Dunmer people themselves. I sought first-hand accounts and personal views about the cataclysmic event. I felt that if I simply did the research in the library stacks at the College of Winterhold, I wasn't really telling the tale that needed to be told. What struck me as I moved from city to city, town to town, camp to camp is that all of the Dunmer I met shared an incredible bond of sheer courage and unshakable faith. So what began as a chronicle of one of the worst events in the history of Morrowind became something altogether different, the celebration of a people who can never be defeated. [pagebreak]

Saldus Llervu Vivec City "I was a trader back then. Ran a pack guar from Vivec City clear down to Narsis. I was walking along the south road when the strangest thing happened. All of the noise around me stopped... the normal things one hears as they travel like the sound of the wind blowing through the treetops. It was just deathly quiet. I felt a tingling sensation all over my body and my guar began to stomp around. Whatever it was, it was driving him crazy. As I tried to get him under control, there was a massive explosion from the center of the city. I saw the cantons fall apart before I was knocked off my feet. Then I remember the ground starting to rumble. It lasted for a long time and it receded into the distance as if directed towards the center of Vvardenfell. A few minutes later, the Red Mountain erupted, sending a huge cloud of fire into the sky. My pack guar had long since fled, and I decided I should do the same. I never stopped running until I reached Narsis." I asked him if he knew what had happened Vivec City. "I didn't hear until much later that the Ministry of Truth had struck the heart of the city. What I do know for certain is that many Dunmer lost their lives that day and that Vivec City is no more." [pagebreak] Deros Dran Mournhold "The Red Year didn't heavily affect Mournhold itself, but it touched many of the people who lived there. A lot of us had relatives somewhere on Vvardenfell, and after the first day that the eruption occurred we started receiving reports of widespread devastation in Vivec City, Sadrith Mora, Balmora and Ald'ruhn. I don't think a single night went by for months where you wouldn't hear someone openly weeping. It was a sad time for all of us." I asked if Mournhold had sustained any damage during the Red Year. "I don't know why, but the destruction seemed to pass us by. A few Dunmer claimed that it was the Tribunal watching over us, but others claimed that the Tribunal was to blame for everything. I actually saw a few of those disagreements come to blows. It was a strange time." I got an interesting response from Deros regarding Mournhold's role during the Red Year. "Relief efforts began almost a month after the mountain erupted. It was actually a directive that came from the House Redoran councilor that was living in Mournhold at the time. I can't remember his name, but he took charge of the situation and sent soldiers, supplies and able-bodied Dunmer to the outlying settlements that had been hit the hardest. I was sent to Balmora. The place was a mess; hardly anything left in town was still standing. I spent maybe two months there, helping to rebuild the town and getting my fellow Dunmer back on their feet. It started out as a burden, but it ended up being the most rewarding thing I'd ever done in my life. I started some friendships there that still last to this day, including my beloved wife."
String.Dest:
[pagebreak]

The Red Year Volume II by Melis Ravel

[pagebreak] [pagebreak]

Pendahuluan Ketika pertama kali saya memutuskan menulis catatan tentang The Red Year ini, saya memilih untuk melakukan perjalanan melintasi Morrowind dan berbicara langsung dengan orang-orang Dunmer itu sendiri. Saya mencari kesaksian langsung dan pandangan pribadi mengenai peristiwa cataklysmik itu. Saya merasa kalau saya hanya meneliti di tumpukan Library di The College of Winterhold, saya tidak akan benar‑benar menceritakan kisah yang perlu diceritakan. Yang mengejutkan saya saat berpindah dari kota ke kota, desa ke desa, kemah ke kemah, adalah semua Dunmer yang saya temui memiliki ikatan luar biasa yang didasarkan pada Courage murni dan kepercayaan yang tak tergoyahkan. Jadi apa yang awalnya merupakan kronik tentang salah satu peristiwa terburuk dalam sejarah Morrowind menjadi sesuatu yang sama sekali berbeda, perayaan bagi sebuah bangsa yang tak pernah dapat dikalahkan. [pagebreak]

Saldus Llervu Vivec City "Saya dulu seorang pedagang. Mengarahkan sekumpulan guar sejak Vivec City hingga ke Narsis. Saya sedang berjalan di jalan selatan ketika hal paling aneh terjadi. Seluruh kebisingan di sekitar saya tiba‑tiba berhenti... suara‑suara biasanya yang terdengar ketika seseorang bepergian, seperti desiran angin lewat kanopi pepohonan. Seketika menjadi sunyi yang mematikan. Saya merasakan sensasi kesemutan di seluruh tubuh dan guar saya mulai menginjak‑injak. Apapun itu, membuatnya gila. Saat saya mencoba menenangkannya, tiba‑tiba ada ledakan dahsyat dari pusat kota. Saya melihat distrik‑distrik runtuh sebelum saya tersandung dan terjatuh. Lalu saya ingat tanah mulai bergetar. Getarannya berlangsung lama dan perlahan memudar ke arah pusat Vvardenfell. Beberapa menit kemudian, Red Mountain meletus, mengirimkan awan api raksasa ke langit. Guar dalam pak saya sudah lama melarikan diri, dan saya memutuskan untuk melakukan hal yang sama. Saya tidak berhenti berlari sampai akhirnya mencapai Narsis." Saya menanyainya apakah ia tahu apa yang terjadi di Vivec City. "Saya baru mendengar kemudian bahwa Ministry of Truth telah menyerang jantung kota itu. Yang saya tahu pasti adalah banyak Dunmer yang kehilangan nyawanya pada hari itu dan Vivec City tidak ada lagi." [pagebreak] Deros Dran Mournhold "The Red Year tidak terlalu memengaruhi Mournhold secara langsung, namun peristiwa itu menyentuh banyak orang yang tinggal di sana. Banyak di antara kami memiliki kerabat di suatu tempat di Vvardenfell, dan setelah hari pertama letusan terjadi kami mulai menerima laporan tentang kehancuran luas di Vivec City, Sadrith Mora, Balmora, dan Ald'ruhn. Saya rasa tidak ada satu malam pun selama berbulan‑bulan yang tidak ada orang menangis secara terbuka. Itu adalah masa yang sangat menyedihkan bagi kami semua." Saya menanyainya apakah Mournhold mengalami kerusakan selama The Red Year. "Saya tidak tahu mengapa, tetapi kehancuran itu sepertinya melewati kami. Beberapa Dunmer mengklaim itu adalah Tribunal yang mengawasi kami, namun yang lain menuduh Tribunal sebagai penyebab semuanya. Saya bahkan menyaksikan beberapa perselisihan itu berujung pada perkelahian. Itu adalah masa yang aneh." Saya mendapatkan jawaban menarik dari Deros mengenai peran Mournhold selama The Red Year. "Upaya bantuan dimulai hampir sebulan setelah gunung itu meletus. Sebenarnya perintah itu datang dari penasehat House Redoran yang tinggal di Mournhold saat itu. Saya tidak ingat namanya, tetapi dia mengambil alih situasi dan mengirimkan prajurit, persediaan, serta Dunmer yang mampu ke pemukiman terpencil yang paling parah terkena. Saya dikirim ke Balmora. Tempat itu berantakan; hampir tidak ada bangunan yang masih berdiri. Saya menghabiskan kira‑kira dua bulan di sana, membantu membangun kembali kota dan menolong sesama Dunmer kembali bangkit. Awalnya terasa beban, namun pada akhirnya menjadi hal paling memuaskan yang pernah saya lakukan dalam hidup. Saya menjalin beberapa persahabatan di sana yang masih bertahan hingga kini, termasuk istri tercinta saya.

String.Source:
[pagebreak]

Thirsk, a Revised History

[pagebreak]

n the bank of Lake Fjalding stands Thirsk, a grand mead hall that serves as the home and center of operations for a most valiant clan of Nord warriors. Long ago, a small group of Skaal decided to leave the main village, and free themselves of their brethren's strict adherence to nature worship. They sought to live life as their ancestors had in Skyrim -- free to kill what they wanted when they wanted, free to worship in any manner they chose. The group braved the harsh weather and traveled south toward Lake Fjalding, where they found the perfect location for a new settlement. There they decided to construct a grand mead hall that would serve as their new home and hunting lodge. After several months of building, the companions had completed the task, and named the mead hall Thirsk. The settlers looked upon all they had accomplished, and were truly proud of their accomplishment. But their happiness was short lived, and the settlers soon learned that not everyone celebrated the construction of Thirsk. As the mead hall was being erected, so too was the noise and commotion of construction disturbing an ancient creature that lay dormant under the ice. It was a tragic twist of irony, therefore, that as the last beam of the great hall was nailed in place, the slumbering beast did finally awaken. His ancient name was the Udyrfrykte, though the settlers knew him only as death. The Udyrfrykte came to the newly completed mead hall and wreaked vengeance upon those who had shattered the peace of his long, cold sleep. He killed without warning, without mercy, reducing the Thirsk Nords to half their number. It was the valiant sorcerer Eldrid Ice-Light who finally drove the beast back to his lair beneath the frozen lake, and used his magicka to seal the entrance with a great wall of ice. The horror was over, but the price was great. It took the settlers two months to fix the damage done by the Udyrfrykte, and with so many strong hands now gone, it was slow and tedious work. Finally, Thirsk stood tall and proud once more. But even though the settlers had worked together to construct the mead hall and drive away the threat of the Udyrfrykte, tensions quickly grew over who would serve as their leader. Most of the men considered Hrothmund the Red their de facto chieftain, as he was the strongest and most capable of the lot. But one warrior, Drengr Bronze-Helm, disagreed. He thought himself most capable to rule over Thirsk, and loudly voiced his opposition to Hrothmund. Knowing that conflict and discord would only serve to destroy the new life they had worked so hard to create, Hrothmund the Red exercised his only true option - he swung his great axe and beheaded Drengr Bronze-Helm where he stood. The Nords appreciated more than anything a warrior's prowess in battle, and Drengr's slaying proved to them that Hrothmund was indeed most worthy to be Thirsk's chieftain. So that the other Nords would never forget he had proven his right to lead, Hrothmund placed Drengr's head on a pedestal in the center of Thirsk's main hall, for all to see. And so began Thirsk's most time-honored tradition. Any warrior, regardless of race or sex, could claim leadership of the mead hall by displaying the most impressive battle trophy on the great hall's pedestal. So long as the spirit of Hrothmund the Red consented, that warrior would be named chieftain. [pagebreak] Hrothmund's Bane For twenty-one years Hrothmund the Red ruled over Thirsk and its residents as chieftain. With his soft voice and great axe, Hrothmund brought peace and prosperity to Thirsk. But peace proved to be Hrothmund's undoing, for the mighty Nord grew restless in the warmth and safety of the mead hall. He longed for battle and adventure, to feel the frost in his veins once more, and could ignore the call of valor no longer. When word spread of a giant, bloodthirsty white wolf terrorizing travelers in the Moesring Mountains, Hrothmund took up his great axe and set out to defeat the beast alone. The men of the mountains named him Ondjage, the Fell Wolf. The beast measured as large as an ox, with fur as white as new-fallen snow, and it was said no man or woman alive could bring Ondjage down. The words of the mountain folk proved true, for while Hrothmund did hew one leg from the Fell Wolf, Ondjage devoured the mighty Nord whole, leaving only his great axe as a grim reminder of man's failure against beast. Filled with sorrow and rage, the residents of Thirsk marched to the mountains in search of the wolf, called by them Hrothmund's Bane. Only together did they manage to slay Ondjage, and as family they feasted on his roasted flesh. [pagebreak] The following is a list of Thirsk's chieftains, since Hrothmund first ruled: Hrothmund the Red. Nord male. Slew Drengr Bronze-Helm and presented his head as a battle trophy. Ruled over Thirsk for twenty-one years. Slain and devoured by Ondjage, the Fell Wolf. Isgeror White-Wave. Nord female. Slew the necromancer Hildir Worm-Heart and presented his heart as a battle trophy. Ruled over Thirsk for four years. Einarr. Nord male. Slew the frost giant Guolog and presented his foot as a battle trophy. Ruled over Thirsk for six years. Gisl Round-Gut. Nord male. Slew Einarr and presented his sword as a battle trophy. Ruled over Thirsk for two months. Einarr the Younger. Nord male. Slew Gisl Round-Gut and presented his stomach as a battle trophy. Ruled over Thirsk for seven years. Grjotgaror. Nord male. Slew the white witch Katla and presented her staff as a battle trophy. Ruled over Thirsk for two years. Amelie Bontecou. Breton female. Slew Grjotgaror and presented his head as a battle trophy. Ruled over Thirsk for three years. Thorormr Storm-Killer. Nord male. Slew the brothers Ani and Ali and presented their enchanted hammers as battle trophies. Ruled over Thirsk for sixteen years. Aegilief. Nord Female. Slew Oddny the Unfaithful and presented her hand as a battle trophy. Ruled over Thirsk for eight years. Caccino Aurelia. Imperial male. Slew the Imperial hero Claudius Anzione and presented his sword as a battle trophy. Ruled over Thirsk for three weeks. Fraud. Eldjar Bear-Skinner. Nord male. Slew the Imperial fraud Caccino Aurelia and presented his tongue as a battle trophy. Ruled over Thirsk for five years. Falki the Fat. Nord male. Slew a pack of six rabid wolves and presented their claws as battle trophies. Ruled over Thirsk for three months. Succumbed to madness and death as a result of rabies. Svana the Knife. Nord female. Slew Gretta Wolf-Child and presented her sword as a battle trophy. Ruled over Thirsk for four years. Beinir White-Beard. Nord male. Slew three Orc raiders and presented their eyes as battle trophies. Ruled over Thirsk for twenty-two years. Skjoldr Wolf-Runner. Nord male. Slew the wizard Griss the Yellow and presented his head as a battle trophy. Ruled over Thirsk for three years. Slain in the mead hall. There is, here, a period of unrecorded histories. At some point, the Udyrfrykte was dealt with once and for all, but the leader of Thirsk in this time is unrecorded. There were, apparently, several other chieftains who came and went before the resumption of record. The Thirsk devotion to oral tradition means these names may forever be lost to history. Girgun the Colossus. Nord male. Slew Thjold the Ill-Minded and presented his brains as a battle trophy. Ruled over Thirsk for six years. Vibeke the Stone. Nord female. Slew seven Imperial pirates and presented their helmets as battle trophies. Ruled over Thirsk for three years. Hjarknir Green-Hand. Nord male. Slew an entire grove of Spriggans and presented their taproot hearts as battle trophies. Ruled Thirsk for twenty-seven years. Bujold the Intrepid. Nord female. Slew the great beast of Ilfark and presented its stomach as a battle trophy. Rules Thirsk as of this writing. [pagebreak] Expansion: The Thirsk mead hall is nearly the same today as it was at its founding, a testament to the quality of its construction. But while Thirsk itself did not grow, its inhabitants did, and before long the grand mead hall could not house all who wished to dwell within. So, over the years, many Nords have left Thirsk to establish their own private dwellings out in the wilderness of Solstheim, relying on the island's many caves and natural shelters. But those who left are always welcome back at Thirsk, and many return frequently to enjoy the mead hall's hospitalities. It is also important to note that although much time has passed since the group first left the Skaal village, the Skaal and Thirsk Nords have always remained civil to one another, and even trade resources on occasion. [pagebreak] Relationship with Raven Rock: The Thirsk Nords hold the same relations with Raven Rock that they once held with the Empire when its presence was more known on Solstheim: a deliberate disinterest and lack of complication. Both sides remain happy if they can plausibly believe the other doesn't exist. Which is not to say there is any cause for enmity; rather, there is simply no cause for fellowship among these two very differing cultures. [pagebreak] Law and Order Within Thirsk: Within the Mead Hall, the Chieftain serves as judge, jury and executioner if necessary. The reality is that Thirsk has always been a fairly peaceful place, with camaraderie and goodwill the norm. Solstheim can be a harsh home, and the Nords of Thirsk have long realized that fighting each other isn't nearly as productive as battling the island's bears, wolves, draugr, Rieklings, and whatever other fell creatures may roam the land. Still, there is the occasional disagreement - which more often than naught ends in bloodshed - and every few years someone gets it into his head to challenge the chieftain to a blood duel to try to gain possession of Thirsk. Generally speaking, the Nords of Thirsk are one big, happy barbarian-like family. And, like any family, they have their squabbles. [pagebreak] The Ashtimes: Since the eruption of the Red Mountain, the southern portion of Solstheim has been lost to waste and Dark Elf occupation. Thirsk sits just above the desolated area, though, and happily escaped the destruction that fell over much of the land. In the years since, Thirsk has taken its role as "haven" all the more seriously. They focus on hospitality, and on welcoming outsiders whether they seek respite from the southern ashlands or the northern chill.
String.Dest:
[pagebreak]

Thirsk, a Revised History

[pagebreak]

Di tepi Danau Fjalding berdiri Thirsk, sebuah balai bir raksasa yang berfungsi sebagai rumah dan pusat operasi bagi sekawan klan Nord yang paling gagah berani. Dahulu kala, sekelompok kecil Skaal memutuskan meninggalkan desa utama, dan membebaskan diri dari kepatuhan ketat saudara‑saudaranya terhadap penyembahan alam. Mereka ingin hidup sebagaimana nenek moyang mereka di Skyrim — bebas membunuh apa yang mereka mau kapan saja, bebas menyembah dengan cara apa pun yang mereka pilih. Kelompok itu menantang cuaca keras dan berangkat ke selatan menuju Danau Fjalding, di mana mereka menemukan lokasi sempurna untuk pemukiman baru. Di sana mereka memutuskan membangun sebuah balai bir megah yang akan menjadi rumah baru dan pondok perburuan mereka. Setelah beberapa bulan pembangunan, The Companions menyelesaikan tugas itu, dan menamai balai bir tersebut Thirsk. Para pemukim menatap semua yang telah mereka capai, dan sungguh bangga atas pencapaian itu. Namun kebahagiaan mereka tidak bertahan lama, dan pemukim segera menyadari tidak semua orang merayakan konstruksi Thirsk. Saat balai bir didirikan, suara dan keributan pembangunan mengganggu makhluk kuno yang terlelap di bawah es. Dengan ironis, ketika balok terakhir balai besar itu dipaku, makhluk yang sedang tidur itu akhirnya terbangun. Namanya yang kuno adalah Udyrfrykte, meskipun para pemukim mengenalnya hanya sebagai kematian. Udyrfrykte datang ke balai bir yang baru selesai dan membalas dendam kepada mereka yang telah memecahkan kedamaian tidur panjangnya yang dingin. Ia membunuh tanpa Warning, tanpa ampun, mengurangi jumlah Nords Thirsk menjadi setengahnya. Pahlawan berani Sorcerer Eldrid Ice-Light akhirnya mengusir makhluk itu kembali ke sarangnya di bawah danau beku, dan menggunakan magikanya untuk menutup pintu masuk dengan dinding es besar. Kengerian itu berakhir, tetapi harga yang dibayar mahal. Para pemukim membutuhkan dua bulan untuk memperbaiki kerusakan yang ditimbulkan Udyrfrykte, dan dengan begitu banyak tangan kuat yang hilang, pekerjaan itu menjadi Slow dan melelahkan. Akhirnya, Thirsk kembali berdiri tinggi dan bangga. Namun meskipun para pemukim bekerja bersama membangun balai bir dan mengusir ancaman Udyrfrykte, ketegangan dengan cepat muncul mengenai siapa yang akan menjadi pemimpin mereka. Kebanyakan pria menganggap Hrothmund the Red sebagai kepala suku de facto mereka, karena ia adalah yang terkuat dan paling mampu di antara mereka. Namun seorang pejuang, Drengr Bronze-Helm, tidak setuju. Ia menganggap dirinya paling layak memerintah Thirsk, dan dengan lantang menyuarakan penolakannya kepada Hrothmund. Menyadari bahwa konflik dan perselisihan hanya akan menghancurkan kehidupan baru yang telah mereka bangun dengan susah payah, Hrothmund the Red menggunakan satu-satunya pilihan sejatinya — ia mengayunkan kapak besarnya dan memenggal Drengr Bronze-Helm tepat di tempat ia berdiri. Para Nords sangat menghargai kehebatan pejuang dalam pertempuran, dan pembunuhan Drengr membuktikan kepada mereka bahwa Hrothmund memang paling layak menjadi kepala suku Thirsk. Agar Nords lain tidak pernah melupakan bahwa ia telah membuktikan haknya memimpin, Hrothmund menempatkan kepala Drengr di atas sebuah pedestal di tengah Main Hall Thirsk, untuk semua lihat. Dan demikian dimulainya tradisi paling terhormat Thirsk. Setiap pejuang, tanpa memandang ras atau jenis kelamin, dapat mengklaim kepemimpinan balai bir dengan menampilkan trofi pertempuran paling mengesankan di atas pedestal balai besar. Selama roh Hrothmund the Red menyetujui, pejuang itu akan dinamai kepala suku. [pagebreak] Hrothmund's Bane Selama dua puluh satu tahun, Hrothmund the Red memerintah Thirsk dan penduduknya sebagai kepala suku. Dengan suara lembut dan kapak besarnya, Hrothmund membawa kedamaian dan kemakmuran ke Thirsk. Namun kedamaian itu menjadi kebalikannya, karena Nord yang perkasa menjadi gelisah dalam kehangatan dan keamanan balai bir. Ia merindukan pertempuran dan petualangan, ingin merasakan beku mengalir dalam nadinya lagi, dan tak bisa lagi mengabaikan panggilan keberanian. Ketika kabar tentang serigala putih raksasa yang berdarah mengerikan menakuti para pelancong di Pegunungan Moesring menyebar, Hrothmund mengangkat kapak besarnya dan berangkat menaklukkan makhluk itu sendirian. Penduduk pegunungan menamainya Ondjage, Serigala Fell. Makhluk itu sebesar seekor lembu, dengan bulu seputih salju baru jatuh, dan konon tak ada pria atau wanita hidup yang dapat menundukkannya. Kata-kata penduduk gunung terbukti benar, karena ketika Hrothmund memotong satu kaki Serigala Fell, Ondjage melahap seluruh Nord yang perkasa itu, menyisakan hanya kapak besarnya sebagai pengingat suram akan kegagalan manusia melawan binatang. Dipenuhi duka dan amarah, penduduk Thirsk berbaris ke pegunungan mencari serigala yang mereka sebut Bane Hrothmund. Hanya bersama mereka berhasil menebas Ondjage, dan sebagai keluarga mereka memakan dagingnya yang dipanggang. [pagebreak] Berikut adalah daftar kepala suku Thirsk, sejak Hrothmund pertama kali memerintah: Hrothmund the Red. Nord laki-laki. Membunuh Drengr Bronze-Helm dan mempersembahkan kepalanya sebagai trofi pertempuran. Memerintah Thirsk selama dua puluh satu tahun. Dibunuh dan ditelan oleh Ondjage, Serigala Fell. Isgeror White-Wave. Nord perempuan. Membunuh Necromancer Hildir Worm-Heart dan mempersembahkan hatinya sebagai trofi pertempuran. Memerintah Thirsk selama empat tahun. Einarr. Nord laki-laki. Membunuh raksasa es Guolog dan mempersembahkan kakinya sebagai trofi pertempuran. Memerintah Thirsk selama enam tahun. Gisl Round-Gut. Nord laki-laki. Membunuh Einarr dan mempersembahkan pedangnya sebagai trofi pertempuran. Memerintah Thirsk selama dua bulan. Einarr the Younger. Nord laki-laki. Membunuh Gisl Round-Gut dan mempersembahkan perutnya sebagai trofi pertempuran. Memerintah Thirsk selama tujuh tahun. Grjotgaror. Nord laki-laki. Membunuh penyihir putih Katla dan mempersembahkan Staffnya sebagai trofi pertempuran. Memerintah Thirsk selama dua tahun. Amelie Bontecou. Breton perempuan.
